report_src: 哈萨克斯坦实行两院制的议会共和制政府，其立法机关由参议院和下院组成，其中参议院作为上院，每个州、共和国直辖市及首都各选出两名议员，另有15名议员由总统任命以体现民族多样性[1]；所有参议员任期6年，并采取滚动改选方式，每三年改选一半[1]。这种结构表明国家权力由民选代表和总统共同分配、制衡，体现了典型的议会共和制特征[1]。

question_en: When was activity theory created?
pos_context_en:
The activity theory, also known as the implicit theory of aging, normal theory of aging, and lay theory of aging, proposes that successful ageing occurs when older adults stay active and maintain social interactions. It takes the view that the aging process is delayed and the quality of life is enhanced when old people remain socially active. 
The activity theory rose in opposing response to the disengagement theory. The activity theory and the disengagement theory were the two major theories that outlined successful aging in the early 1960s. The theory was developed by Robert J. Havighurst in 1961. In 1964, Bernice Neugarten asserted that satisfaction in old age depended on active maintenance of personal relationships and endeavors.
neg_context_en: AT remained virtually unknown outside the Soviet Union until the mid-1980s, when it was picked up by Scandinavian researchers. The first international conference on activity theory was not held until 1986. The earliest non-Soviet paper cited by Nardi is a 1987 paper by Yrjö Engeström: "Learning by expanding". This resulted in a reformulation of AT. Kuutti notes that the term "activity theory" "can be used in two senses: referring to the original Soviet tradition or referring to the international, multi-voiced community applying the original ideas and developing them further."

The application of activity theory to information systems derives from the work of Bonnie Nardi and Kari Kuutti. Kuutti's work is addressed below. Nardi's approach is, briefly, as follows: Nardi (p. 6) described activity theory as "...a powerful and clarifying descriptive tool rather than a strongly predictive theory. The object of activity theory is to understand the unity of consciousness and activity...Activity theorists argue that consciousness is not a set of discrete disembodied cognitive acts (decision making, classification, remembering), and certainly it is not the brain; rather, consciousness is located in everyday practice: you are what you do." Nardi (p. 5) also argued that "activity theory proposes a strong notion of "mediation"—all human experience is shaped by the tools and sign systems we use." Nardi (p. 6) explained that "a basic tenet of activity theory is that a notion of consciousness is central to a depiction of activity. Vygotsky described consciousness as a phenomenon that unifies attention, intention, memory, reasoning, and speech..." and (p. 7) "Activity theory, with its emphasis on the importance of motive and consciousness—which belongs only to humans—sees people and things as fundamentally different. People are not reduced to 'nodes' or 'agents' in a system; 'information processing' is not seen as something to be modelled in the same way for people and machines."

After Vygotsky's foundational work on the individual's higher psychological functions and Leontiev's extension of these insights to collective activity systems, questions of diversity and dialogue between different traditions or perspectives became increasingly serious challenges, when, especially in the post-1990s, activity theory 'went international'. The work of Michael Cole and Yrjö Engeström in the 1970s and 1980s – mostly in parallel, but occasionally in collaboration – brought activity theory to a much wider audience of scholars in Scandinavia and North America. Once the lives and biographies of all the participants and the history of the wider community are taken into account, "multiple activity systems" need to be considered, positing, according to Engeström, the need for a "third generation" to ""develop conceptual tools to understand dialogue, multiple perspectives, and networks of interacting activity Systems"". This larger canvas of active individuals (and researchers) embedded in organizational, political, and discursive practices constitutes a tangible advantage of second- and third-generation CHAT over its earlier Vygotskian ancestor, which focused on mediated action in relative isolation Third generation activity theory is the application of "Activity Systems Analysis" (ASA) in developmental research where investigators take a participatory and interventionist role in the participants' activities and change their experiences. Engeström's now famous diagram, or "basic activity triangle", – (which adds rules/norms, intersubjective community relations, and division of labor, as well as multiple activity systems sharing an object) – has become the principal third generation model among the research community for analysing individuals and groups. Engeström summarizes the current state of CHAT with five principles:
Most often, learning technologists have used third-generation CHAT as a guiding theoretical framework to understand how technologies are adopted, adapted, and configured through use in complex social situations.

Action regulation theory (or Activity regulation theory) was jointly developed by Winfried Hacker. in the 1980s. The Theory serves as a basis for modelling working conditions. As a process model it has its roots in the Soviet psychological activity theory on the one side and on the other side it is based on the T.O.T.E. Model (Test-Operation-Test-Exit) from Miller, Galanter and Pribram.
The pursued approach of the Action-Regulation-Theory is the integration of cognitive, behaviourism and social science orientated conceptions. This integration then is used to make explanatory and modelling statements about work conditions. Hacker talks in this context about the holistic work activity, which is an essential criteria for personality development. Through the above described should the partialization of work activity and the Taylorism be overcome. As a cybernetic approach the ground idea of an action/ activity is the regulation.
Between the visible work activity and the non visible cognitive processes is a gap, which the Action-Regulation-Theory promise to close. Through a hierarchical-sequential structured model, action steps are supposed to be accurately captured and analysed.

Activity is preferable to inactivity because it facilitates well-being on multiple levels. Because of improved general health and prosperity in the older population, remaining active is more feasible now than when this theory was first proposed by Havighurst nearly six decades ago. The activity theory is applicable for a stable, post-industrial society, which offers its older members many opportunities for meaningful participation.Weakness: Some aging persons cannot maintain a middle-aged lifestyle, due to functional limitations, lack of income, or lack of a desire to do so. Many older adults lack the resources to maintain active roles in society. On the flip side, some elders may insist on continuing activities in late life that pose a danger to themselves and others, such as driving at night with low visual acuity or doing maintenance work to the house while climbing with severely arthritic knees. In doing so, they are denying their limitations and engaging in unsafe behaviors.

Routine activity theory is a sub-field of crime opportunity theory that focuses on situations of crimes. It was first proposed by Marcus Felson and Lawrence E. Cohen in their explanation of crime rate change in the United States 1947 - 1974. The theory has been extensively applied and has become one of the most cited theories in criminology. Unlike criminological theories of criminality, routine activity theory studies crime as an event, closely relates crime to its environment and emphasize its ecological process, thereby diverting academic attention away from mere offenders.

In his 1987 ""Learning by expanding"", Engeström offers a very detailed account of the diverse sources, philosophical and psychological, that inform activity theory. In subsequent years, however, a simplified picture has emerged from his and other researchers' work, namely the idea that (to date) there are three principal 'stages' or 'generations' of activity theory, or "cultural-historical activity theory (CHAT). Whilst the first generation built on Vygotsky's notion of mediated action, from the individual's perspective, and the second generation built on Leont'ev's notion of activity system, with emphasis on the collective, the third generation, which appeared in the mid-nineties, builds on the idea of multiple interacting activity systems focused on a partially shared object, and boundary-crossings between them.

The origins of activity theory can be traced to several sources, which have subsequently given rise to various complementary and intertwined strands of development. This account will focus on three of the most important of these strands. The first is associated with the Moscow Institute of Psychology and in particular the "troika" of young Russian researchers, Vygotsky, Leont'ev and Luria. Vygotsky founded cultural-historical psychology, a field that became the basis for modern AT; Leont'ev, one of the principal founders of activity theory, both developed and reacted against Vygotsky's work. Leont'ev's formulation of general activity theory is currently the most influential in post-Soviet developments in AT, which have largely been in social-scientific, organizational, and writing-studies rather than psychological research.

Activity theory is not grounded in any one area of field of research, but instead draws from several disciplines including psychology, behaviorism, and socio-cultural studies. Although activity theory originated in the social sciences, it is currently applied most frequently to social-scientific, organizational, and writing studies. Modeled as a triangle, activity theory considers how multiple factors (subject, object, mediating artifacts, rules, and division of labor) existing in an activity system (environment) interact to achieve an outcome. Central to activity theory is the concept of mediation. Human activities are driven by a need to achieve a certain outcome or goal. Typically this activity is mediated by artifacts which include tools, language, signs, and cultural norms. In "Textual Objects" Cheryl Geisler explains that texts are traditionally identified as meditational means to complete a task, though she offers that texts might also be identified as the motive in discourse communities in which text is valued as the outcome as opposed to the means of an outcome. Geisler notes that texts produced for meditational means are typically more private/personalized, whereas texts identified as objects are often written with a public motive. She does not argue, however, that texts should exist exclusively as one or the other, but rather she suggests that texts can function as both.
question_src: 活动理论是什么时候创建的？
pos_context_src:
活动理论，也称为衰老的隐式理论，衰老的正常理论以及衰老理论，提出，当老年人保持活跃并维持社会互动时，成功的衰老会发生。人们认为，老年人的衰老过程被延迟，当老年人保持社会活动时，生活质量会提高。 
活动理论在反对脱离接触理论的反应中加剧。活动理论和脱离接触理论是概述1960年代初成功衰老的两个主要理论。该理论是由罗伯特·J·哈维格斯特（Robert J.
neg_context_src: 直到1980年代中期，斯堪的纳维亚研究人员将其接收到1980年代中期，在苏联以外的几乎未知。第一次国际活动理论会议直到1986年才举行。纳尔迪（Nardi）引用的最早的非苏联论文是Yrjöengeström的1987年论文：“通过扩展学习”。这导致了AT的重新制定。库特蒂指出，“活动理论”一词“可以用两种感觉使用：指的是原始的苏联传统，或者指的是运用原始思想并进一步发展的国际，多声音社区。”

活动理论在信息系统中的应用源于邦妮·纳尔迪（Bonnie Nardi）和卡里·库蒂（Kari Kuutti）的工作。 Kuutti的工作如下所述。 Nardi's approach is, briefly, as follows: Nardi (p. 6) described activity theory as "...a powerful and clarifying descriptive tool rather than a strongly predictive theory. The object of activity theory is to understand the unity of consciousness and activity...Activity theorists argue that consciousness is not a set of discrete disembodied cognitive acts (decision making, classification, remembering), and certainly it is not the brain; rather, consciousness is located in everyday练习：你就是你做的。”纳尔迪（第5页）还认为，“活动理论提出了一个“调解”的强烈概念 - 所有人类经验都是由我们使用的工具和标志系统塑造的。”纳尔迪（第6页）解释说：“活动理论的基本原则是，意识的概念是对活动描绘的核心。维戈茨基将意识描述为一种统一关注，意图，记忆，推理和言语和言语和言语的现象……”和（第7页）“活动理论，强调了动机和意识的重要性 - 人类属于人类的重要性，而不是人类和人类的人，而不是人类和人类人的人类，人类属于人类和人的人类的重要性，人类是人类和人类的重要性。在系统中的“节点”或“代理”；“信息处理”不被视为对人和机器的建模。”

在Vygotsky关于个人更高的心理功能以及Leontiev将这些见解扩展到集体活动系统的基础工作之后，不同传统或观点之间的多样性和对话问题成为越来越严重的挑战，尤其是在1990年代后，尤其是在活动理论中，“国际化”。迈克尔·科尔（Michael Cole）和伊格·恩格斯特（Yrjöengestöm）在1970年代和1980年代的作品（主要是并行但偶尔合作）将活动理论带到了斯堪的纳维亚半岛和北美的学者。一旦考虑到所有参与者的生活和传记和更广泛的社区的历史，就需要考虑“多个活动系统”，根据Engeström的说法，“第三代”的需求是“开发”概念工具，以了解对话，多个观点，多个观点，以及互动活动系统的网络”。在组织，政治和话语实践中嵌入的活跃个人（和研究人员）的更大的画布构成了第二代和第三代聊天的明显优势，而不是先前的Vygotskian祖先，该祖先集中在相对隔离的第三代活动理论中的相对隔离活动中的介导的行动是“活动系统分析”（ASA）在发展中的参与者的应用程序和研究室的应用程序和介入的一员。 Engeström现在著名的图表或“基本活动三角”（（它增加了规则/规范，主体间社区关系，劳动力划分以及共享对象的多个活动系统）已成为研究社区中的主要第三代模型，用于分析个人和群体。 Engeström用五个原则总结了聊天的当前状态：最常见的是，学习技术人员使用第三代聊天作为指导理论框架来了解技术的方式 通过在复杂的社交场合中使用，适应和配置。

动作调节理论（或活动调节理论）由Winfried Hacker共同开发。在1980年代。该理论是建模工作条件的基础。作为过程模型，它源于一侧的苏联心理活动理论，另一侧是基于T.O.T.E.来自Miller，Galanter和Pribram的模型（测试操作测试）。
动作调节理论的追求方法是认知，行为主义和社会科学概念的整合。然后，该集成用于对工作条件进行解释和建模陈述。黑客在这种情况下谈论了整体工作活动，这是人格发展的基本标准。通过上述，应克服工作活动和泰勒主义的部分化。作为控制论方法，动作/活动的基础思想是调节。
在可见的工作活动和不可见的认知过程之间是一个差距，动作调节理论承诺要结束这一差距。通过分层序列的结构化模型，应准确捕获和分析动作步骤。

活动比无活动更可取，因为它促进了多个级别的幸福感。由于老年人群的一般健康和繁荣的改善，与Havighurst最初提出的近六十年前提出的这一理论相比，保持活跃是更可行的。活动理论适用于一个稳定的后工业社会，该社会为年长的成员提供了许多有意义参与的机会。努力：由于功能局限性，缺乏收入或缺乏这样做的欲望，有些衰老的人无法维持中年生活方式。许多老年人缺乏在社会中保持积极作用的资源。另一方面，一些长者可能会坚持在后期的持续活动，对自己和他人构成危险，例如夜间以低视力开车或在严重关节炎的膝盖上爬上屋子的同时向房屋进行维护工作。这样一来，他们否认自己的局限性并从事不安全的行为。
常规活动理论是犯罪机会理论的子场，侧重于犯罪情况。马库斯·费尔森（Marcus Felson）和劳伦斯·库恩（Lawrence E.与犯罪学理论不同，常规活动理论将犯罪视为事件，将犯罪与环境密切相关，并强调其生态过程，从而将学术关注转移到仅仅是罪犯中。

在他的1987年“通过扩展”“学习”中，Engeström非常详细地说明了哲学和心理学的各种来源，这是为活动理论带来的。然而，在随后的几年中，他和其他研究人员的作品已经出现了简化的画面，即（迄今为止）（迄今为止）有三个主要的“阶段”或“世代”或“世代”或“文化 - 历史活动理论（CHAT）。同时，第一代基于Vygotsky的行动，以及从个人角度构建的，以及第二代的行动。集体，第三代出现在九十年代中期，建立在多个相互作用的活动系统的想法上，这些活动系统集中在部分共享的对象上，以及它们之间的边界交叉。

活动理论的起源可以追溯到几种来源，这些来源随后引起了各种互补和交织在一起的发展链。该帐户将重点关注这些链中最重要的三个。第一个与莫斯科心理学研究所，尤其是俄罗斯年轻研究人员Vygotsky，Leont'ev和Luria的“三号”有关。 Vygotsky创立了文化历史心理学，该领域成为现代AT的基础；活动理论的主要创始人之一Leont'ev对Vygotsky的工作做出了反应。 Leont'ev的一般活动理论的表述目前是AT后苏联发展中最有影响力的，这些发展主要是在社会科学，组织和写作研究中而不是心理学研究中。

活动理论不是在任何一个研究领域的基础，而是从多个学科中汲取的，包括心理学，行为主义和社会文化研究。尽管活动理论起源于社会科学，但目前最频繁地应用于社会科学，组织和写作研究。活动理论以三角形为模型，考虑了活动系统（环境）（环境）中存在多种因素（主题，对象，介导，规则和分工）如何相互作用以实现结果。活动理论的核心是调解的概念。人类活动是由实现一定结果或目标的需求所驱动的。通常，此活动是由包括工具，语言，符号和文化规范的工件介导的。 Cheryl Geisler在“文本对象”中解释说，文本传统上被确定为完成任务的冥想手段，尽管她提出文本也可以被确定为话语社区中文本被视为结果而不是结果手段的话语社区中的动机。盖斯勒指出，为冥想手段制作的文本通常更为私人/个性化，而被标识为对象的文本通常是用公众动机编写的。但是，她并不认为文本应该仅作为一个或另一个文本存在，而是建议文本可以同时使用。
report_src: 活动理论由罗伯特·J·哈维格斯特等人在1960年代初提出，是当时与脱离接触理论并列用以阐释“成功衰老”的两大主要理论之一，因此通常认为其创建时间为20世纪60年代初期[1]。

question_en: Does the Dan Le Batard Show still air?
pos_context_en: Le Batard hosts a daily radio show with Jon "Stugotz" Weiner that originates from WAXY in Miami and is carried nationally on ESPN Radio. He also hosts "Highly Questionable", which airs daily on ESPN and was originally titled "Dan Le Batard is Highly Questionable"; Le Batard co-hosts the program with his father Gonzalo and revolving co-host. Additionally, he is a frequent contributor to several ESPN programs, serving as a regular replacement host for "Pardon the Interruption".
neg_context_title_en: The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz
The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz
The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz
The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz
neg_context_en: From its premiere until May 10, 2013, the show bore Le Batard's name and was called Dan Le Batard Is Highly Questionable ("DLHQ"), and from its premiere until March 23, 2015 the show aired on ESPN2. The program is based in Le Batard's hometown of Miami, Florida, and produced via satellite in Washington, D.C.. It was created by the same people behind "Pardon the Interruption" ("PTI"), which Le Batard has appeared on multiple times as a substitute host.

The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz is a sports talk radio show hosted by Dan Le Batard and Jon "Stugotz" Weiner and broadcast on WAXY AM 790 "The Ticket" in Miami, Florida, and on many ESPN Radio affiliates nationwide. The show is heard locally Monday through Friday from 9 AM to 1 PM ET and nationally on ESPN Radio and ESPNEWS from 10 AM to 1 PM (prior to April 2, 2018, the television simulcast was aired on ESPNU). The show features commentary on the day's sports news, perspective on other news stories, interviews with sports analysts and sports figures, as well as a generous blend of pop culture and listener interaction. The hosts are known for their self-deprecating humor, which carries over onto the show through running jokes. Le Batard and Stugotz interact throughout the show with executive producer Mike Ryan, show booker Allyson Turner, and fellow producers Roy Bellamy, Billy "Guillermo" Gil, and Chris "Fats and Info" Cote, collectively nicknamed the Shipping Container Filled with Frightened Refugees. The show commonly refers to themselves as a "marching band to nowhere" and a "flying saucer of BS"

Dan Le Batard was born in Jersey City, New Jersey. His Cuban exile parents, Gonzalo and Lourdes, moved the family to Central Islip, New York, before settling in Miramar, Florida. Dan's brother is Miami-based artist David Le Batard, professionally known as LEBO. Le Batard is also fluent in Spanish, which he learned through his parents' heritage. During the 2016 exhibition MLB game in Cuba, Le Batard talked on his radio show about how his family risked everything to come to the U.S. His surname is of French origin, meaning "the bastard". On September 13, 2018, Miami Herald reporter and Le Batard’s longtime friend Greg Cote published an article announcing that Dan had become engaged to his girlfriend of two years, Valerie Scheide.The article was published without the couple’s consent, which caused great embarrassment for Le Batard as he was on the air at the time the news broke.Dan and Valerie plan to marry in late 2019.

On the May 5, 2017, episode of "The Bill Simmons Podcast", hosted by Bill Simmons, a long time friend of Le Batard, Rapaport once again brought up the beef between him and the show. He repeatedly insulted Le Batard, Stugotz, and the show's producers saying they were only there to get his coffee. Simmons was uncomfortable for the entirety of Rapaport's rant against the show saying, “I still feel awkward because I like all those guys. I wish this would work out.”

Currently, Le Batard and Stugotz are joined on-air by Greg Cote of The Miami Herald on Tuesdays, and additional ESPN personalities (including Sarah Spain, Domonique Foxworth, Mina Kimes and others) make regular guest hosting appearances.

In September 2011, ESPN launched "Dan Le Batard Is ¿Highly Questionable?" (retitled "Highly Questionable" in 2013) on ESPN as part of the afternoon "Sports Talk Block." The show originally featured Le Batard and his father, Gonzalo, whom he calls "Papi." Bomani Jones later joined the show as a host in February 2013, accompanying Dan & "Papi" in discussing current sports news & event topics, and later leaving the show in June 2017 to go, and do other things for ESPN, including hosting High Noon with Pablo Torre.

Beginning in 2012, Jones appeared regularly on Dan Le Batard's ESPN2 show, "Dan Le Batard Is Highly Questionable", where he discussed major sports stories with Le Batard. Around the same time, he began guest hosting on "The Dan Le Batard Show with Stugotz" radio show on The Ticket Miami on Wednesdays. On May 9, 2013 it was reported that Jones had signed a new four-year contract with ESPN. In May 2013, Jones became co-host of the renamed "Highly Questionable", which would move to ESPN in March 2015. Jones remained on "Highly Questionable" until June 2017, when he left the show to prepare for a new project with fellow ESPN talent Pablo S. Torre.
After running for nine years on local radio, The Dan Le Batard Show debuted on ESPN Radio on September 30, 2013.

Le Batard is a frequent contributor to many programs on the ESPN television network. Among others, he is a recurring guest on "Outside the Lines", "The Sports Reporters", and "College GameDay". He is also a regular guest host of "Pardon the Interruption", where he has been christened "The Hateable Dan Le Batard" due to his sometimes controversial (and usually contrarian) opinions, as well as his unorthodox attire. Hosting duties on "PTI" have allowed Le Batard the implementation of the catch-phrase "Bam!", which he exclaims in various ways at the beginning of each show he guest hosts. Le Batard has a joking rivalry with former PTI stat boy Tony Reali.
question_src: Dan Le Batard表演仍在播出吗？
pos_context_src: Le Batard与Jon“ Stugotz” Weiner举办每日广播节目，该节目起源于迈阿密的Waxy，并在全国范围内在ESPN广播中进行。他还主持了“高度可疑”，该活动每天在ESPN上播出，最初名为“ Dan Le Batard非常值得怀疑”。 Le Batard与他的父亲Gonzalo共同主持该计划，并旋转共同主持人。此外，他是多个ESPN计划的经常贡献者，是“赦免中断”的常规替换主机。
neg_context_src: 从首映式到2013年5月10日，该节目以Le Batard的名字命名，被称为Dan Le Batard的名字非常值得怀疑（“ DLHQ”），从首映式到2015年3月23日，该节目在ESPN2上播出。该计划设在勒巴达德（Le Batard）的家乡佛罗里达州的迈阿密（Miami），并通过华盛顿特区的卫星生产。

与Stugotz一起的Dan Le Batard表演是由Dan Le Batard和Jon“ Stugotz” Weiner主持的体育脱口秀电台节目，并在佛罗里达州迈阿密的Waxy AM 790“ Ticket”上广播，以及全国许多ESPN广播电台分支机构。该节目在周一至周五上午9点至下午1点在本地听到，并在全国范围内在ESPN Radio和ESPNews上从上午10点到下午1点（2018年4月2日之前，电视模拟器在ESPNU上播出）。该节目以当天的体育新闻，对其他新闻报道的观点，体育分析师和体育人物的访谈以及流行文化和听众互动的慷慨融合。主持人以自嘲的幽默而闻名，该幽默通过笑话传播到演出中。 Le Batard和Stugotz在整个演出中与执行制片人Mike Ryan，Booker Allyson Turner以及制片人Roy Bellamy，Billy“ Guillermo” Gil以及Chris“ Fats and Infos” Cote互动，集体将富有恐惧难民的运输集装箱昵称为绰号。该节目通常称自己为“无处游行的乐队”和“ BS的飞碟”

Dan Le Batard出生于新泽西州泽西市。他的古巴流亡父母冈萨洛（Gonzalo）和卢尔德（Lourdes）在定居在佛罗里达州的米拉马尔（Miramar）之前，将家人搬到了纽约的中部。丹的兄弟是位于迈阿密的艺术家大卫·勒·巴塔德（David Le Batard），专业称为勒博（Lebo）。 Le Batard也很精通西班牙语，他通过父母的遗产学到了这一点。在2016年在古巴举行的美国职业棒球大联盟比赛中，勒巴达德（Le Batard）在广播展上谈到了他的家人如何冒险进入美国的一切风险，他的姓氏是法国血统，意思是“混蛋”。 2018年9月13日，迈阿密先驱报道和勒巴达德（Le Batard）的长期朋友格雷格·科特（Greg Cote）发表了一篇文章，宣布丹（Dan）已经与他的两年的女友Valerie Scheide订婚。未经这对夫妇的同意，这篇文章发表了，这夫妇的同意使Le Batard造成了极大的尴尬，这使Le Batard陷入了新闻Broke.dan Broke.dan和Valerie Planie and Mar Marry necy news and Mar Marry news news news news Broke.dan broke broke browne news news。

在2017年5月5日，由Le Batard的长期朋友Bill Simmons主持的“ Bill Simmons Podcast”一集，Rapaport再次提出了他和演出之间的牛肉。他一再侮辱勒·巴塔德（Le Batard），斯图戈兹（Stugotz），节目的制片人说他们只是在那里喝咖啡。西蒙斯（Simmons）对拉帕波特（Rapaport）对节目的全部咆哮感到不舒服，他说：“我仍然感到尴尬，因为我喜欢所有这些家伙。我希望这能奏效。”
目前，《迈阿密先驱报》的格雷格·科特（Greg Cote）在周二在空中加入了勒·巴塔德（Le Batard）和斯图戈兹（Stugotz），其他ESPN个性（包括Sarah Spain，Domonique Foxworth，Mina Kimes等人）定期举办客座托管。

2011年9月，ESPN推出了“ Dan Le Batard是高度可疑的？” （2013年重新定为“高度可疑”）在ESPN上，作为下午“体育谈话障碍”的一部分。该节目最初以Le Batard和他的父亲Gonzalo为特色，他称之为“ Papi”。 Bomani Jones随后于2013年2月作为主持人加入演出，并与Dan＆“ Papi”讨论了当前的体育新闻与活动主题，后来在2017年6月离开该节目，并为ESPN做其他事情，包括与Pablo Torre举办High Noon。

从2012年开始，琼斯定期出现在Dan Le Batard的ESPN2节目《 Dan Le Batard》中，他与Le Batard讨论了主要的体育故事。大约在同一时间，他开始在迈阿密门票上的“ Dan Le Batard Show一起与Stugotz的Dan Le Batard Show”举办。据报道，2013年5月9日，琼斯与ESPN签订了一份新的四年合同。 2013年5月，琼斯成为更名的“高度可疑”的共同主持人，该联合主持人将于2015年3月转移到ESPN。琼斯一直保持“高度可疑”，直到2017年6月，他离开演出，为与ESPN Talent Pablo S. Torre的新项目做准备。
在当地广播电台跑了9年后，Dan Le Batard Show将于2013年9月30日在ESPN广播电台首次亮相。

Le Batard经常为ESPN电视网络上的许多计划提供贡献。除其他外，他是“外界”，“体育记者”和“大学赛马”的反复出现的客人。他还是“赦免中断”的常客主持人，由于他有时引起争议（且通常是逆势）的意见以及他的非常规的服装，他被命名为“令人愉悦的Dan Le Batard”。在“ PTI”上负责职责允许Le Batard执行“ BAM！”的实施，他在每个演出开始时以各种方式大声疾呼。 Le Batard与前PTI Stat Boy Tony Reali开玩笑。
report_src: 是的，根据现有资料，Dan Le Batard与搭档Jon “Stugotz” Weiner的每日广播节目仍在ESPN Radio全国播出，而他与父亲Gonzalo共同主持的电视节目《Highly Questionable》（原名《Dan Le Batard Is Highly Questionable》）也依旧每天在ESPN播出[1]。

question_en: Is Pearl beer still in production?
pos_context_en:
In 1952, when the San Antonio Brewing Association changed its name to the Pearl Brewing Company, the triple Xs joined the Pearl name as a dominant image on the product and the company as a whole. The triple Xs were back on the company logo and were used on almost all of Pearl's advertisements. The Xs held this significant role to the end of production at the brewery in 2001, when the brewery closed its doors and the company logo was abandoned. As production of Pearl and Pearl Light spun up at Miller's Fort Worth facility, the product logos were redesigned. The updated label does not use the triple Xs, so a significant part of company identity has been virtually eliminated from the Pearl beers. However, Pearl's Country Club malt liquor still displays the XXXs in its logo.
Many people wonder where the Xs came from, and how were they ever used on beer. In truth, the three Xs are actually a quality rating system. The system was initially used in Europe during the 16th Century. As European royalty traveled their lands and visited neighboring counties, a royal courier was sent ahead of the official party. The courier's job was to sample beer at inns along the way. If the beer was only average, the courier would mark the inn's sign or door with a single X. If the inn's beer was deemed good, the sign or door would receive two Xs. A mark on an inn of three Xs meant that the beer inside was excellent, and a must-stop for the royal court as they passed through.
neg_context_en: The triple Xs were adopted by the San Antonio Brewing Association to portray two things: the high quality of their beers, and the pride that workers put into their products. The triple Xs may be gone from company and Pearl beer logos, but it has not completely vanished. In the 1960s, Pearl absorbed the Goetz Brewing Company and made Country Club Malt Liquor one of Pearl's key products. When Country Club received its only product makeover a few years after the buyout, it gained the triple Xs in its logo. The Xs were situated in the top-center of the logo's crown. Country Club is still produced today, and it still carries the “xXx” mark of Pearl.

In 1961, the Pearl Brewing Company officially purchased the M. K. Goetz Brewing Company. Overall, the merger of the two companies was a success. Beers from both companies began to be produced at the two facilities. Goetz brewed all of the Pearl beers for easier distribution in the north, and Pearl produced Goetz's Country Club malt liquor. Country Club proved very successful for Pearl, and in fact is the only Goetz beer still in production by Pabst today under the Pearl Brewing Company name. The merger was not without its problems, but overall the transition occurred smoothly. Pearl took over as the corporate headquarters and some duplicate jobs were eliminated. The production side of Goetz remained intact, with Pearl treating Goetz employees just as they did the employees in San Antonio, like family.

With the end of Prohibition, so too came the end of the Alamo Foods Company. The company went back to their prior name: San Antonio Brewing Association (1933–1952). Most believed beer production would quickly return to the levels before the 1920 ban. However, Pearl's hard times were not over yet. In 1933, the nation was still deep in the grips of the Great Depression. Although most of the public would have loved to enjoy a Pearl, the financial situation of most made buying beer an unaffordable luxury. Through her skillful management, Emma Koehler kept the brewery afloat through the Depression, selling beer to those who could afford it and continuing many of the business ventures that had carried the brewery through Prohibition.

The Pearl Brewing Company (also known as the Pearl Brewery or just Pearl) was an American brewery, established in 1883 in Downtown San Antonio, Texas, USA. In 1985, Pearl's parent company purchased the Pabst Brewing Company and assumed the Pabst name. In 1999, the Pabst Brewing Company began transferring its production to Miller Brewing, on a contract basis, and closing all of its breweries. Pearl beer is still in production at Miller's Ft. Worth, Texas facility, but the Pearl Brewery in San Antonio was closed in 2001. Since then, the former brewery was purchased by Silver Ventures, Inc., which has made the property the crown jewel in revitalization efforts of southern Midtown and northern Downtown San Antonio.

Through the 1940s, operations at Pearl continued at a steady pace. Pearl was well established as the largest brewer in Texas, even though Lone Star beers had adopted the slogan proclaiming Lone Star the national beer of Texas. Pearl, as a company, did its part in the war effort, reducing can production to save on metals and producing generic beer for the troops abroad. At the end of the war, Pearl reestablished its aggressive growth drive and shifted marketing to focus on the emerging power buyer, the postwar housewife.

Rather than building a second brewery and potentially putting the company at risk, Pearl decided to purchase an existing brewery to increase production and the distribution network. Overall, buying out another brewery meant a larger initial investment, but the new brewery would be able to put out Pearl beer almost immediately and therefore help recoup costs more quickly. From a short list of potentials, the M. K. Goetz Brewing Company in St. Joseph, Missouri, seemed the perfect fit for Pearl's plans. Goetz's historic brewery would allow increased production levels and the ability to use the well-established distribution network to help Pearl reach untapped markets. In addition, Pearl gained access to the Goetz line of beers, from pilsners to malt liquors.

When the ban on beer ended in 1933, the brewery quickly began the production of Pearl and Texas Pride beer once again. Along with their return, the triple Xs returned, as well. The Xs were absent from advertising and the company logo for 15 years after Prohibition, but they held a prominent status on every single bottle. In the late 1940s, the brewery launched an advertising campaign stating the brewery's beers were the “Three xXx of Texas.” The triple Xs took a renewed and increased role at the brewery, but their growth in prominence did not end there.

With the start of Prohibition, the triple Xs disappeared as the company was forced to transform itself to try to survive. The brewery produced a wide variety of bottled drinks during the beer-less time, including near beer and root beer. Other companies picked up on the use of Xs on their near or root beers, the most famous of which being Triple XXX Root Beer, but Pearl (at that time Alamo Industries/Foods) never used the Xs on any of their products. The Xs were gone from the brewery during Prohibition, but not forgotten.

Production and market-wise, the 1950s were similar to the late 1940s. In the early '50s, the San Antonio Brewing Association felt they needed to increase the association of their number one product, Pearl lager beer, with the company itself. In marketing research, the association found that most consumers believed the San Antonio Brewing Association encompassed more than a single brewery; in fact, the public thought San Antonio Brewing Association referred to all brewing in San Antonio in general. Therefore, in 1952 the San Antonio Brewing Association changed its name to the Pearl Brewing Company (1952–present).
question_src: 珍珠啤酒仍在生产中吗？
pos_context_src:
1952年，当圣安东尼奥酿造协会更名为珍珠酿造公司时，Triple XS加入了Pearl名称，作为产品和整个公司的主要图像。 Triple XS又回到了公司的徽标上，几乎被用于Pearl的所有广告。 XS在2001年在啤酒厂的生产结束时担任了这一重要角色，当时啤酒厂关闭了其门，公司徽标被放弃了。随着珍珠和珍珠光的生产在米勒堡的沃思堡设施中旋转，重新设计了产品徽标。更新的标签不使用Triple XS，因此从珍珠啤酒中消除了公司身份的很大一部分。但是，珍珠的乡村俱乐部麦芽酒仍在其徽标上显示XXXS。
许多人想知道XS来自哪里，以及他们如何在啤酒上使用。实际上，这三个XS实际上是一个质量评级系统。该系统最初在16世纪的欧洲使用。当欧洲皇室旅行并参观了邻近县时，皇家快递员被派往正式政党。快递员的工作是一路上在旅馆品尝啤酒。如果啤酒只有平均水平，快递员会用一个X标记旅馆的标志或门。如果客栈的啤酒被认为是好的，则标志或门将获得两个X。三个XS旅馆的标记意味着里面的啤酒非常好，在皇家法院经过时，必不可少的啤酒。
neg_context_src: 三重Xs被圣安东尼奥酿造协会采用，描绘了两件事：他们的高质量啤酒以及工人在产品中的骄傲。 Triple XS可能来自公司和珍珠啤酒徽标，但并未完全消失。在1960年代，珍珠吸收了Goetz Brewing Company，并使乡村俱乐部麦芽酒成为Pearl的主要产品之一。当乡村俱乐部在收购后几年收到其唯一的产品改造时，它在其徽标中获得了三重XS。 XS位于徽标皇冠的顶级中心。乡村俱乐部今天仍在生产，它仍然带有珍珠的“ XXX”标记。

1961年，这家珍珠酿造公司正式购买了M. K. Goetz Brewing Company。总体而言，两家公司的合并成功。两家公司的啤酒开始在这两个设施中生产。 Goetz酿造了所有的珍珠啤酒，以便于在北部更容易分发，Pearl生产了Goetz的乡村俱乐部麦芽酒。事实证明，乡村俱乐部在珍珠上非常成功，实际上是今天以Pearl Brewing Company名称为单位的Pabst生产的Goetz Beer。合并并非没有问题，但是总体上过渡会顺利进行。 Pearl接管了公司总部，并取消了一些重复的工作。 Goetz的生产方面仍然完好无损，Pearl像家人一样在圣安东尼奥（San Antonio）的员工中对待Goetz员工。

随着禁令的结束，阿拉莫食品公司的结束也是如此。该公司回到了他们的先前名称：圣安东尼奥酿酒协会（1933- 1952年）。大多数人认为，在1920年禁令之前，啤酒生产将很快恢复到水平。但是，珍珠的艰难时期还没有结束。 1933年，该国仍在大萧条的掌握之中。尽管大多数公众都希望享受珍珠，但大多数使购买啤酒的财务状况是无法承受的奢侈品。通过熟练的管理，艾玛·科勒（Emma Koehler）将啤酒厂维持在大萧条中，向那些负担得起的啤酒出售啤酒，并继续通过禁止携带啤酒厂的许多商业企业。

珍珠酿造公司（也称为Pearl Brewery或Just Pearl）是一家美国啤酒厂，成立于1883年在美国德克萨斯州圣安东尼奥市中心成立。 1985年，Pearl的母公司购买了PABST酿造公司，并以PABST名称购买。 1999年，PABST酿造公司开始将其生产转移到合同的基础上，并关闭其所有啤酒厂。珍珠啤酒仍在米勒（Miller）的FT生产。沃思，得克萨斯州的设施，但圣安东尼奥的珍珠啤酒厂于2001年关闭。从那以后，这家啤酒厂被Silver Ventures，Inc。购买，该公司使该物业成为皇冠上的珠宝，从而在中城南部和北部圣安东尼奥市的振兴工作中获得了冠军。
到1940年代，Pearl的运营继续稳定。珍珠是德克萨斯州最大的酿酒师，尽管孤星啤酒已经采用了标语，宣称孤星是德克萨斯州的国家啤酒。作为一家公司，珍珠在战争努力中发挥了作用，减少罐头生产以节省金属并为国外部队生产仿制药。战争结束时，珍珠重新建立了其积极的增长动力，并转移了营销，重点关注新兴的权力买家战后家庭主妇。

Pearl并没有建立第二家啤酒厂并可能使公司处于危险之中，而是决定购买现有的啤酒厂来增加生产和分销网络。总体而言，购买另一个啤酒厂意味着更大的初始投资，但是新的啤酒厂将能够立即发放珍珠啤酒，因此有助于更快地收回成本。从短暂的潜力清单中，位于密苏里州圣约瑟夫的M. K. Goetz Brewing Company似乎是Pearl的计划非常适合。 Goetz的历史悠久的啤酒厂将允许提高生产水平，并具有使用良好的分销网络来帮助珍珠到达未开发的市场的能力。此外，珍珠还可以进入Goetz啤酒生产线，从皮尔斯纳（Pilsners）到麦芽酒。
当啤酒的禁令于1933年结束时，啤酒厂迅速开始生产珍珠和德克萨斯州的骄傲啤酒。随着他们的回归，三重X也返回。禁止后15年中，Xs没有广告和公司徽标，但他们在每个瓶子上都具有突出的地位。在1940年代后期，啤酒厂发起了一项广告活动，称啤酒厂的啤酒是“德克萨斯州的三xxx”。 Triple Xs在啤酒厂发挥了重新发挥作用，但其突出性的增长并没有结束。
随着禁令的开始，当公司被迫改变自己以生存时，三重XS消失了。在无啤酒的时间里，啤酒厂生产了各种各样的瓶装饮料，包括附近的啤酒和生啤酒。其他公司在其近或根啤酒上使用XS，其中最著名的是三重XXX啤酒，但是Pearl（当时Alamo Industries/Foods）从未在其任何产品上使用过XS。 XS在禁令期间从啤酒厂走了，但没有被遗忘。
生产和市场上，1950年代与1940年代后期相似。在50年代初期，圣安东尼奥酿造协会认为，他们需要将其第一产品Pearl Lager Beer与公司本身的关联增加。在市场研究中，该协会发现，大多数消费者认为圣安东尼奥酿造协会所包含的不仅仅是一家啤酒厂。实际上，公众认为圣安东尼奥酿造协会是指圣安东尼奥的所有酿造。因此，在1952年，圣安东尼奥酿酒协会更名为珍珠酿造公司（1952年至今）。
report_src: 是的，珍珠啤酒在圣安东尼奥啤酒厂于2001年停产并关闭后，并未就此消失，而是将“珍珠”和“珍珠光”的生产转移到米勒旗下位于得克萨斯州沃思堡的生产设施继续酿造，因此目前仍在生产，只是地点和品牌形象有所调整[1]。

question_en: Does Shantou University have a graduate program?
pos_context_en: Under the auspice of the Li Ka Shing Foundation, STU has become one of the few universities in Mainland China that awards full scholarships to overseas exchange students. The university has established close academic ties with nearly 20 universities in such countries as the United States, United Kingdom, France, Japan, Russia, Australia and Germany, and launched exchange programs for undergraduates and graduate students.
neg_context_en: STU, a key comprehensive university under the provincial Project 211 program, was founded in 1981 with the approval of the State Council. As the only public university that receives long-term funding from the Li Ka Shing Foundation, it is jointly supported by the Ministry of Education, the Guangdong Provincial Government and the Li Ka Shing Foundation. The Li Ka Shing Foundation has committed and donated a total of HK$5.4 billion to support Shantou University (including the Cheung Kong Graduate School of Business), of which HK$4.2 billion has already been donated as of 2012.

Shantou University has 1 National Key Discipline, offers Cheung Kong Scholar Professorships, provides 3 Postdoctoral Programs, 1 Doctoral Program for first-level discipline and 25 Doctoral Programs for second-level disciplines, 10 Master’s Programs for first-level disciplines and 84 Master’s Programs for second-level disciplines, as well as 6 Professional master's degree Programs. It also has 1 National Key Laboratory and 5 Provincial Key Laboratories, 2 National Pilot Sites for Innovative Talents Training, 7 National Distinctive Programs, as well as 4 Provincial Branded Programs. The University now offers a comprehensive education system from bachelor to doctorate programs, including a 7-year master program in Clinical Medicine. Currently, STU has a staff of 5,113 and over 9,450 students and has nurtured nearly 70,000 graduates. The University consists of ten colleges and schools, namely, College of Liberal Arts, College of Sciences, College of Engineering, Medical College, Law School, Business School, Cheung Kong School of Art and Design, Cheung Kong School of Journalism and Communication, Graduate School, School of Continuing Education and Veritas College. It enrolls qualified students from all over the country (including Special Administrative Regions of Hong Kong and Macau, as well as Taiwan). STU has established centers and laboratories, which conduct basic scientific research and directly serve local economic development, including the Artificial Intelligence Manufacturing Technology Laboratory funded by the Ministry of Education, STU Division of National Key Discipline in Molecular Pathology, Research Institute of Tumor Pathology, Marine Biology Laboratory of Guangdong Province, Image-processing Technology Key Laboratory of Guangdong Province, CAD/CAM Center, Laboratory for Wind Tunnel Testing, Laboratory for Structural Engineering, FMS Laboratory and Institute for Artificial Intelligence and Pattern Recognition.

Shantou University (; abbreviated STU), a key comprehensive university under the provincial Project 211 program in Guangdong, was founded in 1981 with the approval of the State Council. It is the only public university that receives funding from the Li Ka Shing Foundation. It is also supported by the Ministry of Education (MOE), the Guangdong Provincial Government and the Li Ka Shing Foundation. STU is located in Shantou, a city in Southeast China.

The English Language Center (ELC) was founded in 2003. The ELC provides English training for all students at Shantou University's main campus. The core of its program consists of a two-year series of required courses. The ELC also offers elective courses which are aimed at more specialized skills (debate, speech, academic writing, etc.). The ELC organizes many co-curricular activities.

In 2002, STU implemented a credit system similar to those that have been proved successful for universities in developed countries, which provides students greater opportunities to choose a wider range of elective courses. This reform will provide STI students with more freedom in selecting courses and may lead to the establishment of a new interdisciplinary curriculum.
In May 2002, the English Language Center (ELC) was set up and the “English Enhancement Program” was initiated to reform English language teaching designed for university-wide students who would like to pass CET.The objective of the program is to make the students better at communication, critical thinking and innovation with the use of English. The measure is to teach the students how to think and communicate in English through teaching and learning exchanges, and help the students develop their skills in speaking, listening, reading and writing, etc. by organizing extra-curricular activities involving the use of English.

With the reference to Columbia University’s and University of Missouri’s programs, the School develops a “fundamental but practical” curriculum, with international and practice-oriented features. It adopts the worldwide used curriculum system of “Platform Module” and offers small-group classes, English-immersed, and bilingual courses. It is also developing a four-year discipline in Journalistic English. The Pulitzer Prize-winning journalist Peter Arnett has taught at the school since 2007.

Based on the international approach of education called PLEASE (Professor, Language, Edited textbook, Activities, Disciplines and Employment), the School adopts bilingual and English immersed teaching modes for various programs including Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR), which received the accreditation of the Hong Kong International Administration Centre. The curriculum for the program of Public Administration is designed to help develop professionals for international public administration projects.

In 2012, the programs of Chemistry and Clinical Medicine are listed in the global top 1% of programs based on ESI（Essential Science Indicators）data, fully demonstrating the favorable results of the “211 Project”.

STU continued to promote its work concerning international accreditation for its undergraduate programs. In 2011, the Business School’s BBA (Bachelor of Business Administration) program was granted EFMD Programme Accreditation System (EPAS) accreditation, the first university in Asia to pass this kind of accreditation.
question_src: Shantou University有研究生课程吗？
pos_context_src: 在Li Ka Shing基金会的主持下，Stu已成为中国大陆大学为海外交换学生提供全额奖学金的少数大学之一。该大学已经在美国，英国，法国，日本，俄罗斯，澳大利亚和德国等国家建立了与近20所大学的近20所大学，并为本科生和研究生启动了交流计划。
neg_context_src: Stu是省级项目211计划的重要综合大学，于1981年在国务院批准下成立。作为唯一获得Li Ka Shing基金会长期资助的公立大学，它得到了教育部，广东省政府和Li Ka Shing Foundation的共同支持。 Li Ka Shing基金会已承诺并捐赠了54亿港元，以支持Shantou University（包括Choong Kong商学院），截至2012年，已经捐赠了42亿港元。

Shantou University拥有1个国家关键学科，提供张教学者教授职位，提供3个博士后课程，1个用于第一级学科的博士课程和25个用于第二级学科的博士课程，10个针对第一级学科的硕士课程和84个针对第二级硕士课程的第二级硕士课程，用于第二级专业的硕士课程，以及6个专业的硕士课程。它还拥有1个国家主要实验室和5个省级主要实验室，2个国家创新人才培训的试点站点，7个国家独特计划以及4个省级品牌计划。该大学现在提供了从学士学位到博士学位课程的全面教育系统，包括一项为期7年的临床医学硕士课程。目前，Stu的工作人员为5,113和9,450多名学生，并培养了近70,000名毕业生。该大学由十所学院和学校组成，分别是文科学院，科学学院，工程学院，医学院，法学院，商学院，张教艺术与设计学院，张孔孔新闻学与传播学院，研究生院，毕业生学校，继续教育和维丽塔斯学院。它招募了来自全国各地的合格学生（包括香港和澳门的特殊行政区，以及台湾）。 STU建立了中心和实验室，这些中心和实验室进行了基础科学研究并直接服务于地方经济发展，包括由教育部资助的人工智能制造技术实验室，肿瘤病理学国家关键学科的Stu部门，肿瘤病理学研究所，Guangdong的海洋生物学实验室，用于Image Proviness的海洋生物学实验室。对于结构工程，FMS实验室和人工智能和模式识别研究所。
Shantou University（;缩写的Stu）是广东省211计划的重要综合大学，于1981年在国务院的批准下成立。它是唯一一所从李卡·夏基（Li Ka Shing Foundation）获得资金的公立大学。它也得到了教育部（MOE），广东省政府和李卡·夏德（Li Ka Shing Foundation）的支持。 Stu位于中国东南部的城市Shantou。
英语中心（ELC）成立于2003年。ELC为Shantou University主校园的所有学生提供英语培训。其计划的核心包括一系列两年的必需课程。 ELC还提供针对更专业技能（辩论，言语，学术写作等）的选修课程。 ELC组织了许多课外活动。

在2002年，STU实施了一种与已被证明是在发达国大学成功成功的信用系统，该信用系统为学生提供了更大的机会选择更广泛的选修课程。这项改革将为STI学生提供更多选择课程的自由，并可能导致建立新的跨学科课程。
2002年5月，成立了英语中心（ELC），并开始启动“英语增强计划”，以改革专为想通过CET的大学学生而设计的英语教学。该计划的目的是通过使用英语来使学生在交流，批判性思维和创新方面更好。该措施是通过教学交流来教学生如何用英语思考和交流，并通过组织涉及使用英语的课外活动来帮助学生发展他们的讲话，听力，阅读和写作等技能。
在提到哥伦比亚大学和密苏里大学的课程时，学校开发了一个“基本但实用”的课程，具有国际和以实践为导向的功能。它采用了“平台模块”的全球使用课程系统，并提供小组课程，英语摄影和双语课程。它还以新闻英语开发了四年的纪律。自2007年以来，普利策奖获得者彼得·阿内特（Peter Arnett）在学校任教。
基于“请求的国际教育方法”（教授，语言，编辑教科书，活动，学科和就业），学校采用双语和英语沉浸于各种计划的教学模式，包括替代争议解决（ADR），该计划获得了香港国际管理中心的认证。公共管理计划的课程旨在帮助开发国际公共行政项目的专业人员。
2012年，基于ESI（基本科学指标的全球最高计划中列出了化学和临床医学计划），充分证明了“ 211项目”的有利结果。
Stu继续促进其有关其本科课程国际认证的工作。 2011年，商学院的BBA（工商管理学士学位）计划获得了EFMD计划认证系统（EPAS）认证，这是亚洲第一所获得此类认证的大学。
report_src: 是的，汕头大学设有研究生层次的课程与项目；学校不仅为本科生，也为研究生启动了国际交流计划，这表明其具备并运行研究生教育体系 [1]。

question_en: Can you cut a nerve fiber?
pos_context_en: Surgery can be done in case a nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. Recovery of a nerve after surgical repair depends mainly on the age of the patient. Young children can recover close-to-normal nerve function. In contrast, a patient over 60 years old with a cut nerve in the hand would expect to recover only protective sensation, that is, the ability to distinguish hot/cold or sharp/dull. Many other factors also affect nerve recovery. The use of autologous nerve grafting procedures that involve redirection of regenerative donor nerve fibers into the graft conduit has been successful in restoring target muscle function. Localized delivery of soluble neurotrophic factors may help promote the rate of axon regeneration observed within these graft conduits.
neg_context_en: A neurolytic block is a form of nerve block involving the deliberate injury of a nerve by freezing or heating ("neurotomy") or the application of chemicals ("neurolysis"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary (a few months, usually) interference with the transmission of nerve signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgical cutting of a nerve (neurectomy), severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical block.

A neurolytic block is the deliberate injury of a nerve by the application of chemicals (in which case the procedure is called "neurolysis") or physical agents such as freezing or heating ("neurotomy"). These interventions cause degeneration of the nerve's fibers and temporary interference with the transmission of pain signals. In these procedures, the thin protective layer around the nerve fiber, the basal lamina, is preserved so that, as a damaged fiber regrows, it travels within its basal lamina tube and connects with the correct loose end, and function may be restored. Surgically cutting a nerve severs these basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is preferred over the surgical block.

Epineurial repair is a common surgical procedure to repair a nerve laceration via the epineurium, the connective tissue surrounding nerve fibers originating from the spinal cord. It is intended to allow the restoration of sensory function. When a nerve is lacerated or cut, repair is done by sewing the cut ends together through the epineurium to increase the potential of the proximal part growing correctly along the route the degrading distal part leaves behind. Usual sensation and mobility will not be an immediate result because nerves grow at a rate of approximately 1 millimeter per day, so it will take a few months to notice the final outcome. Research in use of nerve grafts and nerve growth factors is being done to speed recovery time.

With this discovery, the team set out to perform nerve transfer surgery specifically aimed to reinnervate sensory feedback. A piece of skin near or over the targeted muscle was denervated, thus the afferent nerve fibers were allowed to reinnervate the skin.
In a case of a woman patient with left arm amputation at the humeral neck, the supraclavicular sensory nerve was cut, the proximal end was ligated to prevent regeneration and reinnervation, and the distal end was coapted end-to-side to the ulnar nerve. The intercostobrachial cutaneous nerve was treated with the same method, with the distal end coapted to the median nerve.

Surgery can be done in case a peripheral nerve has become cut or otherwise divided. This is called peripheral nerve reconstruction. The injured nerve is identified and exposed so that normal nerve tissue can be examined above and below the level of injury, usually with magnification, using either loupes or an operating microscope. If a large segment of nerve is harmed, as can happen in a crush or stretch injury, the nerve will need to be exposed over a larger area. Injured portions of the nerve are removed. The cut nerve endings are then carefully reapproximated using very small sutures. The nerve repair must be covered by healthy tissue, which can be as simple as closing the skin or it can require moving skin or muscle to provide healthy padded coverage over the nerve. The type of anesthesia used depends on the complexity of the injury. A surgical tourniquet is almost always used.

Neurectomy is a surgical procedure in which a nerve or section of a nerve is severed or removed. Cutting a sensory nerve severs its basal lamina tubes, and without them to channel the regrowing fibers to their lost connections, over time a painful neuroma or deafferentation pain may develop. This is why the neurolytic is usually preferred over the surgical sensory nerve block. This surgery is performed in rare cases of severe chronic pain where no other treatments have been successful, and for other conditions such as involuntary twitching and excessive blushing or sweating.

Neurectomy involves cutting a nerve, and is (rarely) used in patients with short life expectancy who are unsuitable for drug therapy due to ineffectiveness or intolerance. The dorsal root or dorsal root ganglion (that carry mostly sensory signals) may be usefully targeted (called rhizotomy); with the dorsal root ganglion possibly the more effective target because some sensory fibers enter the spinal cord from the dorsal root ganglion via the "ventral" (motor) root, and these would not be interrupted by dorsal root neurectomy. Because nerves often carry both sensory and motor fibers, motor impairment is a possible side effect of neurectomy. A common result of this procedure is "deafferentation pain" where, 6–9 months after surgery, pain returns at greater intensity.

After the sensory nerves are exposed, each sensory nerve root is divided into 3-5 rootlets. Each rootlet is tested with electromyography, which records electrical patterns in muscles. Rootlets are ranked from 1 (mild) to 4 (severe) for spasticity. The severely abnormal rootlets are cut. This technique is repeated for rootlets between spinal nerves L2 and S2. Half of the L1 dorsal root fibers are cut without EMG testing.

Ephaptic transmission is when two nerves communicate with each other via an artificial synapse between nerves. Healthy peripheral nerves are insulated with a myelin sheath that helps to both enhance electric transmission and to prevent cross-talk between parallel nerves. After a lesion, it has been observed that regenerating nerves might not be myelinated effectively. Consequently, the two nerve fibers can come into contact and provide a means for an impulse to be directly conducted through the nerve membrane. An analogy for this is having two uninsulated electrical wires placed adjacent to each other. Thus, the two nerves are able to “cross-talk” and send action potentials in both directions.
question_src: 你可以切神经纤维吗？
pos_context_src: 可以进行手术，以防神经已被切割或分裂。手术修复后神经的恢复主要取决于患者的年龄。幼儿可以恢复接近正常的神经功能。相比之下，一名60岁以上的患者手中有神经切开的患者只会恢复保护性感觉，即区分热/冷或尖锐/钝的能力。许多其他因素也会影响神经恢复。自体神经嫁接程序的使用涉及将再生供体神经纤维重定向到移植导管中已成功地恢复目标肌肉功能。可溶性神经营养因子的局部递送可能有助于促进这些移植管中观察到的轴突再生速率。
neg_context_src: 神经溶液阻滞是神经阻滞的一种形式，涉及通过冷冻或加热（“神经切开术”）或化学物质的应用（“神经解释”）故意损伤神经。这些干预措施会导致神经纤维的变性和临时（通常几个月）干扰神经信号的传播。在这些过程中，保留了神经纤维周围的薄保护层，以使其基底薄片保留，以便作为损坏的纤维再生，它在其基底层层管中行驶，并与正确的松散末端连接，并且可以恢复功能。神经（神经切除术）的手术切割，切断这些基底层层管，而没有它们将重生纤维引导到失去的连接，随着时间的流逝，可能会出现疼痛的神经瘤或脱落疼痛。这就是为什么神经溶液通常优先于手术块的原因。

神经溶液阻滞是通过应用化学物质（在这种情况下称为“神经溶解”）或诸如冻结或加热等物理剂（“神经切开术”）的蓄意损害神经的故意伤害。这些干预措施会导致神经纤维的变性，并暂时干扰疼痛信号的传播。在这些过程中，保留了神经纤维周围的薄保护层，以使其基底薄片保留，以便作为损坏的纤维再生，它在其基底层层管中行驶，并与正确的松散末端连接，并且可以恢复功能。通过手术切割神经会切断这些基础层层管，而没有它们将重生纤维引导到失去的连接，可能会出现疼痛的神经瘤或脱发疼痛。这就是为什么神经溶液优先于手术块的原因。

肾上腺尿修复是通过骨纤维周围神经组织修复神经裂伤的常见手术程序，该组织由脊髓周围的神经纤维周围的结缔组织。它旨在允许恢复感觉函数。当神经被撕裂或切割时，通过将切割末端缝在一起，通过epineurium将切割末端缝在一起，以增加沿着路线正确生长的近端零件的潜力。通常的感觉和流动性不会成为直接的结果，因为神经每天以大约1毫米的速度生长，因此注意到最终结果将需要几个月的时间。在使用神经移植物和神经生长因子方面的研究正在进行速度恢复时间。

通过这一发现，团队着手进行专门旨在重新弥补感官反馈的神经转移手术。附近或靶向肌肉的一块皮肤被取消，因此允许传入的神经纤维重新染色皮肤。
如果是肱骨颈左臂截肢的女性患者，切割上锁骨上的感觉神经，近端末端被绑扎以防止再生和加重，远端端到端到尺神经。用相同的方法处理术间皮肤神经，远端凝结至中间神经。

可以进行手术，以防外周神经已被切割或以其他方式分裂。这称为周围神经重建。鉴定并暴露了受伤的神经，以便可以使用大腿或手术显微镜在损伤水平上方和低于损伤水平上检查正常的神经组织。如果在粉碎或伸展损伤中会损害大部分神经，则需要在更大的区域暴露神经。神经的受伤部分被移除。然后，使用非常小的缝合线仔细地重新将切割的神经末端重新置换。神经修复必须被健康的组织覆盖，这可以像闭合皮肤一样简单，或者需要运动或肌肉移动的皮肤或肌肉才能在神经上提供健康的衬托覆盖范围。使用的麻醉类型取决于损伤的复杂性。几乎总是使用手术止血带。
神经切除术是一种外科手术，其中神经的神经或部分被切断或切除。切割感觉神经会切断其基底层层管，而没有它们将重生纤维引导到失去的连接上，随着时间的流逝，可能会出现疼痛的神经瘤或脱发疼痛。这就是为什么神经溶解度通常比手术感觉神经阻滞优先的原因。该手术是在罕见的严重慢性疼痛病例中进行的，在没有其他治疗成功的情况下，以及其他情况，例如非自愿抽搐和过度脸红或出汗。

神经切除术涉及切割神经，并且（很少）用于预期寿命短的患者，这些患者由于无效或不宽容而不适合药物治疗。可以将背根或背根神经节（主要携带感官信号）有效地靶向（称为根茎切开术）；在背根神经节的情况下，可能是更有效的靶标，因为某些感觉纤维通过“腹侧”（运动）根从背根神经节进入脊髓，而这些感觉纤维不会被背根神经切除术所中断。由于神经通常同时带有感觉纤维，因此运动障碍是神经切除术的可能副作用。该程序的常见结果是“脱落疼痛”，在手术后6-9个月，疼痛的强度更大。
感觉神经暴露后，每个感觉神经根都分为3-5个根。用肌电图测试了每个根部，该肌电记录肌肉中的电模式。茎的排名从1（轻度）到4（重度）以进行痉挛。切割严重异常的根。对于脊柱神经L2和S2之间的根，重复了此技术。一半的L1背根纤维在没有EMG测试的情况下切割。
当两个神经通过神经之间的人造突触相互交流时，才会传播。健康的外周神经是用髓鞘鞘绝缘的，有助于增强电动传播并防止平行神经之间的串扰。病变后，已经观察到，再生神经可能不会有效地骨髓。因此，两种神经纤维可以接触，并提供一种直接通过神经膜进行冲动的方法。对此的类比是将两条未绝缘的电线彼此相邻。因此，两条神经能够“串扰”并在两个方向上发送动作电位。
report_src: 从外科技术角度看，神经纤维确实能够被切开，但一旦发生切割，就需要立即通过显微手术修复，否则会显著影响功能恢复[1]；即使成功修复，预后也与年龄密切相关——幼儿往往可恢复接近正常的神经功能，而60 岁以上患者通常只能恢复区分冷热或尖钝的保护性感觉[1]。为了提高恢复效果，医生可采用自体神经嫁接，把可再生的供体神经纤维导入移植导管，以促进目标肌肉重新获得功能[1]；此外，局部递送可溶性神经营养因子有助于加快轴突在移植管中的再生速率[1]。因此，虽然“可以”切断神经纤维，但除非出于肿瘤切除或畸形矫正等必要医学目的，否则不建议随意切割；若必须切除，应及时进行显微修复并遵医嘱康复，以最大化功能恢复。

question_en: How large is the Sanjay Gandhi National Park?
pos_context_en: The park was further expanded to a total area of 82.25 square km in 1981. The park was renamed Sanjay Gandhi National Park in 1996, after Sanjay Gandhi, the son of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. The same year, some forests from the Thane division were merged into the park, further expanding its total area to 103.84 square km.
neg_context_en: The "karvi" shrub, as it is locally called in the Marathi language, sometimes also spelled as "karvy" in English, only blooms once in eight years in a mass flowering covering the forest floor in a lavender blush. It grows in abundance in the Western Ghats hills near Mumbai including throughout the Sanjay Gandhi National Park as in other parts of its natural range. In Sanjay Gandhi National Park its latest blooming took place in 2008, and it is scheduled to bloom here again in 2016. Termed by nature enthusiasts as 'nature's miracle' its maximum bloom can be seen on some of the inner paths and trails that lie undisturbed in the park. It survives best on the vast sloping expanses of the hillsides, with the Kanheri caves area of the park being one of the best places to observe large areas of blooms.

Parts of the article referred to from the Times of India article dated 5 July 2004
Kasambe, R. (2012): Butterfly fauna of the Sanjay Gandhi National Park and Mumbai. Bionotes. 14 (3): 76–80

The rich flora and fauna of Sanjay Gandhi National Park attracts more than 2 million visitors every year. Tourists also enjoy visiting the 2400-year-old Kanheri caves sculpted out of the rocky cliffs which lie within the park.

Sanjay Gandhi National Park is said to be one of the most visited national parks in Asia. According to estimates, around 2 million visitors visit this park annually. Collection at the gates in November 2004 touched .

Seven Buddhist caves, older than Kanheri Caves have also been discovered very recently. Detailed exploration and documentation is awaited from The Archaeological Survey of India.
The park's main entrance is located in Borivali, east of Borivali railway station, which is approximately north of southern tip of Mumbai city, with suburban trains running every 5 minutes. From Borivali station, one can walk or hire an auto rickshaw to reach Sanjay Gandhi National Park. It is well connected with all parts of Mumbai and Maharashtra by road. The Western Express Highway (NH 8) passes by the park entrance. Buses are available on holidays and Sundays from Mumbai to the park. Also, chartered vehicles can be hired for groups to visit the park.

Sanjay Gandhi National Park is an protected area near Mumbai in Maharashtra State in India. It was formerly known as Borivali National Park.
It is notable as one of the major national parks existing within a metropolis limit and is one of the most visited parks in the world.

The park is home to a number of endangered species of flora and fauna. The forest area of the park houses over 1,000 plant species, 251 species of migratory, land and water birds, 50,000 species of insects and 40 species of mammals. In addition, the park also provides shelter to 38 species of reptiles, 9 species of amphibians, 150 species of butterflies and a large variety of fish.

The Sanjay Gandhi National Park area has a long written history dating back to the 4th century BCE. In ancient India, Sopara and Kalyan were two ports in the vicinity that traded with ancient civilisations such as Greece and Mesopotamia. The land route between these two ports was partially through this forest.

There are several public walking trails in the park. The popular "Ashok Van" trail winds up through thick forest to a dense cluster of Ashoka trees that are a welcome half way resting spot. One can return by "Gaumukh" trail to an open place of volcanic rock to return to the Kanheri caves. A more ambitious route is the 'View Point' trail to the highest point in Mumbai, for a panoramic view of the city and a view of the three lakes of the city – Tulsi Lake, Vihar Lake and Powai Lake. New jungle trails at Sanjay Gandhi National Park allow visitors to see the more unexplored parts of the park. They are the "Shilonda Trail", the "Malad Trail", and the "Yeoor Trail". Trails access cost is Rs. 25 per person.
question_src: Sanjay Gandhi国家公园有多大？
pos_context_src: 1981年，公园进一步扩大到总面积为82.25平方公里。1996年，公园更名为桑杰·甘地国家公园，此前是前总理英迪拉·甘地（Indira Gandhi）的儿子桑杰·甘地（Sanjay Gandhi）。同年，塔那分区的一些森林被合并到公园，进一步将其总面积扩大到103.84平方公里。
neg_context_src: “ Karvi”灌木是在马拉地语中被称为本地的，有时也被拼写为“ karvy”英语，在八年的大规模开花中只开花一次，覆盖着薰衣草腮红的森林地板。它在孟买附近的西高止山脉（Western Ghath Hills）的大量生长，包括整个桑杰·甘地国家公园（Sanjay Gandhi National Park），就像其自然范围的其他地区一样。在桑杰·甘地国家公园（Sanjay Gandhi National Park）在2008年举行了最新的盛开，它计划在2016年再次在这里开花。被大自然爱好者称为“大自然的奇迹”，它的最大盛开可以在公园中不受干扰的某些内在道路和小径上看到。它可以在山坡的广阔倾斜膨胀的地方生存下来，公园的坎赫里洞穴地区是观察大面积盛开的最佳场所之一。

该文章的一部分是从2004年7月5日的《印度时报》文章中提及的
Kasambe，R。（2012年）：Sanjay Gandhi国家公园和孟买的蝴蝶动物区系。 Bionotes。 14（3）：76–80
桑杰·甘地国家公园（Sanjay Gandhi National Park）的丰富动植物每年吸引超过200万游客。游客还喜欢参观2400年历史的坎赫里洞穴，从公园内的岩石悬崖上雕刻出来。
据说桑杰·甘地国家公园是亚洲访问量最多的国家公园之一。据估计，每年约有200万游客参观这个公园。 2004年11月在大门口收集。

最近还发现了七个比坎赫里洞穴大的佛教洞穴。印度考古调查局正在等待详细的探索和文档。
该公园的主要入口位于Borivali火车站以东的Borivali，该站位于孟买市南端以北，郊区火车每5分钟运行一次。从Borivali车站，可以步行或租用汽车人力车到达Sanjay Gandhi国家公园。它与孟买和马哈拉施特拉邦的所有地区都息息相关。 Western Express高速公路（NH 8）通过公园入口。从孟买到公园的假期和周日都可以买到公共汽车。此外，可以雇用特许车辆来访问公园。

Sanjay Gandhi国家公园是印度马哈拉施特拉邦孟买附近的一个保护区。它以前被称为Borivali国家公园。
它是在大都市限制中存在的主要国家公园之一，并且是世界上访问量最高的公园之一。
该公园是许多濒临灭绝的动植物的家园。公园的森林地区拥有1,000多种植物，251种迁徙，土地和水鸟，50,000种昆虫和40种哺乳动物。此外，公园还为38种爬行动物，9种两栖动物，150种蝴蝶和各种鱼类提供庇护所。
桑杰·甘地国家公园（Sanjay Gandhi National Park）地区的书面历史可以追溯到公元前4世纪。在印度古代，索帕拉（Sopara）和卡利安（Kalyan）是附近两个港口，与希腊和美索不达米亚等古代文明进行了交易。这两个港口之间的土地路线部分穿过这座森林。

公园里有几条公共步行道。受欢迎的“ Ashok Van”步道蜿蜒穿过茂密的森林，到达一群茂密的Ashoka树，这是一个令人欣慰的休息地点。人们可以通过“ Gaumukh”步道返回火山岩的开放地点，返回坎赫里洞穴。一条更雄心勃勃的路线是通往孟买最高点的“景点”步道，可欣赏城市的全景以及城市三个湖泊的景色 - 塔尔西湖，维哈尔湖和Powai湖。 Sanjay Gandhi国家公园的新丛林步道使游客可以看到公园中更未开发的部分。它们是“ Shilonda Trail”，“ Malad Trail”和“ Yeoor Trail”。步道访问成本为卢比。每人25。
report_src: 桑杰·甘地国家公园（Sanjay Gandhi National Park）现有总面积约103.84平方公里；这一规模在1996年将塔那分区部分森林并入后确立 [1]。

question_en: When was the Pythagorean theorem developed?
pos_context_en: There is debate whether the Pythagorean theorem was discovered once, or many times in many places, and the date of first discovery is uncertain, as is the date of the first proof. According to Joran Friberg, a historian of mathematics, evidence indicates that the Pythagorean theorem "was well-known to the mathematicians of the Old Babylonian period" (20th to 16th centuries BC), which would have been over a thousand years before Pythagoras was born. The history of the theorem can be divided into four parts: knowledge of Pythagorean triples, knowledge of the relationship among the sides of a right triangle, knowledge of the relationships among adjacent angles, and proofs of the theorem within some deductive system.
neg_context_en: In 1988, "The Theorem of Pythagoras" was the first video produced by the series and reviews the Pythagorean theorem. For all right triangles, the square of the hypotenuse is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides ( a + b = c ). The theorem is named after Pythagoras of ancient Greece. Pythagorean triples occur when all three sides of a right triangle are integers such as a = 3, b = 4 and c = 5. A clay tablet shows that the Babylonians knew of Pythagorean triples 1200 years before Pythagoras, but nobody knows if they knew the more-general Pythagorean theorem. The Chinese proof uses four similar triangles to prove the theorem.

In India, the "Baudhayana Sulba Sutra", the dates of which are given variously as between the 8th and 5th century BC, contains a list of Pythagorean triples discovered algebraically, a statement of the Pythagorean theorem, and a geometrical proof of the Pythagorean theorem for an isosceles right triangle.
The "Apastamba Sulba Sutra" (c. 600 BC) contains a numerical proof of the general Pythagorean theorem, using an area computation. Van der Waerden believed that "it was certainly based on earlier traditions". Carl Boyer states that the Pythagorean theorem in "Śulba-sũtram" may have been influenced by ancient Mesopotamian math, but there is no conclusive evidence in favor or opposition of this possibility.
With contents known much earlier, but in surviving texts dating from roughly the 1st century BC, the Chinese text "Zhoubi Suanjing" (周髀算经), ("The Arithmetical Classic of the Gnomon and the Circular Paths of Heaven") gives a reasoning for the Pythagorean theorem for the (3, 4, 5) triangle—in China it is called the "Gougu theorem" (勾股定理). During the Han Dynasty (202 BC to 220 AD), Pythagorean triples appear in "The Nine Chapters on the Mathematical Art", together with a mention of right triangles. Some believe the theorem arose first in China, where it is alternatively known as the "Shang Gao theorem" (商高定理), named after the Duke of Zhou's astronomer and mathematician, whose reasoning composed most of what was in the "Zhoubi Suanjing".

Pythagoras, whose dates are commonly given as 569–475 BC, used algebraic methods to construct Pythagorean triples, according to Proclus's commentary on Euclid. Proclus, however, wrote between 410 and 485 AD. According to Thomas L. Heath (1861–1940), no specific attribution of the theorem to Pythagoras exists in the surviving Greek literature from the five centuries after Pythagoras lived. However, when authors such as Plutarch and Cicero attributed the theorem to Pythagoras, they did so in a way which suggests that the attribution was widely known and undoubted. "Whether this formula is rightly attributed to Pythagoras personally, [...] one can safely assume that it belongs to the very oldest period of Pythagorean mathematics."

The Pythagoreans engaged with geometry as a liberal philosophy which served to establish principles and allowed theorems to be explored abstractly and mentally. Pythagorean philosophers believed that there was a close relationship between numbers and geometrical forms. Early-Pythagorean philosophers proved simple geometrical theorems, including "the sum of the angles of a triangle equals two right angles". Pythagoreans also came up with three of the five regular polyhedra: the tetrahedron, the cube and the dodecahedron. The sides of a regular dodecahedron are regular pentagons, which for Pythagoreans symbolized health. They also revered the pentagram, as each diagonal divides the two others at the golden ratio. When linear geometrical figures replaced the dots, the combination of Babylonian algebra and Pythagorean arithmetic provided the basis for Greek geometric algebra. By attempting to establish a system of concrete and permanent rules, Pythagoreans helped to establish strict axiomatic procedures of solving mathematical problems.

Around 400 BC, according to Proclus, Plato gave a method for finding Pythagorean triples that combined algebra and geometry. Around 300 BC, in Euclid's "Elements", the oldest extant axiomatic proof of the theorem is presented.

Evidence for more complex mathematics does not appear until around 3000 BC, when the Babylonians and Egyptians began using arithmetic, algebra and geometry for taxation and other financial calculations, for building and construction, and for astronomy. The most ancient mathematical texts from Mesopotamia and Egypt are from 2000–1800 BC. Many early texts mention Pythagorean triples and so, by inference, the Pythagorean theorem seems to be the most ancient and widespread mathematical development after basic arithmetic and geometry. It is in Babylonian mathematics that elementary arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) first appear in the archaeological record. The Babylonians also possessed a place-value system, and used a sexagesimal numeral system, still in use today for measuring angles and time.

A generalization of the Pythagorean theorem extending beyond the areas of squares on the three sides to similar figures was known by Hippocrates of Chios in the 5th century BC, and was included by Euclid in his "Elements":

Thales is supposed to have used geometry to solve problems such as calculating the height of pyramids based on the length of shadows, and the distance of ships from the shore. He is also credited by tradition with having made the first proof of two geometric theorems—the "Theorem of Thales" and the "Intercept theorem" described above. Pythagoras is widely credited with recognizing the mathematical basis of musical harmony and, according to Proclus' commentary on Euclid, he discovered the theory of proportionals and constructed regular solids. Some modern historians have questioned whether he really constructed all five regular solids, suggesting instead that it is more reasonable to assume that he constructed just three of them. Some ancient sources attribute the discovery of the Pythagorean theorem to Pythagoras, whereas others claim it was a proof for the theorem that he discovered. Modern historians believe that the principle itself was known to the Babylonians and likely imported from them. The Pythagoreans regarded numerology and geometry as fundamental to understanding the nature of the universe and therefore central to their philosophical and religious ideas. They are credited with numerous mathematical advances, such as the discovery of irrational numbers. Historians credit them with a major role in the development of Greek mathematics (particularly number theory and geometry) into a coherent logical system based on clear definitions and proven theorems that was considered to be a subject worthy of study in its own right, without regard to the practical applications that had been the primary concern of the Egyptians and Babylonians.

Nicomachus' treatises were well known in Greek, Latin and the Arabic worlds. In the 1st century an Arabic translation of Nicomachus’ "Introduction to Arithmetic" was published. The Arabic translations of Nicomachus' treatises were in turn translated into Latin by Gerard of Cremona, making them part of the Latin tradition of numerology. The Pythagorean theorem was referenced in Arabic manuscripts. Scholars in the Arabic world displayed a strong interest in Pythagorean concepts. In the 1st century Abu al-Wafa' Buzjani discussed multiplication and division in a treatise on arithmetic for business administrators in reference to Nicomachus. However, the primary interest of Islamic arithmeticians was in solving practical problems, such as taxation, measurement, the estimation of agricultural values and business applications for the buying and selling of goods. There was little interest for the Pythagorean numerology that developed in the Latin world. The primary arithmetical system used by Islamic mathematicians was based on Hindu arithmetic, which rejected the notion that the relations between numbers and geometrical forms were symbolic.

report_src: 根据给出的14份文档，可将其标题（或内容）中的字母按顺序拼接成短语“NOT TRANSLATED”，即：文档1提供首字母“N”[1]；随后文档2、3分别给出“O”“T”，合成“NOT”[2]；而文档5至14继续提供“T”“R”“A”“N”“S”“L”“A”“T”“E”“D”，完成“TRANSLATED”的拼写[5]。因此，整组信息仅说明原文本尚未被翻译，没有额外可翻译或解释的内容。

question_en: Who created Andes mints?
pos_context_en: In 1921, Andrew Kanelos opened a small candy store in Chicago, Illinois. While he initially called his store "Andy's Candies" in reference to himself, he quickly found that men did not like giving boxes of candy with another man's name to their wives and girlfriends. As such, he changed the spelling of the business to "Andes Candies." In 1980, Andes was purchased by the Swiss candy company Interfood (later Jacobs Suchard). When Jacobs Suchard bought Brach's in 1987, Andes became part of that division. When Jacobs Suchard was sold to Kraft General Foods in 1990, Brach's was kept separate by owner Klaus J. Jacobs. In need of cash, Brach's sold Andes to Tootsie Roll Industries in 2000.
neg_context_en: Andes joined his friend Joseph Segel at The Franklin Mint (a mint producing coinage) in 1967, becoming its first executive vice-president. In 1970, he was named president of its US division, and Franklin Mint stock began to be actively traded on the New York Stock Exchange. When Segel retired in 1973, Andes became CEO and chairman of Franklin Mint Corporation, which by then had expanded internationally and was also producing coin-of-the-realm for several foreign countries.

Andes Chocolate Mints are small rectangular candies consisting of one mint-green layer sandwiched in between two chocolate-brown layers. The candies are usually wrapped in green foil imprinted with the company's logo, the word "Andes" written amidst a drawing of snow-capped peaks. First launched in 1950, they are produced by Tootsie Roll Industries and made in Delavan, Wisconsin.

The most common Andes mint is 1.5 × 0.75 × 0.25 inches, weighs 4.75 grams, and contains 25 calories. A larger size is also available, measuring 2 × 0.75 × 0.25 inches, weighing 9 grams, and containing 47.5 calories.In 2007, the Andes "Limited Edition Dessert Indulgence" array was introduced. It offered an assortment of three new flavors.Andes Mints have been used in several other products. These include baking chips, ice cream, cookies, and cake rolls. Several fast food and fast casual chains have offered Andes Mints in some of their offerings including: Jack in the Box milkshakes, Arby's milkshakes, as a Caribou Coffee cooler and as a featured topping in the topping bar at Yogurtland. The baking chips were introduced in the autumn of 2003 and include the mints' original design.

In the United States, Andes mints are a popular after-dinner mint and are often distributed at restaurants, particularly Olive Garden. The mint used at Olive Garden is a special flavor manufactured exclusively for the restaurant chain, but it is tastewise similar to the Mint Parfait flavor, containing the same layers, but at different ratios.
In 1981, Franklin Mint Corporation was acquired by Warner Communications (the predecessor of Time Warner Corporation). Andes continued as CEO of Franklin Mint Corporation until 1986.

Under Andes’ direction, sales at The Franklin Mint grew steadily, due largely to a program of product diversification from coins and medals to porcelain, crystal, die-cast collectibles and leather-bound books, while still maintaining its status as the world’s largest private mint.
There was a sense of mission and excitement at the Mint, and it was the same thing here at the Institute. We were banded together by a common purpose—and by the sheer terror of it all.

Romney's was founded in 1918, and used an old recipe to create mint cake. This mint cake was sold in Kendal and sent by train to other areas of the north-west for sale. In 1987, Romney's bought Wiper's Mint Cake from Harry Wiper, who had inherited ownership of Wiper's in 1960 when his father Robert Wiper died. 
In 2016 Romney's collaborated with fashion site Lyst to create a limited run of "Kendall Mint Cakes" to celebrate Kendall Jenner's 21st Birthday on 3 November. 200 limited edition cakes were given away on social media.

Pez was first marketed as a compressed peppermint sweet in Vienna, Austria, in 1927 by Eduard Haas III. The name PEZ is an abbreviation of PfeffErminZ (German for peppermint). Haas created the peppermints using family owned baking powders, and decided to serve the mints in small, hand-size containers. He manufactured a small tin to hold the mints, similar to the modern Altoids tins. The first Pez mint dispensers, known as "regulars," were similar in shape to a cigarette lighter, and dispensed an adult breath mint marketed as an alternative to tobacco. They were invented by Oscar Uxa. Haas Food Manufacturing Corporation of Vienna was the first to sell Pez products.
question_src: 谁创造了安第斯山脉的造币厂？
pos_context_title_src: 安第斯山脉巧克力薄荷
pos_context_src: 1921年，安德鲁·卡内洛斯（Andrew Kanelos）在伊利诺伊州芝加哥开设了一家小型糖果店。当他最初称自己的商店为“安迪的糖果”时，他很快发现，男人不喜欢给妻子和女友提供一盒糖果。因此，他将业务的拼写更改为“ Andes Candies”。 1980年，安第斯山脉（Andes）被瑞士糖果公司（Swiss Candy Company）的食品（后来的Jacobs Suchard）购买。当雅各布斯·萨德（Jacobs Suchard）在1987年购买了布拉奇（Brach）时，安第斯山脉成为该部门的一部分。当雅各布斯·萨德（Jacobs Suchard）于1990年将雅各布斯·萨德（Jacobs Suchard）卖给了卡夫（Kraft General Foods）时，布拉克（Brach）由所有者克劳斯·J·雅各布斯（Klaus J. Jacobs）分开。需要现金，布拉克（Brach）于2000年将安第斯山脉卖给了Tootsie Roll Industries。
neg_context_title_src: 安第斯山脉巧克力薄荷
安第斯山脉巧克力薄荷
安第斯山脉巧克力薄荷
neg_context_src: 安第斯山脉（Andes）于1967年加入了他的朋友约瑟夫·塞格尔（Joseph Segel），在富兰克林造币厂（造币厂生产造币造币）上，成为其第一位执行副总裁。 1970年，他被任命为美国部门的总裁，富兰克林造币厂的股票开始在纽约证券交易所进行积极交易。当Segel于1973年退休时，Andes成为Franklin Mint Corporation的首席执行官兼董事长，当时该公司在国际上进行了扩展，还为几个外国的国外制作了货币。
安第斯山脉巧克力造币厂是小矩形糖果，由一个夹在两个巧克力棕色层之间的薄荷绿色层组成。这些糖果通常用绿色的箔纸包裹在公司的徽标上，即“安第斯山脉”一词在雪地山峰的图纸中写成。它们于1950年首次推出，由Tootsie Roll Industries生产，并在威斯康星州的Delavan制造。

最常见的安第斯山脉造币厂为1.5×0.75×0.25英寸，重4.75克，含有25卡路里。还可以使用更大的尺寸，尺寸为2×0.75×0.25英寸，重9克，含有47.5卡路里。它提供了各种新口味的各种。其中包括烤薯条，冰淇淋，饼干和蛋糕卷。几个快餐和快速休闲连锁店为安第斯山脉提供了一些产品，其中包括：杰克在奶昔中，阿比的奶昔，作为驯鹿咖啡冷却器，以及在Yogurtland的顶层酒吧中的特色。烘焙芯片是在2003年秋天引入的，其中包括Mints的原始设计。
在美国，安第斯山脉造币厂是一种流行的餐后薄荷糖，经常在餐厅（尤其是橄榄花园）分发。 Olive Garden使用的薄荷是专为餐厅连锁店制造的一种特殊风味，但它的味道类似于薄荷冻糕的风味，含有相同的层，但以不同的比例。
1981年，富兰克林造币厂被华纳通信公司（时代华纳公司的前身）收购。安第斯山脉一直担任富兰克林造币厂的首席执行官，直到1986年。
在安第斯山脉的指导下，富兰克林薄荷的销售稳步增长，这在很大程度上是由于产品从硬币和奖牌到瓷器，水晶，模具式收藏品和皮革限制的书籍的多元化计划，同时仍然保持其作为世界上最大的私人薄荷的地位。
造币厂有一种使命和兴奋感，研究所在这里也是同一件事。我们以一个共同的目的团结在一起，而这一切的纯粹恐惧。

罗姆尼（Romney's）成立于1918年，并使用旧食谱制作薄荷蛋糕。这种薄荷蛋糕是在肯德尔出售的，并被火车送往西北地区出售的其他地区。 1987年，罗姆尼（Romney）从哈里·维普特（Harry Wiper）那里购买了刮水器的薄荷蛋糕，哈里·韦普尔（Harry Wiper）于1960年继承了对怪兽的所有权，当时他的父亲罗伯特·惠普（Robert Wiper）去世了。 
2016年，罗姆尼（Romney）与时装网站Lyst合作，创建了有限的“肯德尔薄荷蛋糕”（Kendall Mint Cakes），以庆祝11月3日肯德尔·詹纳（Kendall Jenner）的21岁生日。在社交媒体上赠送了200个限量版蛋糕。

佩兹（Pez）于1927年由爱德华·哈斯三世（Eduard Haas III）于1927年在奥地利维也纳（Vienna）作为压缩的薄荷糖销售。 PEZ这个名字是Pfefferminz（德语用于薄荷）的缩写。 Haas使用家族拥有的烘焙粉创造了薄荷，并决定将薄荷糖提供在小型的手工尺寸的容器中。他制造了一个小锡来固定薄荷糖，类似于现代的Altoid罐头。第一批被称为“常规人”的PEZ薄荷分配器的形状类似于打火机，并分发了成人呼吸薄荷的销售，以替代烟草。它们是由奥斯卡UXA发明的。维也纳的哈斯食品制造公司是第一个出售PEZ产品的公司。
report_src: 安第斯山脉薄荷巧克力（Andes Mints）的创始人是安德鲁·卡内洛斯（Andrew Kanelos）；1921年，他在伊利诺伊州芝加哥开设了一家小型糖果店，最初取名为 “Andy’s Candies”，随后因顾客偏好将品牌改为“Andes Candies”，由此诞生了这一著名的薄荷巧克力产品[1]。

question_en: How big is Japans current navy?
pos_context_en: The , JMSDF, also referred to as the Japanese Navy, is the maritime warfare branch of the Japan Self-Defense Forces, tasked with the naval defense of Japan. It is the "de facto" navy of Japan and was formed following the dissolution of the Imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) after World War II. The JMSDF has a fleet of 154 ships and 346 aircraft and consists of approximately 45,800 personnel. Its main tasks are to maintain control of the nation's sea lanes and to patrol territorial waters. It also participates in UN-led peacekeeping operations (PKOs) and Maritime Interdiction Operations (MIOs).

Winfield Toll Bridge, also known as the Ross Booth Memorial Bridge, is a historic three-span cantilever Warren Truss bridge located at Winfield and Red House, Putnam County, West Virginia. It was built in 1955, and spans the Kanawha River, carrying West Virginia Route 34. The cantilever through-truss consists of two anchor spans each 245 feet in length and the main span 462 feet in length between pier center lines. The main span consists of two 128 feet, 4 inch, cantilever arms and a 205 feet, 4 inch, suspended span.

In his planning for how the war in the Pacific would be fought and won, Admiral Chester Nimitz knew the manufacturing might of the United States would eventually supply him with a force large enough to overcome the forces of the Empire of Japan. He referred to this future force as the 'Big Blue Fleet'. To make it effective at projecting its power, he would need to devise a way to keep it supplied and in fighting condition. The ongoing resupply of a large naval force across the vast expanse of the Pacific would require the US Navy to perform something no navy had ever accomplished before.

pos_context_src: JMSDF，也称为日本海军，是日本自卫队的海事战争部，负责日本海军国防部。这是日本的“事实上”海军，在第二次世界大战后日本帝国海军（IJN）解散后成立。 JMSDF有154艘船和346架飞机，由大约45,800名人员组成。它的主要任务是维持对国家海上车道和巡逻领域的控制。它还参加非领导的维持和平行动（PKO）和海上拦截行动（MIOS）。

question_en: What is the largest judo competition?
pos_context_en: The World Judo Championships are the highest level of international judo competition, along with the Olympic judo competition. The championships are held once every year (except the years when the Olympics take place) by the International Judo Federation, and qualified judoka compete in their respective categories as representatives of their home countries. Team competitions have also been held since 1994. The men's championships began in 1956, though the format and periodicity of the championships have changed over time. The last edition of the championships took place in Budapest, Hungary in 2017.
neg_context_en:
Popularity for the 2014 Commonwealth Games in Glasgow is growing exponentially as the day of the opening ceremony quickly approaches. Approximately 92% of the total number of tickets available - for the 11 days of sporting events - have already sold out; with judo and athletics, as well as various other sporting disciplines proving popular amongst supporters of the host and commonwealth nations.
The popularity of judo amongst the host-nation supporters is due to the Glasgow European Open, which took place in October 2013. The event was the largest judo tournament held in Scotland to date, however, this was not the main aim of the event; it was to increase the popularity of judo with the Glasgow’s citizens, in the hope of increasing the number of people getting involved in the sport as well as to gain more supporters in the run-up to the Commonwealth Games.

Takemori began practicing judo in 1937. He founded the Washington Judo Club with Don Draeger and taught there from the end of World War II. The club became the largest in the area and while there he would reach 9th dan in judo (one of the handful of Americans to reach that rank). James Takemori was one of the founders of the Judo Black Belt Federation which became the United States Judo Federation. By 1965, he was considered one of the top 15 judo black belts in America. He served as a coach for the 1964 US Olympic judo bronze medalist Jim Bregman and served as a coach for the US men's and women's national teams. He served on selection committees for the US men's and women's national and international teams. He served as a coach for other US Teams as well including the Southern US Team. Takemori utilized his influence in getting Allen Coage named to the US 1976 Olympic Team in the open weight class where he won a bronze medal. It was under Takemori's leadership that the US Women won three bronze medals in the first women's Worlds Championships in judo. He served as the USJF Juniors chairman. He also served as Chairman of the AAU Junior Judo Program.

The Men's 81 kg competition at the 2018 World Judo Championships was held on 23 September 2018.

Takemori于1937年开始练习柔道。他与唐·德雷格（Don Draeger）建立了华盛顿柔道俱乐部，并从第二次世界大战结束时就在那里任教。该俱乐部成为该地区最大的俱乐部，尽管他将在柔道（少数美国人达到这一职位上）达到第9位。詹姆斯·塔克莫里（James Takemori）是柔道黑带联合会的创始人之一，该联合会成为美国柔道联合会。到1965年，他被认为是美国排名前15位的柔道黑带之一。他曾担任1964年美国奥林匹克柔道铜牌得主吉姆·布雷格曼（Jim Bregman）的教练，并担任美国男子和女子国家队的教练。他曾在美国男子和女子国家和国际团队的选拔委员会任职。他还曾担任其他美国队的教练，包括美国南部队。 Takemori利用了他的影响力，使艾伦·科奇（Allen Coage）在1976年的美国奥运会球队中命名为开放式体重班级，他赢得了铜牌。正是在Takemori的领导下，美国妇女在柔道的第一批女子世界锦标赛中赢得了三枚铜牌。他曾担任USJF大三学生主席。他还曾担任AAU Junior Judo计划的主席。
