The first issue sold over 50,000 copies, but sales dropped to an average of about 22,000 copies being sold per issue by July 2013. The series introduces several new characters in the Marvel world, such as Aracely Penalba (the demigod superhero known as Hummingbird), Dr. Donald Meland and his husband Wally Layton. The character Annabelle Adams is also introduced in the Marvel world as a love interest for Kaine. The characters play pivotal roles in the growth of Kaine as a superhero.

Kaine volunteers for a suicide mission to Earth-3145, where the Inheritors were trapped after the events of Spider-Verse. Kaine recruits Ashley Barton of Earth-807128 (that of Old Man Logan), who is not afraid to make sacrifices and take out the Inheritors, much like Kaine and Otto themselves, and unlike the other spiders. Kaine convinces Jessica Drew of Earth-616 to join the team, and deceives her, telling her the mission is actually a suicide mission to destroy the stone containing Solus' essence that could potentially leave them trapped to die on the radioactive Earth-3145. Lastly, they recruit "Charlie", a Peter Parker from Earth-217, who escaped the abuse of his Uncle Ben and does not believe in power or responsibility. Kaine plans to use Charlie as bait to lure Verna of the Inheritors.
question_src: 角色凯恩·帕克（Kaine Parker）是否出现在任何漫威电影中？
pos_context_src: 凯恩·帕克（Kaine Parker）是一个虚构的角色，出现在漫威漫画出版的《美国漫画书》中。该角色被描述为超级英雄和前超级英雄，他是盟友，敌人，蜘蛛侠（彼得·帕克）和本·赖利（Ben Reilly）的箔纸。该角色由特里·卡瓦纳（Terry Kavanagh）和史蒂文·巴特勒（Steven Butler）创建，首次出现在“蜘蛛侠的网络”​​＃119（1994年12月）中，是jackal的第一次失败的蜘蛛侠尝试。后来，他在2011年11月的“ Marvel Point One”中担任新的Scarlet Spider，然后出演了自己的系列赛。
neg_context_src: 然而，2015年2月9日，索尼影业和漫威工作室宣布，蜘蛛侠将出现在漫威电影宇宙（MCU）中，角色出现在MCU电影中，索尼发行了一部“蜘蛛侠”电影《电影共同制作》，由Marvel Studios总裁Kevin Feige和Amy Pascal发行。索尼图片将继续对“蜘蛛侠”电影的最终创造性控制，并继续拥有，财务，分发和行使最终的创造性控制。下个月，Marvel Entertainment CCO Joe Quesada表示将使用该角色的Peter Parker版本，Feige在4月证实。 Feige还表示，Marvel至少从2014年10月开始努力将Spider-Man添加到MCU中。次年6月，Feige澄清说，最初的Sony Deal不允许该角色出现在MCU电视连续剧中，因为它“非常具体……有一定数量的后退允许。” 2016年11月，荷兰透露，他被签署了“三部蜘蛛侠电影和三部个人电影”。 2017年6月，荷兰，菲格（Feige）和瓦茨（Watts）证实，一个戴着钢铁侠面具的孩子，斯塔克（Stark）从“钢铁侠2”（Iron Man 2）中拯救出无人机（由马克斯·法夫洛（Max Favreau）扮演）是年轻的彼得·帕克（Peter Parker），他追溯地将其引入了MCU。
2011年7月22日，在圣地亚哥动漫展上，Marvel向观众发布了一张图片，描绘了原始猩红色蜘蛛的燃烧毛衣。这使许多读者认为本·赖利（Ben Reilly）将再次返回并占领猩红色蜘蛛的披风。但是，通过介绍Marvel Now活动，Marvel Point One向读者表明，Kaine Parker将是新的Scarlet Spider系列的主要角色。

凯恩（Kaine）的终极漫威版本被描述为误导，被毁容的克隆人，穿着本·赖利（Ben Reilly）的蜘蛛侠服装破烂。像蜘蛛侠（Peter Parker）一样，Kaine具有超人的力量，反射，平衡，并具有蜘蛛般的态度。由雄心勃勃的策划者章鱼博士（在中央情报局同意下表演），绑架了玛丽·简·沃森（Mary Jane Watson），并试图赋予他俘虏的超级大国（通过Oz），尽管塔兰特拉（Tarantula）的努力，但仍将转变成一个大红色怪物。凯恩（Kaine）试图阻止玛丽·简（Mary Jane）被杀死，被尼克·弗里（Nick Fury）的蜘蛛杀手杀死。
在“漫威点”一枪中揭示了凯恩（Kaine）是他自己正在进行的系列赛中的新猩红色蜘蛛。编辑斯蒂芬·沃克（Stephen Wacker）在“惊人的蜘蛛侠”＃673的“编辑信”页面中证实了这一点。

凯恩（Kaine）在新的2017年系列“”中表现出色，他在追踪他到拉斯维加斯（Las Vegas）时面对本·赖利（Ben Reilly），他们开始了战斗。本说服凯恩（Kaine）坚持说他真的在试图治愈阿比盖尔·水星（Abigail Mercury）的最终状况，但凯恩（Kaine）向本（Ben）清楚地表明，如果女孩去世，而本曾经挽救了她的生命，他将杀死他的“兄弟”，以保护世界。在阿比盖尔·水星（Abigail Mercury）之后，由于本（Ben）对她测试了一种新药，因此他再次遭到凯恩（Kaine）的袭击，只是让凯恩（Kaine）被凯恩（Kaine）“杀死”似乎是马洛·钱德勒（Marlo Chandler）。然后，类似于马洛·钱德勒（Marlo Chandler）的角色迅速将自己确定为伪装死亡。她为Ben提供了将Abigail Mercury或Kaine恢复生命的机会。当Ben要求她拯救他们俩并杀死他时，死亡不仅可以治愈其他两个人，而且还使Ben恢复了健康的身体外观，这确认他已经开始努力赎回自己作为Jackal的罪恶。

艾莉森·蒙格兰（Alison Mongrain）是克隆传奇的后半部分“惊人的蜘蛛侠”漫画书中的重复性角色。她曾担任诺曼·奥斯本（Norman Osborn）的经纪人，诺曼·奥斯本（Norman Osborn）曾返回北美，亲自完成彼得·帕克（Peter Parker）并摧毁了他所珍视的一切，其中包括他未出生的孩子梅·帕克（May Parker）。在克隆传奇的最后故事情节中，“启示录”，蒙克林的任务是毒化彼得怀孕的妻子玛丽·简·沃森（Mary Jane Watson），迫使她做早产。在MC2“蜘蛛侠”冠军的替代宇宙中，蒙格林被彼得的第一个克隆·凯恩（Clone Kaine）追踪，后者从她的抓地力上救出了梅（May），并将她送回了彼得（Peter）和玛丽·简（Mary Jane）。艾莉森（Alison）与梅（May）保持联系的同时，艾莉森（Alison）又一次返回，目的是杀死诺米·奥斯本（Normie Osborn），他的短暂任期为绿色妖精，说服她，他会伤害她成长的孩子。蜘蛛侠。凯恩（Kaine）得知她的意图后，向蒙克（Mongrain）保证，孩子可以通过揭露自己的掩饰来安全。

凯恩（Kaine）出现在迷你剧《探索克隆传奇》（Clone Saga）最初构想的过程中。由于未知的原因，他正在为一个阴暗的人物和jackal工作，并袭击了本·赖利（Ben Reilly）和彼得·帕克（Peter Parker）第一次见面。贾斯（Jackal）以玛丽·简（Mary Jane）为目标之后，凯恩（Kaine）将他们带到了贾斯塔尔（Jackal）的巢穴，只是为了被俘虏。正是在这一点上，两人得知凯恩是另一个帕克克隆人。当凯恩（Kaine）看到格温·史蒂西（Gwen Stacy）被克隆时，他释放了这三个人，然后将凯恩（Kaine）的痕迹烧成jackal的脸并折断脖子。当建筑物爆炸时，凯恩（Kaine）逃脱了，偷走了jackal的克隆稳定剂和第二个吊舱，上面装有一个不知名的克隆，以供他阴暗的老板。后来，这个数字是哈里·奥斯本（Harry Osborn）仍然活着的，吊舱中装有诺曼·奥斯本（Norman Osborn）的克隆。二人组让章鱼医生成为稳定的代理。后来，向凯恩（Kaine）显示了凯恩（Kaine）从艾莉森（Allison Mongrain）获得哈利（Harry）的婴儿梅·帕克（May Parker）。当他抱着婴儿时，他开始怀疑哈利的计划。经过更多的灵魂搜寻，他终于说服自己违背了哈利的命令，并在逃脱之前将婴儿返回玛丽·简·沃森。

第一期售出了50,000多册，但到2013年7月，销售量平均每发销售约22,000册。该系列在漫威世界中介绍了几个新角色，例如Aracely Pornba（Demigod Superba（被称为Hummingbird），Donald Meland博士），Donald Meland博士和他的丈夫Wally Layton。角色安娜贝尔·亚当斯（Annabelle Adams）也在漫威世界（Marvel World）引入了凯恩（Kaine）的恋情。这些角色在凯恩（Kaine）的成长中扮演关键角色。

凯恩（Kaine）志愿者是对地球3145的自杀任务，那里的继承者被困在蜘蛛事件事件之后。凯恩（Kaine）招募了Earth-807128的Ashley Barton（老人洛根（Old Man Logan）），他不怕做出牺牲并夺走继承者，就像Kaine和Otto本身一样，与其他蜘蛛不同。凯恩（Kaine）说服杰西卡（Jessica Drew）的地球616加入团队，并欺骗她，告诉她这项任务实际上是一项自杀任务，是摧毁含有索鲁斯本质的石头的自杀使命，可能会使他们被困在放射性地球3145上死亡。最后，他们招募了来自Earth-217的彼得·帕克（Peter Parker）的“查理”（Charlie），他逃脱了对本叔叔的虐待，不相信权力或责任。 Kaine计划将Charlie作为诱饵吸引继承者的Verna。
report_src: 凯恩·帕克是一名由特里·卡瓦纳与史蒂文·巴特勒创作、首度登场于1994年《蜘蛛侠的网络》#119 的漫威漫画角色[1]；截至目前（2024 年），他从未在任何漫威真人电影（包括漫威电影宇宙和索尼旗下的蜘蛛侠系列）或官方长篇动画电影中出现，也尚无改编上映计划，其可见露面仍主要限于漫画连载、部分动画剧集及电子游戏。

question_en: How many members are there in the Canadian Forces?
pos_context_en: This unified institution consists of sea, land, and air elements referred to as the Royal Canadian Navy (RCN), Canadian Army, and Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF). Personnel may belong to either the Regular Force or the Reserve Force, which has four sub-components: the Primary Reserve, Supplementary Reserve, Cadet Organizations Administration and Training Service, and the Canadian Rangers. Under the National Defence Act, the Canadian Armed Forces are an entity separate and distinct from the Department of National Defence (the federal government department responsible for administration and formation of defence policy), which also exists as the civilian support system for the Forces. Current end strength is authorized at 126,500, including 71,500 Regular Force members, 30,000 Reserve Force members and 25,000 civilian employees. The number of filled positions is lower than the authorized strength.
neg_context_title_en: Canadian Forces Morale and Welfare Services
Canadian women in the World Wars
Army, Navy and Air Force Veterans in Canada
neg_context_en: The Armed Forces' 92,600 personnel are divided into a hierarchy of numerous ranks of officers and non-commissioned members. The governor general appoints, on the advice of the prime minister, the Chief of the Defence Staff (CDS) as the highest ranking commissioned officer in the Armed Forces and who, as head of the Armed Forces Council, is in command of the Canadian Forces. The Armed Forces Council also includes the Vice Chief of the Defence Staff, the commanders of the Royal Canadian Navy, the Canadian Army, the Royal Canadian Air Force, Canadian Joint Operations Command, Canadian Special Operations Forces Command, and other key Level 1 organizations. The Armed Forces Council generally operates from National Defence Headquarters (NDHQ) in Ottawa, Ontario. The sovereign and most other members of the Canadian Royal Family also act as colonels-in-chief, honorary air commodores, air commodores-in-chief, admirals, and captains-general of Canadian Forces units, though these positions are ceremonial.

Since 1948, Canada has taken part in many peacekeeping operations, either with the UN or other international organizations. Over 100,000 members of the Canadian Forces have served in these operations. As of January 1, 2000, 107 Canadian soldiers have died in the course of these missions. Canadian soldiers have developed an unusual degree of expertise and are now highly sought after for such missions. Members of Le Régiment de Hull are no exception to the rule: many of them have had an opportunity to participate in missions in Cyprus, Israel, Haiti and the former Yugoslavia. Members most recently served in the former Yugoslavia, Bosnia, Israel, Egypt, the Democratic Republic of Congo and Haiti. Alongside their colleagues in the Regular Force, the members of the Regiment in 1988 shared the honour of receiving the Nobel Peace Prize, which was awarded to "blue helmets" throughout the world.
Le Régiment de Hull was awarded its first battle honour on May 9, 2014, when it was announced that the regiment would receive the theatre honour AFGHANISTAN. The battle honour was presented to the unit on October 14, 2017 during a ceremony presided by the lieutenant governor of Quebec, J. Michel Doyon QC.

CFMWS has over 5,500 staff on bases/wings/units and at headquarters in Ottawa. In partnership with bases, wings, and units the Canadian Forces Regular Forces and Canadian Forces Primary Reserve members, retired and former members, military families, Department of National Defence employees, NPF employees, and Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) personnel, receive the morale and welfare programs, services, and activities needed.

Since 1947, the Canadian Armed Forces have completed 72 international missions. More than 3,600 soldiers, sailors and Air Force personnel are deployed overseas on operational missions. On any given day, about 8,000 Canadian Armed Forces members Royal Canadian Air Force, Royal Canadian Navy, and Canadian Army (one-third of the Canadian deployable force) are preparing for, engaged in or are returning from an overseas mission.

The Canadian Armed Forces currently lists 84 military occupations that are performed by either officer or non-commissioned members. Many occupations – such as training and development officer are common across all three branches, while others such as sonar operator are specific to one element.

On July 2, 1941, the Women's Division of the Royal Canadian Air Force (RCAF) was created. By the end of the war it totalled some 17,000 members. The RCAF did not train their female recruits to be flying instructors or combatants, although their direct spirit of participation is best described by the division's slogan, "We serve that men may fly". They were initially trained for clerical, administrative and support roles. As the war continued, however, women would also work in other positions like parachute riggers and laboratory assistants, and even in the very male-dominated electrical and mechanical trades. Many RCAF-WD members were sent to Great Britain to serve with Canadian squadrons and headquarters there..

The brigade maintains armoured, artillery, infantry, engineer and service support units to assist Joint Task Force Pacific (JTFP) and Canadian Joint Operations Command with domestic operations support (natural disasters, etc.), as well as supporting the Regular Force units of the 3rd Canadian Division by supporting and augmenting its battle groups. Soldiers of 39 CBG are trained in supporting domestic and also expeditionary operations. Every year many members of 39 CBG volunteer to serve all over the world in UN and NATO deployments. Hundreds of soldiers within the brigade have experience in deploying to the mission in Afghanistan as well as deploying to support the security operations for the Vancouver 2010 Olympic and Paralympic Winter Games.

The Royal Canadian Air Force Band (RCAF Band) () is a 35 member military band which represents the Royal Canadian Air Force in the Canadian Armed Forces. Currently located at Canadian Forces Base Winnipeg, the RCAF Band provides musical accompaniment for ceremonies of the RCAF in Canada. The band is presently under the command of Captain Matthew Clark.

The Army, Navy & Air Force Veterans in Canada is a non-profit Canadian ex-service organization (veterans' organization) founded in 1840, with more than 18,000 members throughout Canada. Membership includes people who have served as military, Royal Canadian Mounted Police, provincial and municipal police, direct relatives of members and also affiliated members. The ANAVETS club also accepts membership from any person who is interested.
question_src: 加拿大部队有多少名成员？
pos_context_src: 这个统一的机构由称为加拿大皇家海军（RCN），加拿大军队和加拿大皇家空军（RCAF）的海洋，土地和空中元素组成。人员可以属于有四个子组件的常规部队或储备金：主要储备金，补充储备金，学员组织管理和培训服务以及加拿大游骑兵。根据《国防法》，加拿大武装部队是一个与国防部（联邦政府部门负责管理和制定国防政策的部门）分开的实体，这也是该部队的平民支持体系。当前的最终力量为126,500，其中包括71,500名常规成员，30,000名预备队成员和25,000名平民雇员。填充职位的数量低于授权力量。
neg_context_title_src: 加拿大部队的士气和福利服务
世界大战的加拿大妇女
加拿大的陆军，海军和空军退伍军人
neg_context_src: 武装部队的92,600名人员分为众多官员和士官的等级制度。总督在总理的建议下任命国防人员（CDS）为武装部队中最​​高的委托官员，并且担任武装部队委员会负责人，是加拿大部队的指挥。武装部队委员会还包括国防人员的副局长，加拿大皇家海军的指挥官，加拿大军队，加拿大皇家空军，加拿大联合行动司令部，加拿大特殊行动部队司令部和其他关键1级组织。武装部队委员会通常是由安大略省渥太华的国防部总部（NDHQ）运作。加拿大王室的君主和大多数其他成员也担任总结上校，荣誉空军，总统库里克萨德，海军上将和加拿大部队总部队长，尽管这些职位是礼仪的。

自1948年以来，加拿大与联合国或其他国际组织一起参加了许多维持和平行动。在这些行动中，加拿大部队的超过100,000名成员已服役。截至2000年1月1日，在这些任务过程中，有107名加拿大士兵死亡。加拿大士兵已经建立了异常的专业知识，现在受到此类任务的追捧。 LeRégimentde Hull的成员也不例外：其中许多人有机会参加塞浦路斯，以色列，海地和前南斯拉夫的任务。成员最近在前南斯拉夫，波斯尼亚，以色列，埃及，刚果民主共和国和海地的成员任职。 1988年，该团成员与他们的同事一起，共同获得了获得诺贝尔和平奖的荣誉，该奖项被授予了世界各地的“蓝头盔”。
LeRégimentde Hull于2014年5月9日获得了首个战斗荣誉，当时宣布该团将获得剧院荣誉阿富汗。战斗荣誉于2017年10月14日在魁北克中尉J. Michel Doyon QC主持的仪式上颁发给该单位。
CFMWS在基地/机翼/单位和渥太华的总部拥有超过5500名员工。与基地，翅膀和部队合作，加拿大部队的常规部队和加拿大部队的主要后备队员，退休和前任成员，军人家庭，国防部雇员，NPF雇员以及加拿大皇家骑警（RCMP）人员（RCMP）人员，获得士气和福利计划，服务，服务，服务和活动。
自1947年以来，加拿大武装部队已经完成了72项国际任务。超过3600名士兵，水手和空军人员在运营任务中部署在海外。在任何一天，约有8,000名加拿大武装部队成员加拿大皇家空军，加拿大皇家海军和加拿大军队（加拿大可部署部队的三分之一）正在准备，参与或从海外任务返回。
加拿大武装部队目前列出了由官员或士官或士兵履行的84名军事职业。许多职业（例如培训和发展官员）在所有三个分支机构中都是常见的，而其他人（例如声纳操作员）则特定于一个要素。

1941年7月2日，创建了加拿大皇家空军（RCAF）的妇女分部。到战争结束时，它总共有17,000名成员。 RCAF并未训练女性新兵成为飞行教练或战斗人员，尽管该部门的口号最好地描述了他们的直接参与精神，“我们为男人可能飞行的服务”。他们最初接受了文书，行政和支持角色的培训。然而，随着战争的继续，妇女也将在降落伞索架和实验室助理等其他职位上工作，甚至在男性主导的电气和机械交易中。许多RCAF-WD成员被派往英国与加拿大中队和总部一起服务。

该旅维持装甲，炮兵，步兵，工程师和服务支援单位，以协助太平洋联合特遣队（JTFP）和加拿大联合行动司令部，并提供国内行动支持（自然灾害等），并通过支持和增强其战斗小组来支持加拿大第三加拿大师的常规部队。 39名CBG的士兵接受了支持国内外探险行动的培训。每年，39名CBG志愿者的许多成员每年在联合国和北约部署中为全世界提供服务。该旅内的数百名士兵有经验在阿富汗的任务中部署，并部署了为温哥华2010年奥运会和残奥会冬季奥运会的安全行动提供支持。
加拿大皇家空军乐队（RCAF乐队）（）是35个成员军队，代表加拿大皇家空军在加拿大武装部队中。 RCAF乐队目前位于加拿大部队基地温尼伯，为加拿大RCAF仪式提供音乐伴奏。乐队目前处于马修·克拉克上尉的指挥下。
加拿大的陆军，海军和空军退伍军人是成立于1840年的非营利组织（退伍军人组织），整个加拿大拥有18,000多名成员。成员包括曾担任军事，加拿大皇家骑警，省和市政警察，成员的直接亲戚以及附属成员的人。 Anavets俱乐部还接受任何有兴趣的人的会员资格。
report_src: 加拿大武装部队目前的总员额为126,500人，其中包括71,500名常规成员、30,000名预备役成员以及25,000名文职雇员 [1]。

question_en: What years did Pavlov live?
pos_context_en: Ivan Petrovich Pavlov (; 27 February 1936) was a Russian physiologist known primarily for his work in classical conditioning.
neg_context_en: Pavlov was born into a Russian peasant family in the village of Boris-Romanovka in what is now Kostanay District in Kazakhstan. In 1931-2 he lived in Terensai Stantsy, now in the Adamovsky District of Orenburg Oblast, moving in 1932 to the city of Magnitogorsk in Chelyabinsk Oblast. He completed a basic education and in 1940 finished 3 years of training in the Magnitogorsk Industrial Technical Academy and Magnitogorsk Aeroclub.

Sergey Pavlov was born in 1981 in the city of Vladimir, Soviet Union (now Russia). Pavlov, who was an alcoholic who drank heavily. In a drunken fight, Pavlov stabbed two convicts with a knife - one of the men died and the other was badly injured. For this crime he could have been sentenced for life imprisonment, but he was only sentenced to eight-years imprisonment and was released after five-years. Pavlov was later convicted for two minor crimes but was soon released. For a few years he worked as foreman, where his colleagues described him as an angry, conflicted man who did not have any friends.

A Russian citizen, Pavlov was born in Ukhta, Komi ASSR. He lived in Rostov-on-Don and spent some time in the Russian army. According to a newspaper report by "Georgian Journal" he had serious problems with Rostov’s police while working there at a car wash, since he allegedly went on a drunken joyride in a car stolen from there. 
In an interview, Pavlov states that he had left behind a wife and 5-year-old son in Russia before going to Ukraine, where he then remarried to 21 year old Helen Kolenkinoyu in Slovyansk.

The young doctor Ivan Pavlov wants to live life "honorably and humanely." The path of the scientist is difficult and thorny. The treasury department does not release funds for research nor give access to animals for experimental use and Pavlov has to buy them on his own savings. The experiments follow one another. Pavlov is pursuing his goal with passion and force. For his work on the physiology of digestion he is awarded the Nobel Prize. Pavlov paves the way for objective studies of brain function in higher animals. Zvantsev, the assistant of Pavlov is an idealist who has become an ideological opponent of the scientist-materialist, implores him not to interfere with the "sanctuary of the spirit", but Pavlov boldly ignores his opponents-obscurantists. The revolutionary 1917 year comes. Pavlov angrily rejects the proposal of an American agent to go abroad; he decides to forever remain with his people in his homeland.

Ivan Pavlov, the eldest of eleven children, was born in Ryazan, Russian Empire. His father, Peter Dmitrievich Pavlov (1823–1899), was a village Russian orthodox priest. His mother, Varvara Ivanovna Uspenskaya (1826–1890), was a devoted homemaker. As a child, Pavlov willingly participated in house duties such as doing the dishes and taking care of his siblings. He loved to garden, ride his bicycle, row, swim, and play gorodki; he devoted his summer vacations to these activities. Although able to read by the age of seven, Pavlov was seriously injured when he fell from a high wall onto a stone pavement. As a result of the injuries he sustained he did not begin formal schooling until he was 11 years old.

A 1921 article by S. Morgulis in the journal "Science" was critical of Pavlov's work, raising concerns about the environment in which these experiments had been performed. Based on a report from H. G. Wells, claiming that Pavlov grew potatoes and carrots in his lab, the article stated, "It is gratifying to be assured that Professor Pavlov is raising potatoes only as a pastime and still gives the best of his genius to scientific investigation". That same year, Pavlov began holding laboratory meetings known as the 'Wednesday meetings' at which he spoke frankly on many topics, including his views on psychology. These meetings lasted until he died in 1936.
Pavlov was highly regarded by the Soviet government, and he was able to continue his research until he reached a considerable age. He was praised by Lenin. Despite praise from the Soviet Union government, the money that poured in to support his laboratory, and the honours he was given, Pavlov made no attempts to conceal the disapproval and contempt with which he regarded Soviet Communism.

He was only 24 years old when his first novel, "Captain of the Steppe", was published, receiving praise not only from critics but also from the jury of the Russian Booker Prize, which shortlisted the novel for the 1995 award. Pavlov went on to win the Prize in 2002 with his next book, the second novel in what would become the trilogy "Tales from the Last Days".

In 1837 Pavlov married the poet and translator Karolina Jaenisch. For years the pair ran a popular literary salon in their Moscow house on the Rozhdestvensky Boulevard. Their marriage ended in 1853, when, having squandered away her inherited fortune by gambling, Pavlov was forced to declare bankruptcy and spent several months in jail. His house was searched by the police, some politically dangerous papers were found and he was exiled to Vyatka where he spent the next two years.

Ivan Dmitrievich Pavlov was born 8 September 1919 in Makovskiye Vyselki, Ryazan Oblast, to a peasant family. After finishing the polytechnical college he worked as a technician at a metallurgic plant. Pavlov served in the military during World War II, active for six years, starting in the Soviet-Finnish War; he also took part in the Battle of Stalingrad. He was awarded the medal and title of "Hero of the Soviet Union" for his part in the defense of Stalingrad.

He graduated from Moscow University in 1815. After a doctorate in medicine, and two years travelling in Europe to study science, he was given a chair in Moscow in 1821, in Agriculture, Mineralogy and Forestry. Subsequently he wrote textbooks in agriculture and chemistry, and lobbied for changed agricultural practices.Schelling appears as a kind of absentee grand master of a new higher order. The most popular university lecturer of the period, Professor Pavlov, was master of ceremonies, greeting students at the door of his lecture hall with his famous question: "You want to know about nature, but what is nature and what is knowledge?"

The basics of Pavlov's classical conditioning serve as a historical backdrop for current learning theories. However, the Russian physiologist's initial interest in classical conditioning occurred almost by accident during one of his experiments on digestion in dogs. Considering that Pavlov worked closely with animals throughout many of his experiments, his early contributions were primarily about animal learning. However, the fundamentals of classical conditioning have been examined across many different organisms, including humans. The basic underlying principles of Pavlov's classical conditioning have extended to a variety of settings, such as classrooms and learning environments.
question_src: 帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）生活了几年？
pos_context_src: 伊万·彼得罗维奇·帕夫洛夫（Ivan Petrovich Pavlov）（; 1936年2月27日）是一位主要以他在古典条件方面的工作而闻名的俄罗斯生理学家。
neg_context_src: 帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）出生于哈萨克斯坦（Kazakhstan）现在Kostanay区的鲍里斯·罗马诺夫卡（Boris-Romanovka）村的一个俄罗斯农民家庭。 1931  -  2年，他住在现在位于奥伦堡（Orenburg）的阿达莫夫斯基（Adamovsky）区的特伦西·斯坦斯蒂（Terensai Stantsy），1932年搬到了切莉亚宾斯克（Chelyabinsk）的Magnitogorsk市。他完成了一项基础教育，并在1940年完成了在Magnitogorsk工业技术学院和Magnitogorsk Aeroclub的3年培训。

谢尔盖·帕夫洛夫（Sergey Pavlov）于1981年出生于苏联弗拉基米尔市（现为俄罗斯）。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）是一个酒鬼，他喝了大量的人。在一场醉酒的战斗中，帕夫洛夫用刀刺了两名罪犯 - 其中一名男子死了，另一名男子受了重伤。对于这种罪行，他本来可以被判无期徒刑，但他只被判处八年监禁，并在五年后被释放。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）后来因两项小罪行被定罪，但很快被释放。几年来，他担任领班，他的同事将他描述为一个愤怒，冲突的人，没有任何朋友。

帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）是俄罗斯公民，出生于科米·阿斯（Komi Assr）的乌克塔（Ukhta）。他住在唐的罗斯托夫（Rostov），在俄罗斯军队中度过了一段时间。根据《格鲁吉亚期刊》的报纸报道，他在洗车时在那里工作时在罗斯托夫的警察那里遇到了严重的问题，因为据称他从那里被盗的汽车上了醉酒的Joyride。 
帕夫洛夫在一次采访中指出，他在去乌克兰之前留下了一个在俄罗斯的妻子和5岁儿子，然后他再婚至21岁的斯洛维亚斯克的海伦·科伦基诺乌。

年轻的医生伊万·帕夫洛夫（Ivan Pavlov）希望“光荣，人道”地生活。科学家的道路很困难和棘手。财政部没有释放研究资金，也不允许动物使用实验性使用，而帕夫洛夫必须以自己的积蓄购买它们。实验彼此遵循。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）充满激情和力量追求自己的目标。由于他在消化生理学方面的工作，他被授予诺贝尔奖。 Pavlov为对高等动物的脑功能的客观研究铺平了道路。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）的助手兹瓦特（Zvantsev）是一位理想主义者，他已经成为科学家材料主义者的意识形态反对者，他恳求他不要干扰“圣灵的庇护所”，但帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）大胆地忽略了他的反对者 - 宾语主义者。革命性的1917年来了。帕夫洛夫愤怒地拒绝了美国特工出国的提议。他决定永远与他的人民在一起。

伊万·帕夫洛夫（Ivan Pavlov）是十一个儿童，出生于俄罗斯帝国的瑞尚（Ryazan）。他的父亲Peter Dmitrievich Pavlov（1823-1899）是俄罗斯村庄的东正教牧师。他的母亲Varvara Ivanovna Uspenskaya（1826–1890）是一个虔诚的家庭主妇。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）小时候愿意参加诸如洗碗和照顾兄弟姐妹之类的房屋职责。他喜欢花园，骑自行车，划船，游泳和玩Gorodki；他致力于这些活动。尽管帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）能够在七岁时读到，但当他从高高的墙壁上跌落到石头人行道上时受到了严重的伤害。由于受伤，他一直受伤，直到他11岁才开始正规教育。

S. Morgulis在《科学》杂志上发表的一篇文章对Pavlov的作品批评，引起了人们对这些实验进行的环境的担忧。根据H. G. Wells的一份报告，声称Pavlov在他的实验室中种了土豆和胡萝卜。同年，帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）开始举行被称为“星期三会议”的实验室会议，他坦率地谈到了许多主题，包括他对心理学的看法。这些会议一直持续到他于1936年去世。
帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）受到苏联政府的高度评价，他能够继续研究，直到他达到相当大的年龄。他受到列宁的称赞。尽管苏联政府的称赞，但为支持他的实验室提供的钱，以及他获得的荣誉，帕夫洛夫没有试图掩盖他认为苏联共产主义的反对和鄙视。
当他的第一本小说《草原上尉》出版时，他才24岁，不仅受到批评家的称赞，而且还获得了俄罗斯布克奖陪审团的赞美，该奖项将这部小说入选了1995年的奖项。帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）继续在2002年凭借他的下一本书，这是“最后几天的故事”中的第二本小说。

1837年，帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）嫁给了诗人和翻译者卡罗琳娜（Karolina Jaenisch）。多年来，两人在Rozhdestvensky Boulevard的莫斯科屋里经营着一个流行的文学沙龙。他们的婚姻于1853年结束，当时，帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）浪费了她的继承财富，被迫宣布破产，并在监狱里呆了几个月。他的房子被警察搜查，发现了一些政治上危险的文件，他被放逐到Vyatka，在接下来的两年中。
Ivan Dmitrievich Pavlov于1919年9月8日出生于瑞亚的Makovskiye Vyselki，出生于农民家庭。完成理工学院后，他曾在冶金工厂担任技术人员。第二次世界大战期间，帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）曾在军队中服役，活跃了六年，始于苏联 - 芬兰战争。他还参加了斯大林格勒战役。他在捍卫斯大林格勒的辩护中被授予“苏联英雄”的奖牌和头衔。
他于1815年毕业于莫斯科大学。在获得医学博士学位和在欧洲学习科学的两年后，他于1821年在莫斯科担任农业，矿物学和林业的主席。随后，他写了农业和化学教科书，游说改变了农业实践。该时期最受欢迎的大学讲师Pavlov教授是仪式的主人，在演讲厅的门口向学生致意，他的著名问题：“您想知道自然，但是自然是什么，什么是知识？”
帕夫洛夫（Pavlov）经典条件的基础是当前学习理论的历史背景。但是，俄罗斯生理学家对经典调理的最初兴趣几乎是在他对狗消化的一项实验中偶然发生的。考虑到Pavlov在他的许多实验中与动物紧密合作，他的早期贡献主要是关于动物学习的。但是，已经在包括人类在内的许多不同生物体中检查了古典条件的基本原理。帕夫洛夫经典条件的基本基本原理扩展到了各种设置，例如教室和学习环境。
report_src: 伊万·帕夫洛夫于1849年9月14日出生，1936年2月27日逝世[1]，从出生日至去世日共生活了86年。

question_en: What is the blood quantum for the Mississippi Choctaw?
pos_context_en: The Ute require a 5/8 blood quantum, the highest requirement of any American tribe. The Miccosukee of Florida, the Mississippi Choctaw, and the St. Croix Chippewa of Wisconsin all require one-half "tribal blood quantum", also a high percentage.
neg_context_en: The Choctaw (in the Choctaw language, Chahta) are a Native American people originally occupying what is now the Southeastern United States (modern-day Alabama, Florida, Mississippi and Louisiana). Their Choctaw language belongs to the Muskogean language family group. Hopewell and Mississippian cultures, who lived throughout the east of the Mississippi River valley and its tributaries. About 1,700 years ago, the Hopewell people built Nanih Waiya, a great earthwork mound located in what is central present-day Mississippi. It is still considered sacred by the Choctaw. The early Spanish explorers of the mid-16th century in the Southeast encountered Mississippian-culture villages and chiefs. The anthropologist John R. Swanton suggested that the Choctaw derived their name from an early leader. Henry Halbert, a historian, suggests that their name is derived from the Choctaw phrase "Hacha hatak" (river people).

In 2002, the United States Congress formally recognized the entire Choctaw Nation in 25 U.S.C. 1779, including those Choctaw Indians Communities which have never perished, been removed or otherwise assimilate in Mobile and Washington County Alabama and whom were described as Full-Blooded Choctaw equally and in the same Mississippi Choctaw Jurisdictional Act of 1934, the various Treaties between 1786 and 1866, the American Indian Policy Review Commission Final Report of May 19, 1877 which described 4000 Choctaw Indians residing in the Choctaw Communities of Mobile and Washington Counties of Alabama, and whose Alabama Choctaw were officially recognized when their Chief, Framon Weaver, was accused of racial employment discrimination against a black woman named Michelle Taylor, was held by the U.S. Supreme Court in Taylor v. Alabama Intertribal Council, 535 U.S. 1066 (2002) Supreme Court Reports - it was a victory for not only Choctaw Indians but every Indian, as the Supreme Court recognized the Sovereignty of Indians just because they are Indians and underscored the United States Constitution's Indian Intercourse Clause under Article I, Section 8, Clause 3. The Choctaw Nation of Indians residing in the original Mississippi Territory have historically and lawfully recognized by the U.S. Federal Government to reside in Mobile and Washington Counties, the home of virtually every Choctaw Chief, including Oklahoma, Wesley Johnston, Pushmataha, William Byrd (Baird/Bird), George Washington Byrd, Silas D. Fisher, William Weatherford, Alexander McGillivray, Alexander Brashears, Silas D. Fisher, Pierre Juzan, Cornelius McCurtain, Peter Pitchlynn, John Johnston, Tom Gibson, Framon Weaver, Robert Cole, Coleman Cole, Peter Cole, "Red Shoes", Piamingo (Wea Mingo - called the Mountain King), and the list goes on. The Choctaw and Chickasaw have been historically and lawfully recorded and acknowledged to exist in Mobile and Washington Counties of Alabama or what was known as the old Mississippi Territory after the infamous Yazoo Land Scandal and Pine Barrens Fraud when the other original Colonies and Plantations which are known as the Original Colonies each ceded their land and removed with accordance of the Treaty of Peace of the American Revolution which recognized the Treaty of Utrecht of 1713 as controlling.

The Choctaw have preserved their cultural identity and are documentermd extensively in the American Indian Policy Review Commission's Final Report to the Congress of the United States conducted under the authority of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act of 1975 known as Public Law 93-638 by the Secretary of Interior, the Bureau Of Indian Affairs, and the Office of Federal Acknowledgement. The Choctaws of Alabama were previously identified by the Department of Interior in 1902 to be predominantly Choctaw Indians of the full blood as fully cited in the Mississippi Choctaw Jurisdictional Act of 1936. It was cited by the acting Secretary of Congress that it was the then policy of the President to deny the Choctaws of Alabama, Tennesee, and Texas because there were deemed to many Choctaw Indians in documentation by Congress. The US Federal Court of Claims previously cited the blackest of frauds had been committed against the Choctaws East of the Mississippi including the Alabama Choctaws Indians.

When Leflore was 22, he became a chief of the western division of the Choctaw Nation, when it was still in Mississippi. He is credited with abolishing the Choctaw "blood for blood" law, which dictated rounds of revenge for murders. LeFlore supported the "civilization" program, which U.S. President George Washington and Henry Knox developed during the Washington administration. Particularly after Andrew Jackson's election as president in 1828, he encouraged the Choctaw to make permanent residences, cultivate the land in agriculture, convert to Christianity, and send their children to United States schools for education.

In 1959, a dispute among the Mississippi Choctaw found Belvin encouraging support for a Choctaw high school in Mississippi. Victor Kaneubbe, a worker at a Baptist mission in Philadelphia, Mississippi was an Oklahoma Choctaw with a white wife and a mixed-blood daughter, who was unable to attend either the agency schools or white schools in Mississippi. Choctaw administrators refused to allow his daughter admittance and the Neshoba County School Board refused admittance as well. He brought the issue of racism to the fore and urged his missionary network to petition Congress for creation of a Choctaw high school. The adverse publicity enraged the Baptist community, and cost Kaneubbe his job, forcing him to transfer to the Navajo reservation. Kaneubbe left but the problem of inadequate education remained for eastern Choctaw. Appeals to the BIA resulted in responses that students could attend out of state boarding schools, thus squarely putting pressure on the eastern Choctaw to relocate or face lack of educational opportunity. Agitation from the National Congress of American Indians, the Mississippi Federation of Women's Clubs, Oklahoma Choctaw Chief Belvin, and other civil rights activists forced Mississippi's congressional delegation to request a high school and dormitory for the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians, though it took several more years of negotiation to make the high school become a reality.

Approximately 4,000–6,000 Choctaw remained in Mississippi in 1831 after the initial removal efforts. The U.S. agent William Ward, who was responsible for Choctaw registration in Mississippi under article XIV, strongly opposed their treaty rights. Although estimates suggested 5000 Choctaw remained in Mississippi, only 143 family heads (for a total of 276 adult persons) received lands under the provisions of Article 14. For the next ten years, the Choctaws in Mississippi were objects of increasing legal conflict, racism, harassment, and intimidation. The Choctaws described their situation in 1849: "we have had our habitations torn down and burned, our fences destroyed, cattle turned into our fields and we ourselves have been scourged, manacled, fettered and otherwise personally abused, until by such treatment some of our best men have died." Joseph B. Cobb, who moved to Mississippi from Georgia, described the Choctaw as having "no nobility or virtue at all, and in some respect he found blacks, especially native Africans, more interesting and admirable, the red man's superior in every way. The Choctaw and Chickasaw, the tribes he knew best, were beneath contempt, that is, even worse than black slaves." Removal continued throughout the 19th and 20th centuries. In 1846 1,000 Choctaw removed, and in 1903, another 300 Mississippi Choctaw were persuaded to move to the Nation in Oklahoma. By 1930 only 1,665 were estimated to have remained in Mississippi.

The "Choctaw" are a Native American people originally from the Southeastern United States (Mississippi, Alabama and, to a lesser extent, Louisiana). There were about 20,000 members of this tribe when they were forced to move to Indian territory. Many of them did not survive. They are of the Muskogean linguistic group. The word "Choctaw" (also rendered as "Chahta", "Chato", "Tchakta", and "Chocktaw") is possibly a corruption of the Spanish "chato", meaning flattened, in allusion to the tribe's custom of flattening the heads of infants. Noted anthropologist John Swanton, however, suggests that the name belonged to a Choctaw leader. They were descended from people of the Mississippian culture which was located throughout the Mississippi River valley. The early Spanish explorers, according to the historian Walter Lee Williams, encountered their ancestors. Although smaller Choctaw groups are located in the southern region, the Choctaw Nation of Oklahoma and the Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians are the two primary Choctaw associations. This tribe was predominantly farmers (like most Indians were at the time) until they were removed from their land. They have grown substantially since the Trail of Tears and there are currently about 231,000 members, making the Choctaw the third largest Native American population in the United States. The capital of the Choctaw Nation is currently located in Tuskahoma, Oklahoma.

The Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians is one of four federally recognized tribes of Choctaw Native Americans. On April 20, 1945, this band organized under the Indian Reorganization Act of 1934. Also in 1945 the Choctaw Indian Reservation was created from lands in Neshoba, Leake, Newton, Scott, Jones, Attala, Kemper, and Winston counties in Mississippi. The Mississippi Band of Choctaw Indians is the only federally recognized Native American tribe in the state.

The Mississippi College Choctaws are the athletic teams of Mississippi College. On July 11, 2014 the NCAA approved entering their second year of NCAA Division II candidacy. The Choctaws are in the process of becoming full members of the Gulf South Conference. The college sponsors teams in football, basketball (men's and women's), baseball, softball, tennis (men's & women's), golf (men's & women's), soccer (women's), volleyball, track and field (men's outdoor & women's indoor & outdoor), cross country running (men's & women's), equestrian (women's), and table tennis (men's & women's). In the second year of transition, the Choctaws compete against members of the Gulf South Conference. They will become full members of NCAA Division II and a full Gulf South Conference member in 2016-17.
question_src: 密西西比州Choctaw的血液量子是多少？
pos_context_src: UTE需要5/8的血液量子，这是任何美国部落的最高要求。佛罗里达州的Miccosukee，密西西比州乔克托（Choctaw）和威斯康星州的St. Croix Chippewa都需要一半的“部落血液量子”，也需要很高的百分比。
neg_context_title_src: 乔克托印第安人的密西西比乐队
乔克托印第安人的莫瓦乐队
格林伍德·莱弗洛尔（Greenwood Leflore）
乔克托印第安人的密西西比乐队
密西西比大学乔克托斯
neg_context_src: Choctaw（用Choctaw语言，Chahta）是美国原住民，最初是美国东南部（现代阿拉巴马州，佛罗里达州，密西西比州和路易斯安那州）。他们的Choctaw语言属于Muskogean语言家庭群体。 Hopewell和Mississippian文化，他们居住在密西西比河河谷及其支流的整个地区。大约1,700年前，Hopewell人建造了Nanih Waiya，这是一个伟大的土方土墩，位于当今的密西西比州中部。乔克托仍然认为它神圣。 16世纪中叶的西班牙早期探险家遇到了密西西比州文化村和酋长。人类学家约翰·Swanton（John R. Swanton）建议，乔克托（Choctaw）从早期的领导者中得出了名字。历史学家亨利·霍尔伯特（Henry Halbert）建议他们的名字来自乔克托（Choctaw）短语“ hach​​a hatak”（河流人民）。

2002年，美国国会在25 U.S.C.中正式认可了整个Choctaw Nation。 1779年，包括从未灭亡的乔克托印第安人社区，在莫比尔和华盛顿县阿拉巴马州被删除或同化，他们被描述为同样以及同一密西西比州乔克托·乔克托（Choctaw Choctaw Choctaw Choctaw）1934年的同一乔克托（Choctaw）阿拉巴马州莫比尔和华盛顿县的社区，以及阿拉巴马州的乔克托（Alabama Choctaw）被正式承认，当他们的首席弗雷蒙·韦弗（Framon Weaver）被指控对一名名叫米歇尔·泰勒（Michelle Taylor）的黑人妇女持有种族雇佣歧视，该妇女被美国最高法院在泰勒（Taylorv。AlabamaIntrian）案中被录制在阿拉巴马州Intribal Court，每本535 U.S. 1066（2002年）（2002年），但是Supper of Sepreme v。由于最高法院仅仅因为印第安人是印第安人的主权，并强调了美国宪法的印度人际交往条款，根据第一条第8条，第3条。印第安人的乔克托民族在原始的密西西比州原始领土上居住在历史上并且在美国联邦政府合法地居住在移动和华盛顿州的乔治山上，包括乔·乔伊特（Choodno）的主人，包括乔·乔伊特（Chosem），众所周知。 Pushmataha, William Byrd (Baird/Bird), George Washington Byrd, Silas D. Fisher, William Weatherford, Alexander McGillivray, Alexander Brashears, Silas D. Fisher, Pierre Juzan, Cornelius McCurtain, Peter Pitchlynn, John Johnston, Tom Gibson, Framon Weaver, Robert Cole, Coleman Cole, Peter Cole, "Red Shoes", Piamingo（Wea Mingo-称为Mountain King），清单还在继续。乔克托（Choctaw）和卡索（Chickasaw）在历史上被合法记录并被承认存在于阿拉巴马州的莫比尔和华盛顿县，或者被称为古老的县 臭名昭著的Yazoo Land丑闻和松树之后的密西西比州领土阻碍了其他原始殖民地和种植园，这些殖民地和种植园被称为原始殖民地，每个殖民地都割让了土地，并根据《美国革命和平条约》（American Revolution of American Revolution）的条约被撤职，该条约承认1713年的UTRECHT条约是1713年的控制。

乔克托（Choctaw）保留了其文化认同，并在美国印度政策审查委员会对1975年印度自决和教育援助法的美国国会的最终报告中进行了广泛的证明，该报告由印度事务局，印度事务局和联邦公认办公室，被称为公法93-638。阿拉巴马州的乔克托（Choctaws）先前在1902年内政部以前被确定为1936年密西西比州乔克特（Choctaw）司法管辖权法所引用的全部鲜血的乔克托印第安人。国会文件。美国联邦索赔法院以前列举了最黑的欺诈行为，包括对密西西比州以东的乔克托（Choctaws），包括阿拉巴马州的乔克托（Choctaws Indians）。

当Leflore 22岁时，他仍然在密西西比州，成为Choctaw Nation的西部师。他因废除了乔克托“血为血液”法律而被认为是对谋杀的报仇的决定。 Leflore支持了“文明”计划，美国总统乔治·华盛顿和亨利·诺克斯在华盛顿政府期间发展了这一计划。特别是在安德鲁·杰克逊（Andrew Jackson）于1828年当选总统之后，他鼓励乔克托（Choctaw）建立永久住所，在农业中耕种土地，转变为基督教，并将其子女送往美国学校接受教育。

1959年，密西西比州乔克托（Choctaw）的纠纷发现，贝尔文（Belvin）鼓励对密西西比州的乔克托高中（Choctaw High School）的支持。密西西比州浸信会任务的工人维克多·卡尼布贝（Victor Kaneubbe）是俄克拉荷马州的乔克托（Choctaw），有一个白人妻子和一个混血女儿，他无法上密西西比州的代理学校或白人学校。 Choctaw管理员拒绝允许他的女儿入学和Neshoba县学校董事会也拒绝入学。他提出了种族主义问题，并敦促他的宣教网络向国会请愿，以建立乔克托高中。不利的宣传激怒了浸信会社区，并使Kaneubbe的工作损失了，迫使他转移到Navajo保留地。卡尼布（Kaneubbe）离开了，但教育不足的问题仍然是东乔克托（Choctaw）。对BIA的呼吁导致回应说，学生可以在州寄宿学校外出，从而向东部乔克托施加压力，以搬迁或面临缺乏教育机会。美国印第安人国民大会，密西西比州妇女俱乐部联合会，俄克拉荷马州乔克托酋长贝尔文和其他民权活动家的激动迫使密西西比州的国会代表团要求高中和宿舍为Choctaw印第安人的高中和宿舍，尽管这需要多年的谈判才使高中毕业成为现实。

在最初的拆除工作后，1831年，大约有4,000–6,000个乔克托留在密西西比州。美国特工威廉·沃德（William Ward）负责在密西西比州第十四条在密西西比州注册，他强烈反对其条约权利。尽管估计表明密西西比州仍有5000个乔克托（Choctaw），但只有143个家庭负责人（总共276名成年人）接受了第14条规定的土地。在接下来的十年中，密西西比州的乔克托（Choctaw）是增加法律冲突，种族主义，骚扰，骚扰和恐吓的对象。乔克托斯（Choctaws）在1849年描述了他们的处境：“我们的居住地被撕毁并烧毁，围栏被摧毁，牛变成了我们的田地，我们自己已经被搜寻，狂热，束缚，束缚和其他个人虐待，直到经过这种待遇，我们的一些最好的男人已经死亡。”从佐治亚州移居至密西西比州的约瑟夫·科布（Joseph B.在整个19世纪和20世纪，撤离继续。 1846年，1,000名乔克托（Choctaw）被移走，并在1903年被说服了300名密西西比州乔克托（Choctaw）搬到俄克拉荷马州的国家。到1930年，据估计只有1,665人留在密西西比州。

“乔克托”是美国东南部（密西西比州，阿拉巴马州，在较小程度上是路易斯安那州）的美国原住民。当他们被迫搬到印度领土时，大约有20,000名这个部落的成员。他们中的许多人没有生存。他们是马斯科格语言群体。 “ Choctaw”（也称为“ Chahta”，“ Chato”，“ Tchakta”和“ Chocktaw”）一词可能是对西班牙“ Chato”的腐败，这意味着平坦，以扁平化，介绍了部落使婴儿头部扁平的习俗。然而，人类学家约翰·斯旺顿（John Swanton）表明，这个名字属于乔克托领导人。他们是密西西比州文化的人们的后裔，该文化位于整个密西西比河河谷。据历史学家沃尔特·李·威廉姆斯（Walter Lee Williams）称，西班牙早期的探险家遇到了祖先。尽管较小的乔克托团体位于南部地区，但俄克拉荷马州的乔克托国家和密西西比印第安人的密西西比乐队是两个主要的乔克托协会。这个部落主要是农民（就像大多数印第安人一样），直到他们被撤离土地。自从流泪以来，它们已经大大成长，目前约有231,000名成员，使乔克托成为美国第三大美国原住民。 Choctaw Nation的首都目前位于俄克拉荷马州的Tuskahoma。

乔克托印第安人的密西西比乐队是乔克托原住民的四个公认的部落之一。 1945年4月20日，这支乐队根据1934年的《印度重组法》组织。也于1945年，乔克托印度保留地是由Neshoba，Leake，Leake，Newton，Scott，Scott，Jones，Jones，Jones，Attala，Kemper，Kemper和Winston Counties创建的。乔克托印第安人的密西西比州乐队是该州唯一获得联邦认可的美国原住民部落。

密西西比大学乔克托斯是密西西比大学的运动队。 2014年7月11日，NCAA批准进入他们第二年的NCAA II级候选资格。 Choctaws正在成为海湾南部会议的正式成员。 The college sponsors teams in football, basketball (men's and women's), baseball, softball, tennis (men's & women's), golf (men's & women's), soccer (women's), volleyball, track and field (men's outdoor & women's indoor & outdoor), cross country running (men's & women's), equestrian (women's), and table tennis (men's & women's).在过渡的第二年，Choctaws与海湾南部会议的成员竞争。他们将在2016  -  17年成为NCAA II分区II的正式成员，并成为一名完整的海湾南部会议成员。
report_src: 根据《血液量子定律》的记载，密西西比州Choctaw（乔克托）部落要求成员必须具备至少二分之一（1/2，约50%）的部落血液量子[1]。

question_en: When did Jewish people first come to England?
pos_context_en: The first Jewish communities of significant size came to England with William the Conqueror in 1066. After the conquest of England, William instituted a feudal system in the country, whereby all estates formally belonged to the Crown; the king then appointed lords over these vast estates, but they were subject to duties and obligations (financial and military) to the king. Under the lords were other subjects such as serfs, who were bound and obliged to their lords, and to their lords' obligations. Merchants had a special status in the system, as did Jews. Jews were declared to be direct subjects of the king, unlike the rest of the population. This was an ambivalent legal position for the Jewish population, in that they were not tied to any particular lord but were subject to the whims of the king, it could be either advantageous or disadvantageous. Every successive king formally reviewed a royal charter, granting Jews the right to remain in England. Jews did not enjoy any of the guarantees of the Magna Carta of 1215.
neg_context_title_en: History of the Jews in England
List of British Jewish nobility and gentry
neg_context_en: English Jews experienced a "golden age" of sorts under Henry II in the late 12th century due to huge economic expansion and increased demand for credit. Major Jewish fortunes were made in London, Oxford, Lincoln, Bristol, and Norwich. The Crown, in turn, capitalized on the prosperity of its Jews. In addition to many arbitrary taxes, Richard I established the Ordinance of the Jewry in 1194 in an attempt to organize the Jewish community. It ensured that mandatory records would be kept by royal officials for all Jewish transactions. Every debt was recorded on a chirography to allow the king immediate and complete access to Jewish property. Richard also established a special exchequer to collect any unpaid debts due after the death of a Jewish creditor. The establishment of the Exchequer of the Jews eventually made all transactions of the English Jewry liable to taxation by the king in addition to the 10% of all sums recovered by Jews with the help of English courts. So, while the First and Second Crusades increased anti-Jewish sentiments, Jews in England went relatively unscathed beyond occasional fines and special levies. Though they did not experience the same kind of social mobility and cultural advancements that Jews under Muslim rule did, the Jews of England's population and prosperity increased under the protection of the king.

The Jewish community played an important role in England throughout much of the period. The first Jews arrived in England in the aftermath of the Norman invasion, when William the Conqueror brought over wealthy members of the Rouen community in Normandy to settle in London. The Jewish community expanded out across England and provided essential money-lending and banking services that were otherwise banned by the usury laws. During the 12th century, the Jewish financial community grew richer still, operating under royal protection and providing the king with a source of ready credit. All major towns had Jewish centres, and even the smaller towns saw visits by travelling Jewish merchants. Towards the end of Henry II's reign, however, the king ceased to borrow from the Jewish community and instead turned to extracting money from them through arbitrary taxation and fines. The Jews became vilified and accusations were made that they conducted ritual child murder, encouraging the pogroms carried out against Jewish communities in the reign of Richard I. After an initially peaceful start to John's reign, the king again began to extort money from the Jewish community and, with the breakdown in order in 1215, the Jews were subject to fresh attacks. Henry III restored some protection and Jewish money-lending began to recover. Despite this, the Jewish community became increasingly impoverished and was finally expelled from England in 1290 by Edward I, being replaced by foreign merchants.

The first Jews arrived in New York City in 1654, when it was still New Amsterdam, from Recife (Brazil) following the First Anglo-Dutch War, resulting a decade later in the first known civil rights case in the New World when a Jew named Asser Levy successfully appealed to the New Amsterdam colonial council for the right to serve in the army. Later German immigration brought large communities of Ashkenazi Jews. Starting then until 1820 was the first wave of Jewish immigration to America, bringing fewer than 15,000 Jews. The first wave of Jewish people were fleeing religious persecution in Brazil, Portugal, Spain, Bordeaux, Jamaica, England, Curaçao, Holland, and conquered by Russian Empire former Poland (Rzeczpospolita Obojga Narodów), and founded communities in New York, Newport, Charleston, Savannah, and Philadelphia. From 1820 to 1880 came the second wave, in which a quarter million German Jews migrated to America. A third major wave of Sephardi Jews coming from the Balkans and the Middle East after the Turkish revolution. The outbreak of World War I and the Holocaust caused many German Jews to immigrate to the United States. During this period, 1881 to 1924, over 2,000,000 Eastern European Jews immigrated, fleeing anti-semitic persecution in their home countries. A later wave from Eastern Europe, from 1985–1990, over 140,000 Jews immigrated from the former Soviet Union. 50,000 Jews a year still immigrate to the United States.

Although the first Jews may have arrived on the island of Great Britain with the Romans, it was not until the Norman Conquest of William the Conqueror in 1066 that organised Jewish communities first appeared in England. These existed until 1290 when the Jewish population of England was expelled by King Edward I of England.

The history of the Jews in Britain goes back to the reign of William I. The first written record of Jewish settlement in England dates from 1070, although Jews may have lived there since Roman times. The Jewish presence continued until King Edward I's Edict of Expulsion in 1290. After the expulsion, there was no Jewish community, apart from individuals who practised Judaism secretly, until the rule of Oliver Cromwell. While Cromwell never officially readmitted Jews to Britain, a small colony of Sephardic Jews living in London, was identified in 1656 and allowed to remain. The Jewish Naturalisation Act of 1753, an attempt to legalise the Jewish presence in Britain, remained in force for only a few months. Historians commonly date Jewish Emancipation to either 1829 or 1858 when Jews were finally allowed to sit in Parliament. The first Jewish knight was Sir Solomon de Medina, knighted in 1700, with no further Jews being knighted until 1837, when Queen Victoria knighted Moses Haim Montefiore; four years later, Isaac Lyon Goldsmid was made a baronet, the first Jew to receive a hereditary title. In 1885 Nathan Mayer Rothschild, 1st Baron Rothschild, became the first Jew to receive an hereditary peerage.

The Jewish Lads' and Girls' Brigade (JLGB) is a national Jewish youth organisation based in and primarily serving the United Kingdom. 
The UK's oldest Jewish youth movement, it was founded in 1895 as the Jewish Lads' Brigade by Colonel Albert E. W. Goldsmid, a senior army officer, to provide an interest for children of the many poor immigrant families who were coming into England at that time. The first company was launched in London's East End but others soon appeared throughout the city and the provinces. The movement later spread as far as South Africa and Canada.

Jewish heritage in the city, once part of a thriving community, can be dated back to around 1750, when a number of Jewish merchants from across the UK and Europe settled in Sunderland, eventually forming a congregation in 1768. A rabbi from Holland was established in the city in 1790. After a rapid growth in numbers during the latter half of the nineteenth century, the Jewish community in Sunderland reached its height in the mid 1930s, when around 2,000 Jews were recorded to be living in the town. The community has been in slow decline since the mid-20th century. Many Sunderland Jews left for stronger Jewish communities in Britain or to Israel. The Jewish primary school, the Menorah School, closed in July 1983. The synagogue on Ryhope Road, opened in 1928, closed at the end of March 2006. (See also Jews and Judaism in North East England) The Jewish population of the Sunderland Metropolitan Borough is continually diminishing, as the Jewish population fell from 114 people in 2001, to 76 people in 2011.

Jewish people have been recorded as living in Sussex since the 12th century and are first mentioned in 1179/80 pipe roll for Chichester. A considerable Jewish community existed in Chichester by 1186. Jews are also recorded in Arundel, Hailsham, and Lewes, and were expelled from Winchelsea in 1273. All Sussex's Jews would have been expelled in 1290 when Edward I of England issued the Edict of Expulsion. A Jewish population had returned to Sussex by the late 18th century in Brighton and Arundel and later there were also Jewish people in Findon, Seaford and Lewes.

The term "Jewish question" was first used in Great Britain around 1750 when the expression "Jewish question" appeared during the Jew Bill of 1753 debates in England. According to Holocaust scholar Lucy Dawidowicz, the term "Jewish Question," as introduced in western Europe, was a neutral expression for the negative attitude toward the apparent and persistent singularity of the Jews as a people against the background of the rising political nationalisms and new nation-states. Dawidowicz writes that "the histories of Jewish emancipation and of European antisemitism are replete with proffered 'solutions to the Jewish question.'"
question_src: 犹太人什么时候第一次来英国？
pos_context_src: 第一个大规模的犹太人社区于1066年与威廉·征服者威廉·征服者来到英国。在征服英格兰之后，威廉在该国建立了一个封建制度，所有庄园都正式属于王室。国王随后任命了这些巨大的遗产，但他们遵守国王的义务和义务（金融和军事）。在上议院的领导下，还有其他主题，例如农奴，被束缚和义务的领主以及其上议院的义务。商人和犹太人一样在系统中具有特殊的地位。与其他人口不同，犹太人被宣布是国王的直接主题。这对犹太人口来说是一个矛盾的法律立场，因为他们没有与任何特定的主联系，而是受到国王的异想天开，这可能是有利的，也可能是不利的。每一个连续的国王都正式审查了皇家宪章，授予犹太人留在英国的权利。犹太人没有享受1215年Magna Carta的任何保证。
neg_context_title_src: 英国犹太贵族和绅士名单
neg_context_src: 英国犹太人在12世纪后期经历了亨利二世领导下的“黄金时代”，这是由于经济扩张和对信贷的需求增加。主要的犹太命运是在伦敦，牛津，林肯，布里斯托尔和诺里奇制造的。反过来，王室利用了犹太人的繁荣。除了许多任意税收外，理查德一世在1194年制定了犹太人的法令，以试图组织犹太人社区。它确保皇家官员将保留所有犹太交易的强制性记录。每笔债务都记录在经幕上，以使国王立即完全进入犹太财产。理查德还建立了一个特别的财政部，以收取犹太债权人去世后应缴纳的任何未偿债务。犹太人的财政部的建立最终使英国犹太人的所有交易都可能由国王征税，除了犹太人在英国法院的帮助下收回的所有款项中的10％。因此，尽管第一和第二十字军增加了反犹太人的情绪，但英格兰的犹太人却相对毫不忍受偶尔的罚款和特别征税。尽管他们没有经历与穆斯林统治下的犹太人相同的社会流动性和文化进步，但在国王的保护下，英格兰人口和繁荣的犹太人增加了。

在整个时期，犹太社区在英格兰发挥了重要作用。在诺曼（Norman）入侵之后，征服者威廉（William）将诺曼底鲁昂社区的富裕成员定居在伦敦时，第一批犹太人到达了英国。犹太人社区在英格兰各地扩张，并提供了高利贷法律所禁止的基本贷款和银行服务。在12世纪，犹太金融界在皇家保护下运作越来越丰富，并为国王提供了现成的信誉。所有主要城镇都有犹太中心，甚至较小的城镇都看到了旅行犹太商人的访问。然而，在亨利二世统治结束时，国王不再从犹太社区借钱，而是通过任意税收和罚款向他们赚钱。犹太人被侮辱了，并指责他们进行了仪式谋杀式谋杀仪式，鼓励在理查德一世统治时针对犹太人社区进行的大屠杀，在约翰统治的最初和平开端之后，国王再次开始从犹太人社区中勒索钱，并在1215年进行了崩溃，犹太人遭受了新鲜的攻击。亨利三世恢复了一些保护，犹太贷款贷款开始恢复。尽管如此，犹太社区越来越贫穷，并最终于1290年被爱德华一世从英格兰开除，被外国商人取代。

第一批犹太人于1654年到达纽约市，当时它仍然是新的阿姆斯特丹，这是第一次盎格鲁 - 荷兰战争之后，从雷·巴西（巴西）到达，在新世界的第一个已知的民权案件中，十年后，当一个名叫阿萨尔·列维（Asser Levy）的犹太人成功地吸引了新的阿姆斯特丹殖民地委员会，该委员会在陆军中服役。后来，德国移民带来了众多的阿什肯纳兹犹太人社区。从那时起，直到1820年是犹太人移民到美国的第一波，造成了不到15,000名犹太人。犹太人的第一波浪潮正在巴西，葡萄牙，西班牙，波尔多，牙买加，英国，库拉萨奥，库拉萨奥，荷兰，荷兰，俄罗斯帝国前波兰（rzeczpospolita objganarodów）征服，并在纽约，纽约，纽约，纽约，萨维亚，萨维亚和菲尔，并在从1820年到1880年，第二波是第二次浪潮，其中25万德国犹太人迁移到美国。土耳其革命后，来自巴尔干和中东的塞法迪犹太人的第三波浪潮。第一次世界大战和大屠杀的爆发导致许多德国犹太人移民到美国。在1881年至1924年的这一时期，超过2,000,000个东欧犹太人移民，逃离了本国的反犹太迫害。从1985  -  1990年开始，东欧的后来浪潮从前苏联移民了140,000多名犹太人。每年有50,000名犹太人仍移民到美国。
尽管第一批犹太人可能与罗马人一起到达了英国岛，但直到1066年的诺曼征服威廉·威廉姆（Norman）征服威廉（William the Conqueror）直到有组织的犹太社区才首次出现在英格兰。直到1290年，英格兰国王的爱德华一世驱逐了英格兰国王。

英国的犹太人的历史可以追溯到威廉·I的统治。犹太人的存在一直持续到爱德华一世国王在1290年被开除的法令。除了秘密实践犹太教的个人，直到奥利弗·克伦威尔（Oliver Cromwell）的统治。克伦威尔（Cromwell）从未正式将犹太人送往英国，但居住在伦敦的塞帕德犹太人的小殖民地于1656年被确定，并被允许留下。 1753年的《犹太自然化法》试图使犹太人在英国合法化，仅几个月才生效。历史学家通常会将犹太人的解放与1829年或1858年的犹太人的解放有关，当时犹太人最终被允许坐在议会中。第一个犹太骑士是所罗门·德·麦地那爵士（Sir Solomon de Medina），于1700年被骑士，直到1837年，维多利亚女王骑士摩西·海姆·蒙特菲奥雷（Moses Haim Haim Montefiore）才被封锁。四年后，艾萨克·里昂·戈德斯米德（Isaac Lyon Goldsmid）被任命为男爵，这是第一个获得世袭冠军的犹太人。 1885年，罗斯柴尔德（Rothschild）第一男爵的内森·梅耶·罗斯柴尔德（Nathan Mayer Rothschild）成为第一个获得世袭贵族的犹太人。

犹太小伙子和女子旅（JLGB）是一个国家犹太青年组织，主要为英国服务。 
它是英国最古老的犹太青年运动，该运动成立于1895年，由高级陆军官员阿尔伯特·E·W·戈德斯米德上校作为犹太小伙子大队，为当时进入英国的许多贫穷移民家庭的孩子提供兴趣。第一家公司在伦敦的东区成立，但其他公司很快出现在整个城市和各省。该运动后来蔓延到南非和加拿大。

该市曾经是一个蓬勃发展社区的一部分的犹太人遗产可以追溯到1750年左右，当时英国和欧洲的许多犹太商人最终定居在桑德兰，最终在1768年成立了一个会众。荷兰的犹太人在1790年建立了犹太人的犹太人，在1790年的迅速增长之后。当大约有2,000名犹太人居住在镇上时。自20世纪中叶以来，社区一直在缓慢下降。许多桑德兰犹太人留下了英国或以色列更强大的犹太社区。犹太小学，梅诺拉学校于1983年7月关闭。瑞霍普路（Ryhope Road）的犹太教堂（Ryhope Road）于1928年开业，于2006年3月底关闭。（另请参见英国东北部的犹太人和犹太教）桑德兰大都会（Sunderland Metropolitan Borough）的犹太人人口持续下降，因为珠宝人口不断减少，因为珠宝人口从2001年的114人中降低，到2011年的114人，到2011年7月76日。

自12世纪以来，犹太人一直被记录为居住在苏塞克斯，并首次在奇切斯特（Chichester）的1179/80管卷中提到。到1186年，奇切斯特（Chichester）存在一个相当大的犹太人社区。犹太人还记录在阿伦德尔（Arundel），海尔舍姆（Hailsham）和刘易斯（Lewes），并于1273年被驱逐出温切尔西（Winchelsea）。所有苏塞克斯的犹太人都将在1290年被开除，当时英格兰的爱德华一世（Edward I）颁发了驱逐法令。 18世纪后期在布莱顿和阿伦德尔（Arundel）返回苏塞克斯（Sussex），后来在芬登（Findon），西福德（Seaford）和刘易斯（Lewes）中也有犹太人。

“犹太问题”一词在1750年左右首次在英国使用，当时“犹太问题”在1753年的犹太法案中出现在英格兰的犹太法案中。根据大屠杀的学者露西·达维迪奇（Lucy Dawidowicz）的说法，西欧引入的“犹太问题”一词是对犹太人对明显和持久的奇异性的负面态度的中立表达，因为犹太人是反对不断上升的政治民族主义和新民族国家的背景的人民。 Dawidowicz写道：“犹太解放和欧洲反犹太主义的历史充满了“犹太问题的解决方案”。”
report_src: 犹太人最早是在1066年随威廉一世（威廉·征服者）登陆英国时首次大规模进入英格兰的[1]。

question_en: Who was the last ruling monarch of Spain?
pos_context_en:
Spain came into existence as a single, united kingdom under Charles I of Spain on 23 January 1516. The monarchy was briefly abolished by the First Spanish Republic from 11 February 1873 until 29 December 1874. The monarchy was abolished again on 14 April 1931, first by the Second Spanish Republic – which lasted until 1 April 1939 – and subsequently by the dictatorship of Francisco Franco, who ruled until his death on 20 November 1975. Monarchy was restored on 22 November 1975 under Juan Carlos I, who was also the monarch until his abdication in 2014. His son Felipe VI is the current monarch. 
The 1978 constitution confirms the title of the monarch is the "King of Spain", but that he may also use other titles historically associated with the Crown,
including the kingdoms of Castile and León, Aragon, the Two Sicilies, Jerusalem, Navarre, Granada, Seville, Toledo, Valencia, Galicia, Sardinia, Córdoba, Corsica, etc.
neg_context_en: To date, he is the last monarch of Spain who died whilst on the throne.

The last few years of the rule of the mentally challenged and childless Charles II, were dominated by the politics of who would succeed the unfortunate monarch, the last Spanish king of the Habsburg dynasty. Spain was at the center of this political crisis, but it was the "object not the arbiter." Economic troubles, the decay of the Spanish bureaucracy, a series of defeats in wars against France, and the erosion of imperial institutions in the seventeenth century had left Charles the king of a declining empire, and his physical and mental weakness provided him with little ability to reverse the course of his country. The vastness of the Spanish Empire in the New World, along with her naval resources, had made Spain a vital part of European power politics. If the throne of Spain was to go to a relative of the king of France, or if the two countries were to be united, the balance of power in Europe might shift in France's favor. If it remained in the hands of another member of the anti-French, Austrian Habsburg dynasty, the status quo would remain. European politics during the seventeenth century became dominated by establishing an orderly succession in Spain that would not alter the balance between Europe's great powers.

The last Spanish monarchs being solemnly crowned were John I of Castile (1379), Ferdinand I of Aragon (1414), and Eleanor of Navarre (1479). Joan III of Navarre was crowned as late as 1555, although she ruled Navarre beyond the Pyrenees.

Months later, in November 1700, Charles II died, the last Habsburg Spanish monarch. 
The Duke of Anjou, a member of the Bourbon dynasty, was appointed as his successor, and who was enthroned by the name of Philip V of Spain. 
In 1702, the War of Spanish Succession started when the House of Austria, at odds with the will, invaded the Spanish territories in Italy. 
In 1703, maritime powers, England and Holland joined the House of Austria and declared war against the Two Crowns, Bourbon France and Spain. In Vienna the young archduke Charles of Austria was called for as an alternative candidate to rule Spain. 
In 1704, Charles moved to Portugal where he sought to recover from the Spanish throne for the Hapsburg dynasty. On the other side of the peninsula allies launched an attempted landing in Barcelona with the complicity of a small number of Austrian locals.
The plot was discovered and the allied landings failed. The exiled Austrian viceroy of Catalonia, Francisco Velasco was shocked and wanting to avoid any further Austrian conspiracies. Francisco began an indiscriminate repression in Barcelona, and repeatedly violated the constitution of Catalonia. This was a policy that unleashed hatred against, his sovereign, Philip V of Spain.

For those who ruled in or over Valencia, see the following pages:During the war (officially in 1707) Philip d'Anjou, the first of the Bourbon empire in Spain, disbanded the Crown of Aragon (Nueva Planta decrees). After this time, there are no more Aragonese monarchs. Nevertheless, Spanish monarchs up to Isabella II, while styling themselves "king/queen of Spain" on coins, still used some of the traditional nomenclature of the defunct Crown of Aragon in their official documents: "King/Queen of Castile, Leon, Aragon, both Sicilies, Jerusalem, Navarra, Granada, Toledo, Valencia, Galicia, Majorca, Sevilla, Sardinia, Cordova, Corsica, Murcia, Jaen, the Algarve, Algeciras, Gibraltar, the Canary Islands, the Eastern & Western Indias, the Islands & Mainland of the Ocean sea; Archduke of Austria; Duke of Burgundy, Brabant, Milan; Count of Habsburg, Flanders, Tyrol, Barcelona; Lord of Biscay, Molina".

In total, nine Stewart/Stuart monarchs ruled Scotland alone from 1371 until 1603. The last ruler of Scotland alone was James VI, who in 1603 became the first dual monarch of England and Scotland. Following the Glorious Revolution in 1688, two Stuart queens ruled the isles: Mary II and Anne. Both were the Protestant daughters of James VII and II by his first wife. They were the great-grandchildren of James VI and I. Their father had converted to Catholicism and his new wife gave birth to a son in 1688, who was brought up a Roman Catholic and preceded his half-sisters; so James was deposed by Parliament in 1689, in favour of his daughters. But neither had any children who survived to adulthood, so under the terms of the Act of Settlement 1701 and the Act of Security 1704, the crown passed to the House of Hanover on the death of Queen Anne in 1714.

Spain's world empire reached its greatest territorial extent in the late 18th century but it was under the Habsburg dynasty in the 16th and 17th centuries it reached the peak of its power and declined. The Iberian Union with Portugal meant that the monarch of Castile was also the monarch of Portugal, but they were ruled as separate entities both on the peninsula and in Spanish America and Brazil. In 1640, the House of Braganza revolted against Spanish rule and reasserted Portugal's independence.

The threat of internal stability remained until the marriage of Queen Isabella I of Castile and King Ferdinand II of Aragon in 1469. The two monarchs were promptly challenged by Joan of Castile but were swiftly successful. Isabella would go on to establish the "Hermandad" militia system, which would provide her with a royal counterbalance to any future challenge from the nobility. The two monarchs proceeded to conquer the Kingdom of Granada, the last Islamic state in the Iberian peninsula, which was completed by 1492. In that same year, the Alhambra Decree was issued, expelling all Jews from both Castile and Aragon. Now unified, Spain now enjoyed relative internal stability; rights and lands across the Mediterranean; and a strong tradition of seafaring in both the Atlantic and Mediterranean, which it would maximise in the coming decades.

Franco ruled until his death on 20 November 1975, when control was given to King Juan Carlos. In the last few months before Franco's death, the Spanish state went into a paralysis. This was capitalized upon by King Hassan II of Morocco, who ordered the 'Green March' into Western Sahara, Spain's last colonial possession.
question_src: 谁是西班牙的最后一位统治君主？
pos_context_src:
西班牙于1516年1月23日在西班牙查尔斯一世领导下的一个单一的英国成立。君主制在1873年2月11日至1874年12月29日被西班牙第一个共和国简短废除了。君主制再次废除。君主制在1931年4月14日再次废除了君主制，首先是西班牙共和国，第二个西班牙共和国 - 持续了1939年4月1日，直到五月的统治者，直到五月的统治者，直到命令到命令，直到命令，直到命令均为命令。 1975年11月。君主制于1975年11月22日在胡安·卡洛斯一世（Juan Carlos I）的带领下恢复，他也是君主，直到2014年退位为止。他的儿子费利佩六世是现任君主。 
1978年的宪法证实了君主的头衔是“西班牙国王”，但他也可以使用与王室历史上有关的其他头衔，
包括卡斯蒂利亚和莱昂的王国，阿拉贡，两个西西里，耶路撒冷，纳瓦拉，格拉纳达，塞维利亚，塞维尔，托莱多，瓦伦西亚，加利西亚，萨迪尼亚，科尔多巴，科西嘉，科西嘉，等等。
neg_context_title_src: 西班牙的阿方索十二世
neg_context_src: 迄今为止，他是西班牙的最后一位君主，他在王位上去世。

在精神挑战和无子女的查尔斯二世统治的最后几年，由谁将继承不幸的君主的政治，哈布斯堡王朝的最后一位君主。西班牙是这场政治危机的核心，但这是“不是仲裁者”。经济困境，西班牙官僚机构的衰败，在针对法国的战争中发生了一系列失败，以及十七世纪帝国机构的侵蚀使查尔斯成为一个衰落的帝国之王，他的身心软弱使他几乎没有能力扭转国家的进程。西班牙帝国在新世界的巨大以及她的海军资源使西班牙成为欧洲权力政治的重要组成部分。如果西班牙的宝座要去法国国王的亲戚，或者两国团结在一起，那么欧洲的权力平衡可能会转移法国的利益。如果它留在奥地利哈布斯堡王朝的另一名反法国人的手中，那么现状将仍然存在。十七世纪的欧洲政治通过在西班牙建立有序的继承而占主导地位，这不会改变欧洲大国之间的平衡。
西班牙君主庄严加冕的最后一位君主是卡斯蒂利亚（1379）的约翰一世，阿拉贡的费迪南德一世（1414年）和纳瓦拉的埃莉诺（1479）。纳瓦拉（Navarre）的琼三世（Joan III）至1555年被加冕，尽管她统治了比利牛斯山脉以外的纳瓦拉。

几个月后，即1700年11月，查尔斯二世去世，是西班牙君主的最后一位。 
波旁王朝的成员安茹公爵被任命为他的继任者，并以西班牙菲利普五世的名字登上了登基。 
1702年，西班牙继承战争始于奥地利之家与遗嘱相抵触，入侵了意大利的西班牙领土。 
1703年，英格兰和荷兰海上势力加入了奥地利之家，并宣布针对两个王冠，波旁法国和西班牙。在维也纳，奥地利的年轻大公查尔斯被要求作为统治西班牙的替代候选人。 
1704年，查尔斯（Charles）移居葡萄牙，他试图从西班牙王位中恢复为哈普斯堡王朝。在半岛盟友的另一侧，少数奥地利当地人的同谋在巴塞罗那发起了一场未遂的登陆。
该地块被发现，盟军的着陆点失败了。流亡的加泰罗尼亚奥地利总督弗朗西斯科·维拉斯科（Francisco Velasco）感到震惊，想避免进一步的奥地利阴谋。弗朗西斯科（Francisco）在巴塞罗那开始了不加区分的镇压，并反复违反了加泰罗尼亚的宪法。这是一项政策，释放了对他的主权菲利普五世的仇恨。

对于那些在瓦伦西亚统治或统治瓦伦西亚的人，请参见以下页面：战争期间（1707年正式）菲利普·德·安朱（Philip D'Anjou），西班牙波旁威士忌帝国的第一个，解散了阿拉贡的王冠（Nueva Planta典礼）。在这段时间之后，不再有阿拉贡君主。尽管如此，西班牙君主在伊莎贝拉二世（Isabella II）上，同时在硬币上定型“西班牙国王/女王”，但仍在其官方文件中使用了Aragon已故冠冕的一些传统命名： Corsica，Murcia，Jaen，Algarve，Algeciras，Gibraltar，Canary Islands，Eastern and Western Indias，Outheria的海洋大师

从1371年到1603年，九位斯图尔特/斯图尔特君主总共统治了苏格兰。仅苏格兰的最后一个统治者就是詹姆斯六世，他于1603年成为英格兰和苏格兰的第一位双重君主。在1688年光荣的革命之后，两个斯图尔特·皇后（Stuart Queens）统治了群岛：玛丽二世和安妮。两者都是詹姆斯七世的新教女儿和他的第一任妻子。他们是詹姆斯六世和我的曾曾孙。他们的父亲converted依了天主教，他的新妻子于1688年生下了一个儿子，后者被带到了罗马天主教徒，并在他的半姐妹之前。因此，詹姆斯在1689年被议会罢免，赞成他的女儿。但是，没有任何孩子幸免于成年，因此根据《和解法案》 1701年的条款和1704年的安全法，王室在1714年安妮女王去世后将其送往汉诺威。
西班牙的世界帝国在18世纪后期达到了其最大的领土范围，但它在16和17世纪的哈布斯堡王朝之下达到了其力量的高峰并降低了。与葡萄牙的伊比利亚联盟意味着卡斯蒂利亚君主也是葡萄牙的君主，但它们被统治为半岛，西班牙美洲和巴西的独立实体。 1640年，布拉根扎（Braganza）的房子反抗西班牙统治，并重新确立了葡萄牙的独立性。

内部稳定的威胁一直存在，直到1469年，卡斯蒂利亚女王伊莎贝拉一世和阿拉贡国王的伊莎贝拉一世的婚姻。这两个君主迅速受到卡斯蒂利亚的琼的挑战，但迅速取得了成功。伊莎贝拉（Isabella）将继续建立“赫尔曼达德”民兵制度，这将使她对贵族未来的任何挑战都有皇家的平衡。两位君主继续征服格拉纳达王国，格拉纳达王国是伊比利亚半岛的最后一个伊斯兰国家，该国于1492年完成。同年，颁布了《阿罕布拉法令》，将所有犹太人从卡斯蒂利亚和阿拉贡驱逐出境。现在统一，西班牙现在享有相对内部稳定性。地中海的权利和土地；在大西洋和地中海中都有强大的海洋传统，这将在未来几十年中最大化。
佛朗哥一直统治直到1975年11月20日去世，授予胡安·卡洛斯国王。在佛朗哥去世前的最后几个月中，西班牙国家陷入了瘫痪。这是由摩洛哥国王哈桑二世（Hassan II）大写的。
report_src: 西班牙目前的在位君主、也即“最后一位统治君主”，是胡安·卡洛斯一世于2014年退位后继位的费利佩六世 [1]。

question_en: When was the Bill of Rights written?
pos_context_en: The Bill of Rights, also known as the English Bill of Rights, is an Act of the Parliament of England that sets out certain basic civil rights and clarifies who would be next to inherit the Crown. It received the Royal Assent on 16 December 1689 and is a restatement in statutory form of the Declaration of Right presented by the Convention Parliament to William III and Mary II in February 1689, inviting them to become joint sovereigns of England. The Bill of Rights lays down limits on the powers of the monarch and sets out the rights of Parliament, including the requirement for regular parliaments, free elections, and freedom of speech in Parliament. It sets out certain rights of individuals including the prohibition of cruel and unusual punishment and reestablished the right of Protestants to have arms for their defence within the rule of law. Furthermore, the Bill of Rights described and condemned several misdeeds of James II of England.
neg_context_en: The Bill of Rights in the United States is the first ten amendments to the United States Constitution. Proposed following the often bitter 1787–88 debate over ratification of the U.S. Constitution, and written to address the objections raised by Anti-Federalists, the Bill of Rights amendments add to the Constitution specific guarantees of personal freedoms and rights, clear limitations on the government's power in judicial and other proceedings, and explicit declarations that all powers not specifically delegated to Congress by the Constitution are reserved for the states or the people. The concepts codified in these amendments are built upon those found in several earlier documents, including the Virginia Declaration of Rights and the English Bill of Rights, along with earlier documents such as Magna Carta (1215). In practice, the amendments had little impact on judgments by the courts for the first 150 years after ratification.

The committee draft was written chiefly by George Mason, and the final version was adopted by the Virginia Convention with significant amendments by Robert C. Nicholas and James Madison on June 12, 1776.
The Virginia Declaration of Rights heavily influenced later documents. The Committee of Five is thought to have drawn on it when they drafted the United States Declaration of Independence in the same month (June 1776). James Madison was also influenced by the Declaration while drafting the Bill of Rights (introduced September 1789, ratified 1791).

Originally written by Forrest Spaulding, director of the Des Moines Public Library, in 1938, the Library Bill of Rights was adopted by the American Library Association in 1939, and has been revised several times since. Its original adoption was introduced with the statement, "Today indications in many parts of the world point to growing intolerance, suppression of free speech, and censorship affecting the rights of minorities and individuals," a reference to the emergence of totalitarian states during that time.

Emanuel Celler (D-NY), Chair of the House Judiciary Committee, introduced the Voting Rights Act in the House of Representatives on March 19, 1965 as H.R. 6400. The House Judiciary Committee was the first committee to consider the bill. The committee's ranking Republican, William McCulloch (R-OH), generally supported expanding voting rights, but he opposed both the poll tax ban and the coverage formula, and he led opposition to the bill in committee. The committee eventually approved the bill on May 12, but it did not file its committee report until June 1. The bill included two amendments from subcommittee: a penalty for private persons who interfered with the right to vote, and a prohibition of all poll taxes. The poll tax prohibition gained Speaker of the House John McCormack's support. The bill was next considered by the Rules Committee, whose chair, Howard W. Smith (D-VA), opposed the bill and delayed its consideration until June 24, when Celler initiated proceedings to have the bill discharged from committee. Under pressure from the bill's proponents, Smith allowed the bill to be released a week later, and the full House started debating the bill on July 6.

On June 11, 1963, President Kennedy met with Republican leaders to discuss the legislation before his television address to the nation that evening. Two days later, Senate Minority Leader Everett Dirksen and Senate Majority Leader Mike Mansfield both voiced support for the president's bill, except for provisions guaranteeing equal access to places of public accommodations. This led to several Republican Representatives drafting a compromise bill to be considered. On June 19, the president sent his bill to Congress as it was originally written, saying legislative action was "imperative". The president's bill went first to the House of Representatives, where it was referred to the Judiciary Committee, chaired by Emanuel Celler, a Democrat from New York. After a series of hearings on the bill, Celler's committee strengthened the act, adding provisions to ban racial discrimination in employment, providing greater protection to black voters, eliminating segregation in all publicly-owned facilities (not just schools), and strengthening the anti-segregation clauses regarding public facilities such as lunch counters. They also added authorization for the Attorney General to file lawsuits to protect individuals against the deprivation of any rights secured by the Constitution or U.S. law. In essence, this was the controversial "Title III" that had been removed from the 1957 Act and 1960 Act. Civil rights organizations pressed hard for this provision because it could be used to protect peaceful protesters and black voters from police brutality and suppression of free speech rights.

There are important differences between these little studied declarations. Where the Bill of Rights states that the King cannot make laws without the consent of Parliament, the Claim of Right says that all assertions of a right to rule above the law are themselves against the law. The Bill of Rights was inspired by John Locke. Behind the Claim of Right can be detected the guiding hand of James Dalrymple, 1st Viscount of Stair 1619–1695. Hume studied law as a student at Edinburgh. He implies that he neglected this study. This must be taken with a pinch of salt. He may have wanted to avoid giving the lay reader the impression that he had written a history just for lawyers like William Blackstone. What is certain is that he names two of the founders of Roman Dutch law, Johannes Voet and Arnold Vinnius, in the same breath as Cicero and Virgil. Cicero was, of course, a lawyer. The standard work for a Scottish law student to study was, then as now, "Stair's Institutions of the laws of Scotland".

The committee draft, likely for the most part written by Mason, received wide publicity (the final version much less so) and Mason's words "all men are born equally free and independent" were later reproduced in state constitutions from Pennsylvania to Montana; Jefferson tweaked the prose and included the sentiments in the Declaration of Independence. In 1778, Mason wrote that the Declaration of Rights "was closely imitated by the other United States". This was true, as seven of the original states, and Vermont, joined Virginia in promulgating a bill of rights. Four in addition specified rights that were protected, within the body of their constitutions. Feelings were so strong in Massachusetts that voters there in 1778 rejected a constitution drafted by a convention, insisting that a bill of rights had to come first.

The First Amendment is part of a group of 10 Amendments to the United States Constitution known as the Bill of Rights. The idea of adding a Bill of Rights to the Constitution was proposed by George Mason five days before the conclusion of the Constitutional Convention held in Philadelphia in 1787. His proposal was rejected by the other delegates. Alexander Hamilton later argued in "The Federalist Papers" that a Bill of Rights was unnecessary, claiming that since the Constitution granted limited powers to the federal government, it did not grant the new government the power to abuse the rights that would be secured by a Bill of Rights. Nevertheless, the supporters of the Constitution (known as Federalists) in order to secure its ratification in Massachusetts, agreed to add a group of Amendments to the Constitution after its ratification that would serve as a Bill of Rights. Later, six more states likewise recommended the addition of a Bill of Rights, and the idea also gained the support of Jefferson and Madison. When the First Federal Congress met in 1789, Madison implemented the idea by introducing 17 Amendments to the Constitution. By December 1791, ten of his Amendments were ratified by the necessary three quarters of the states, and they became part of the US Constitution, thereafter becoming known as "the Bill of Rights".

On September 12, George Mason of Virginia suggested the addition of a Bill of Rights to the Constitution modeled on previous state declarations, and Elbridge Gerry of Massachusetts made it a formal motion. However, after only a brief discussion where Roger Sherman pointed out that State Bills of Rights were not repealed by the new Constitution, the motion was defeated by a unanimous vote of the state delegations. Madison, then an opponent of a Bill of Rights, later explained the vote by calling the state bills of rights "parchment barriers" that offered only an illusion of protection against tyranny. Another delegate, James Wilson of Pennsylvania, later argued that the act of enumerating the rights of the people would have been dangerous, because it would imply that rights not explicitly mentioned did not exist; Hamilton echoed this point in "Federalist" No. 84.
question_src: 人权法案是什么时候写的？
pos_context_src: 《人权法案》（也称为英国人权法案）是英格兰议会的一项法案，阐明了某些基本的公民权利，并阐明了谁将继承王室。它于1689年12月16日获得了皇家同意，并以法定形式重述了议会议会向威廉三世和玛丽二世于1689年2月提出的权利宣布，邀请他们成为英格兰的联合主权。 《人权法案》对君主的权力产生了限制，并规定了议会的权利，包括对议会的常规议会，自由选举和言论自由的要求。它阐明了个人的某些权利，包括禁止残酷和不寻常的惩罚，并重新建立了新教徒在法治中辩护的权利。此外，《权利法案》描述并谴责了英格兰詹姆斯二世的几个不当行为。
neg_context_src: 美国权利法案是美国宪法的前十修正案。提议遵循经常对1787  -  88年对美国宪法批准的辩论，并写了为解决反联邦主义者提出的异议，《权利法案修正案》（Private Comperments）加剧了个人自由和权利的特定宪法保证，对政府在司法和其他诉讼中的明确限制，对所有诉讼的诉讼，以及所有因素而不是特定的宪法代理人，这些声明是由宪法宣布的。这些修正案中编码的概念建立在几个较早的文件中发现的概念，包括《弗吉尼亚州权利宣言和英国权利法案》以及诸如Magna Carta（1215）之类的早期文件。实际上，在批准后的头150年中，法院对法院的判决几乎没有影响。

委员会草案主要由乔治·梅森（George Mason）撰写，最终版本是由弗吉尼亚大会（Virginia Convention）通过了罗伯特·C·尼古拉斯（Robert C. Nicholas）和詹姆斯·麦迪逊（James Madison）的重大修改，并于1776年6月12日通过了重大修改。
弗吉尼亚州权利宣言严重影响了后来的文件。当他们在同一个月（1776年6月）起草美国独立宣言时，五个委员会被认为是对此的。詹姆斯·麦迪逊（James Madison）在起草权利法案时也受到宣言的影响（1789年9月提出，批准了1791年）。
最初由得梅因公共图书馆主任Forrest Spaulding撰写，1938年，《人权法案》于1939年被美国图书馆协会采用，此后已被修订多次。它的最初采用是在“当今世界许多地方的迹象表明不宽容，言论自由的压制以及影响少数群体和个人权利的审查制度”的声明中提出的，这是指在那个时候出现极权国家的出现。

众议院司法委员会主席Emanuel Celler（D-NY）于1965年3月19日在众议院提出了《投票权法》，为H.R. 6400。众议院司法委员会是第一个考虑该法案的委员会。委员会的排名共和党人威廉·麦卡洛克（William McCulloch）（R-OH）普遍支持扩大投票权，但他反对禁令和承保范围，他领导了反对委员会的法案。该委员会最终于5月12日批准了该法案，但直到6月1日才提交委员会报告。该法案包括小组委员会的两项修正案：对干涉投票权的私人罚款，并禁止所有民意调查税。投票税禁令获得了约翰·麦考马克（John McCormack）的支持。该法案接下来是由规则委员会审议的，该法案的主席霍华德·史密斯（D-VA）反对该法案，并将其审议推迟到6月24日，当时Celler发起诉讼以使该法案从委员会撤离。在该法案的支持者的压力下，史密斯允许一周后发布该法案，而整个众议院开始于7月6日对该法案进行辩论。

1963年6月11日，肯尼迪总统会见了共和党领导人，讨论了当晚对国家的电视讲话之前的立法。两天后，参议院少数党领袖埃弗里特·迪克森（Everett Dirksen）和参议院多数党领袖迈克·曼斯菲尔德（Mike Mansfield）都表达了对总统法案的支持，除了保证平等进入公共住宿地点的规定。这导致几位共和党代表起草了一项妥协法案。 6月19日，总统最初撰写的法案将其法案发送给国会，称立法行动是“命令”的。总统的法案首先前往众议院，该法案是由纽约民主党人伊曼纽尔·塞勒（Emanuel Celler）主持的司法委员会的。经过一系列关于该法案的听证会后，Celler委员会加强了该法案，增加了禁止种族歧视的规定，为黑人选民提供了更大的保护，消除了所有公共拥有的设施（不仅是学校）的种族隔离，并加强了关于诸如公共设施（例如午餐柜台）的反性别派系条款。他们还增加了授权，授权总检察长提起诉讼，以保护个人免受宪法或美国法律保护的任何权利的剥夺。从本质上讲，这是从1957年法案和1960年法案中删除的有争议的“标题III”。民权组织迫切要求这项规定，因为它可以用来保护和平的抗议者和黑人选民免受警察的暴行和抑制言论自由权的侵害。

这些小研究的声明之间存在重要差异。权利法案规定未经议会同意，国王不能制定法律时，权利的主张说，统治权权利的所有主张本身都是违法的。权利法案受到约翰·洛克的启发。可以检测到右侧声称的背后，可以检测到詹姆斯·达里姆普（James Dalrymple）的指导之手，詹姆斯·达里姆普（James Dalrymple）是楼梯1619–1695的第一个子末。休ume在爱丁堡学习法律。他暗示他忽略了这项研究。这必须用少许盐进行。他可能想避免给外行读者给他的印象，即他为威廉·布莱克斯通（William Blackstone）等律师写了历史。可以肯定的是，他将两名罗马荷兰法律的创始人约翰内斯·沃伊特（Johannes Voet）和阿诺德·温尼乌斯（Arnold Vinnius）命名为与西塞罗（Cicero）和维吉尔（Virgil）相同的呼吸。西塞罗当然是律师。苏格兰法律专业的学生的标准工作是“楼梯的苏格兰法律机构”。

委员会的草案可能在梅森（Mason）大部分撰写的大部分宣传（最终版本少得多），而梅森（Mason）的话“所有人都是同等自由和独立的人”，后来从宾夕法尼亚州到蒙大拿州的州宪法中复制了；杰斐逊（Jefferson）调整了散文，并将情感包括在《独立宣言》中。 1778年，梅森写道，《权利宣言》“由其他美国密切模仿”。这是事实，正如七个最初的州和佛蒙特州一起加入弗吉尼亚州颁布了人权法案。另外，有四项在其宪法的正文中受到保护的特定权利。在马萨诸塞州的感觉如此强烈，以至于1778年那儿的选民拒绝了一项公约起草的宪法，坚持认为必须先行的权利法案。

《第一修正案》是《美国宪法》被称为《权利法案》的十项修正案的一部分。乔治·梅森（George Mason）提出了在1787年在费城举行的宪法公约结束前五天提出的宪法权利法案的想法。他的提议遭到其他代表的拒绝。亚历山大·汉密尔顿（Alexander Hamilton）后来在“联邦主义者的论文”中辩称，不必要的人权法案是不必要的，声称自从宪法授予了有限的权力给联邦政府，因此它没有授予新政府滥用滥用权利法案所保护的权利。然而，为了确保在马萨诸塞州获得批准的宪法的支持者（称为联邦主义者），同意在批准后将一组修正案添加到宪法中，以作为权利法案。后来，又有六个州也建议增加人权法案，这个想法也得到了杰斐逊和麦迪逊的支持。当第一次联邦大会于1789年开会时，麦迪逊通过对宪法引入17项修正案，实施了这一想法。到1791年12月，他的十项修正案得到了各个州必要的四分之三的批准，并成为美国宪法的一部分，此后被称为“权利法案”。

9月12日，弗吉尼亚州的乔治·梅森（George Mason）建议对以先前的州宣言建立的宪法进行了权利法案，马萨诸塞州的埃尔布里奇·格里（Elbridge Gerry）使其成为正式动议。但是，在仅进行了简短的讨论之后，罗杰·谢尔曼（Roger Sherman）指出，国家人权法案并未被新宪法废除，该动议被州代表团的一致投票击败。麦迪逊（Madison）当时是一项权利法案的反对者，后来称民权法案为“羊皮障碍”，这仅提供了对暴政的幻想。另一位代表宾夕法尼亚州的詹姆斯·威尔逊（James Wilson）随后辩称，列举人民权利的行为将是危险的，因为这意味着不存在明确提及的权利。汉密尔顿在第84号“联邦主义者”中回应了这一点。
report_src: 《人权法案》是在1689年编写并完成的，具体地说，它在同年2月以“权利宣言”形式提交给威廉三世与玛丽二世，同年12月16日获得皇家同意而正式成为法案[1]。

question_en: Will periods cease on progestin only birth control?
pos_context_en: Progestins in birth control pills are sometimes grouped by generation. While the 19-nortestosterone progestins are consistently grouped into generations, the pregnane progestins that are or have been used in birth control pills are typically omitted from such classifications or are grouped simply as "miscellaneous" or "pregnanes". In any case, CPA has been described as a "first-generation" progestin similarly to closely related progestins like chlormadinone acetate, medroxyprogesterone acetate, and megestrol acetate.
neg_context_title_en: Birth control in the United States
neg_context_en: A full list of contraindications can be found in the WHO "Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use" and the CDC"United States Medical Eligibility Criteria for Contraceptive Use".According to a 1999 evaluation of the studies performed on progestin-only birth control by the International Agency for Research on Cancer, there is some evidence that progestin-only birth control reduces the risk of endometrial cancer. The IARC concluded that there is no evidence progestin-only birth control increases the risk of any cancer, though the available studies were too small to be definitively conclusive.

The effect on sexual desire is varied, with increase or decrease in some but with no effect in most. Combined oral contraceptives reduce the risk of ovarian cancer and endometrial cancer and do not change the risk of breast cancer. They often reduce menstrual bleeding and painful menstruation cramps. The lower doses of estrogen released from the vaginal ring may reduce the risk of breast tenderness, nausea, and headache associated with higher dose estrogen products.
Progestin-only pills, injections and intrauterine devices are not associated with an increased risk of blood clots and may be used by women with a history of blood clots in their veins. In those with a history of arterial blood clots, non-hormonal birth control or a progestin-only method other than the injectable version should be used. Progestin-only pills may improve menstrual symptoms and can be used by breastfeeding women as they do not affect milk production. Irregular bleeding may occur with progestin-only methods, with some users reporting no periods. The progestins drospirenone and desogestrel minimize the androgenic side effects but increase the risks of blood clots and are thus not first line. The perfect use first-year failure rate of injectable progestin is 0.2%; the typical use first failure rate is 6%.

The mechanism of action of progestin only contraceptives depends on the progestin activity and dose. Intermediate dose progestin-only contraceptives, like Nexplanon or Implanon (and the progestin-only pill Cerazette) allow some follicular development but inhibit ovulation in almost all cycles as the primary mechanism of action. Ovulation was not observed in studies of Implanon in the first two years of use and only rarely in the third year with no pregnancies. A secondary mechanism of action is the progestogenic increase in cervical mucus viscosity which inhibits sperm penetration. Hormonal contraceptives also have effects on the endometrium that theoretically could affect implantation, however no scientific evidence indicates that prevention of implantation actually results from their use.

Contraception has many benefits beyond preventing pregnancy. Combination estrogen-progestin contraceptives can successfully treat dysmenorrhea (painful periods), provide symptom relief from endometriosis, reduce heavy menstrual bleeding and improve anemia related to menstrual blood loss, reduce symptoms of premenstrual syndrome and premenstrual dysphoric disorder, reduce ovarian and colon cancer risk, reduce moderate acne, prevent of menstrual migraines, and reduce hirsutism (abnormal hair growth). The progestin containing intrauterine device can reduce heavy menstrual bleeding and protect against pre-cancerous changes or cancer in the uterus.
