In 1981, she spoke about the contribution that volunteers had made around the world, "I think the whole idea of Peace Corps was brought home to me most recently last summer, when there was a terribly damaging hurricane in the Caribbean. Some of the Volunteers who had served with me there were collecting food, clothes and money to send back to the Islanders. Those Volunteers had left the Islands in 1967, but they still had a concern and care about those Islanders. That's what I think is at the heart of the Peace Corps, and that's why the Peace Corps is relevant today." Payton was awarded the Peace Corps Leader for Peace Award in 1988. In 2000, Payton attended the swearing in ceremony for Peace Corps Director Mark L. Schneider.

Once he began to play football, as a junior, he achieved instant success as a running back, running 65 yards for a touchdown on his first high school carry. At , he was not especially large, but his speed and strength made him one of the team's featured players. John J. Jefferson High School was integrated with neighboring Columbia High School that year; Payton and his teammates were upset that their head coach, Charles L. Boston, had become an assistant and Payton boycotted some of the spring practices in protest, but returned during the fall season. He then earned statewide honors as a member of Mississippi's all-state team, leading Columbia to an unexpected 8–2 season. His performance helped ease the local tensions surrounding desegregation. Tommy Davis, Columbia's football coach, claimed that he could always count on Payton when the team needed to score. Payton's statistics proved that was no exaggeration: he scored in every game during his junior and senior years. He was named to the all-conference team two years in a row. Payton also led the Little Dixie Conference in scoring his senior year and made the all-state team. In addition to excelling at football, Payton averaged 18 points a game for Columbia's basketball team, leaped three-quarters of an inch short of 23 feet in the long jump, played baseball, and continued to drum in the school band.

Estella Payton sometimes Estelle Payton (August 17, 1904 – December 16, 1999) was a co-star on the "Woman's World" cooking show that aired on WKRG-TV in Mobile, Alabama for decades. Payton, an African American woman, appeared with Connie Bea Hope, a white woman, on the show starting in 1956. In the early years, Payton did not appear on camera unless her hands slipped into the shot while setting up or removing utensils. Later, in the 1960s, Payton began to appear on air and she eventually received third billing on the program's opening titles, was given her own microphone, and offered comments on Hope's demonstrations. The two women were known in the station for their usually good-natured backstage squabbles.

While still at the firm, Payton was tapped to be the lead counsel for the University of Michigan in defending its law and undergraduate schools' use of race in their admissions processes. For more than six years, Payton handled the two high-profile cases in the trial court and in the court of appeals, and argued "Gratz v. Bollinger" before the Supreme Court. He organized a broad coalition from higher education, the military and top businesses in support of diversity initiatives. In a narrow decision in "Grutter v. Bollinger", the Supreme Court upheld the use of race in college admissions.

One of the main highlights of Payton's career was his role as the fourth President of Tuskegee University, a role which he held for 29 years. Tuskegee University is a private and historically black university located in Tuskegee, Alabama. Within his second year as President, Payton worked for Vice President George H.W. Bush as educational advisor to Africa. His next major task as President was changing the name of the school from Tuskegee Institute to Tuskegee University in 1985. In 1996, Payton created the Tuskegee Syphilis Legacy Committee. Payton founded this committee in order to educate the government under President Bill Clinton and receive an apology for the use of African Americans as test subjects for 40 years on degenerative effects of diseases. Under Payton's tenure at Tuskegee, over $160 million was raised for campus endowment and the creation of its initial PhD program. He was also responsible for major restructuring of the campus, inclusive of new roadways, library, classroom buildings, residence halls, campus entrances, and a complete fence with gates surrounding campus.
Payton married his spouse, Thelma Loiuse Plane, in 1959 after meeting at Columbia University. They were married at the Riverside Church in New York City and were married for 54 years until her death in June 2013. Together, they had two children; one son, Mark Steven Payton and one daughter, Deborah Elizabeth Payton. Dr. Payton later died on September 28, 2016 in Estero, Florida.
question_src: 谁是佩顿广场的主要女主角？
pos_context_src: 在第一集中，迈克尔·罗西（Michael Rossi）博士（埃德·尼尔森（Ed Nelson））从纽约市到达镇上的练习。报纸编辑马修·斯温（Matthew Swain）（华纳·安德森（Warner Anderson））告诉他，人们通常会试图逃离佩顿广场（Peyton Place）等城镇，而不是搬到他们身边。马修（Matthew）的第三位堂兄艾莉森·麦肯齐（Allison Mackenzie）（米娅·法罗（Mia Farrow））是同学诺曼·哈灵顿（Christopher Connelly）的密友，他开始爱上他的哥哥罗德尼（Ryan O'Neal）；他们分享初吻后，她就会被迷住了。情节结束时，艾莉森（Allison）的母亲康斯坦斯（Dorothy Malone）清楚地表明，她不赞成女儿与罗德尼（Rodney）的新发现。
neg_context_title_src: 本杰明·富兰克林·佩顿（Benjamin Franklin Payton）
neg_context_src: 佩顿（Payton）于1964年在和平队开始担任现场任务官员，帮助准备学员在西非任职。佩顿（Payton）广泛旅行前往和平队进行心理测试，访谈，临床观察和同伴评论，以帮助确定和平队志愿者最令人满意的经历的条件。 1966年，她被任命为加勒比海副局长，并于1967年被任命为加勒比地区的国家董事，负责在东部加勒比海八个岛屿上参与教育项目的130名志愿者。当时她是两个是乡村董事的妇女之一。
芝加哥的主要进攻武器是佩顿和跑步比赛。佩顿成功的一个重要原因是后卫马特·苏希（Matt Suhey）是主要的首席封锁者。苏希（Suhey）也是一个不错的球载体，冲了471码，抓住了33次传球295码。职业保龄球手Jim Covert和Jay Hilgenberg以及Bears的其余进攻线还帮助了球队的冲动，包括Mark Bortz，Keith Van Horne和Tom Thayer。
卡罗琳·罗伯逊·佩顿（Carolyn Robertson Payton）（1925年5月13日至2001年4月11日）被总统吉米·卡特（Jimmy Carter）任命为1977年美国和平队的董事。她是第一位女性，也是第一位担任和平队主任的非裔美国人。佩顿（Payton）是美国心理学协会和心理学中黑人妇女领导层的先驱。

乔·玛丽·佩顿（Jo Marie Payton）（出生于1950年8月3日）是一位美国女演员和歌手，曾出演过Harriette Baines -Winslow，Winslow家族的族裔是ABC/CBS情景喜剧“ Family Matters”（1989- 1998年），并在其父母系列中重新出现在其父母系列中的重复角色。从2001年到2005年，佩顿（Payton）为布鲁斯·W·史密斯（Bruce W. Smith）的迪斯尼频道的“骄傲家庭”（The Proud Family）骄傲的苏加·妈妈（Suga Mama）为声音提供了声音。该角色在2005年获得了NAACP图像奖的提名。佩顿在“ Will＆Grace”的第二季（1999-2000）期间，佩顿（Payton）担任格雷戈里·海因斯（Gregory Hines）角色Ben Doucette（Will Truman's Boss）的个人助理。

乔·玛丽·佩顿（Jo Marie Payton）于1950年8月3日出生于佐治亚州奥尔巴尼。在她十几岁的时候，她的家人搬到了佛罗里达州的Opa-Locka。佩顿（Payton）曾在北达德（North Dade Jr.）/高中（Sr. Payton's big break came when she was cast as Harriet Winslow, the elevator operator on the ABC sitcom "'Perfect Strangers" in 1987. Her performance was so well received by audiences that she was given her own sitcom, "Family Matters", in 1989. Continuing her character Harriette Winslow from "Perfect Strangers", she played a mother in an African-American middle-class family living in Chicago, Illinois.佩顿（Payton）在最后一个赛季中离开了“家庭事务”（Family Matters），这是1997年12月19日最后一次出现的。 2002年，佩顿（Payton）出现在安妮·罗宾逊（Anne Robinson）版本的“最弱链接”的“电视妈妈”情节中，这是第三次投票。 2003年，佩顿（Payton）和她的女儿出现在母亲节“ Lingo”一集中，与电视妈妈梅雷迪思·巴克斯特（Meredith Baxter）和她的女儿竞争。巴克斯特和她的女儿赢了。 2005年，乔·玛丽·佩顿（Jo Marie Payton）在《骄傲的家庭电影》中提供了Suga Mama的声音。她的其他电视学分包括“绝望的家庭主妇”，“ Reba”，“女朋友”，“ Wanda agent”，“审判Amy”，“ Parkers”，“ Will＆Grace”，“ Hughleys”，“ The Hughleys”，“ 7th Heaven”，“ Moesha”，“ Moesha”，“ Moesha“”她还出现在加拿大电视迷你电视连续剧《 The Rev》中。 2005年，Payton与Glynn Turman共同主持了第15届年度NAACP剧院奖。 2009年8月，佩顿（Payton）出现在雪莉·范·欧文（Shirley van Owen）的“遇见布朗”上。佩顿（Payton）最近在“与乔马里·佩顿（Jomarie Payton）的第二次机会”上主持了自己的演出。 2012年，佩顿（Payton）参加了GMC电视电影特别节目“从今天开始”。 2004年， 为了帮助为弗吉尼亚联合大学筹集资金，佩顿给校友写信，敦促他们以18.65美元至186,500美元捐款，以纪念该大学的1865年成立日期。Payton还继续捐赠，托管慈善活动，并支持她的Albany State University的ALMA Mation，同时还继续教育和成功的职业生涯。 Payton是Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority的成员。 1999年，她发行了爵士专辑“ Southern Shadows”。佩顿已经结婚并离婚了三次。她的第一次婚姻是1980年至1987年与法国马克·法国（Marc France）与她的女儿，尚塔尔法国（Chantale France），出生于1984年。从1993年4月17日到1998年，佩顿与罗德尼·诺布尔（Rodney Noble）结婚。离婚后不久，佩顿于1998年与兰德里斯·克拉克（Landrus Clark）结婚。后来在2004年离婚。佩顿自2007年以来与伦纳德·唐斯（Leonard Downs）结婚。

佩顿保留了她与和平队的联系。 1981年，她谈到了志愿者在世界范围内做出的贡献，“我认为和平队的整个想法是最近去年夏天带回家给我的，当时加勒比海地区有一场巨大破坏性的飓风。一些志愿者与我一起服务的一些志愿者在岛民中送给那些岛民，这些岛民曾经送给那些岛屿。我认为是和平队的核心，这就是为什么今天和平团有意义的原因。”佩顿（Payton）于1988年被授予和平队和平领袖和平奖。2000年，佩顿（Payton）参加了和平队主任马克·施耐德（Mark L. Schneider）的宣誓仪式。

一旦他开始踢足球，他是一名大三时，他就获得了跑步的即时成功，跑步了65码，在他的第一届高中进球中进行了达阵。在，他不是特别大，但他的速度和力量使他成为球队的特色球员之一。约翰·J·杰斐逊高中（John J. Jefferson High School）当年与邻国哥伦比亚高中融合在一起。佩顿（Payton）和他的队友对他们的总教练查尔斯·波士顿（Charles L. Boston）成为助手感到不高兴，佩顿（Payton）抵制了一些春季练习，但在秋季返回。然后，他成为密西西比州全州球队的成员，赢得了全州范围的荣誉，导致哥伦比亚出乎意料的8-2赛季。他的表现有助于缓解围绕种族隔离的当地紧张局势。哥伦比亚的足球教练汤米·戴维斯（Tommy Davis）声称，当球队需要得分时，他总是可以指望佩顿。佩顿的统计数据证明这并不夸张：他在大三和大四时都在每场比赛中得分。他连续两年被任命为全会议团队。佩顿还在他的高年级得分中带领小迪克西会议，并成为了全州球队。除了在足球比赛中表现出色外，佩顿还为哥伦比亚的篮球队平均每场比赛得到18分，在跳远比赛中跳过了三分之三英寸的三分之三英寸，打棒球，并继续参加学校乐队。

埃斯特拉·佩顿（Estella Payton）有时Estelle Payton（1904年8月17日至1999年12月16日）是“女人世界”烹饪节目的联合主演，该节目在阿拉巴马州莫比尔（Mobile）的WKRG-TV上播出了数十年。佩顿（Payton）是一名非洲裔美国妇女，从1956年开始在节目中​​与白人妇女康妮·比·霍普（Connie Bea Hope）一起出现。在早期，佩顿（Payton）没有出现在镜头前，除非她的手在设置或卸下餐具时滑过枪击。后来，在1960年代，佩顿开始播出，最终她获得了该计划的开场冠军的第三次计费，并获得了自己的麦克风，并就希望的示威游行发表了评论。这两名妇女因其通常是善良的后台争吵而在车站闻名。
在该公司仍在该公司时，佩顿被任命为密歇根大学的主要律师，以捍卫其法律和本科生在招生过程中使用种族。六年多以来，佩顿在初审法院和上诉法院处理了两个备受瞩目的案件，并在最高法院辩称“ Gratzv。Bollinger”。他组织了一个来自高等教育，军事和顶级企业的广泛联盟，以支持多样性倡议。最高法院在“ Grutterv。Bollinger”中的一个狭窄决定中，维持了在大学录取中使用种族。

佩顿职业生涯的主要亮点之一是他担任塔斯基吉大学的第四任校长，这是他担任29年的角色。塔斯基吉大学是一所私立且历史悠久的黑人大学，位于阿拉巴马州塔斯基吉。在担任总裁的第二年，佩顿为副总统乔治·H·W.（George H.W.）工作。布什担任非洲的教育顾问。他作为总统的下一个主要任务是将学校的名称从塔斯基吉学院（Tuskegee Institute）改为1985年。1996年，佩顿（Payton）成立了Tuskegee梅毒遗产委员会。佩顿（Payton）成立了该委员会，目的是在比尔·克林顿（Bill Clinton）总统下对政府进行教育，并为将非裔美国人用作测试对象的道歉40年对疾病的退化影响。在佩顿（Payton）在塔斯基吉（Tuskegee）任职期间，校园捐赠基金会筹集了超过1.6亿美元的资金，并创建了最初的博士学位计划。他还负责对校园进行重大重组，包括新的道路，图书馆，教室建筑，宿舍，校园入口以及校园周围有大门的完整围栏。
佩顿（Payton）在哥伦比亚大学（Columbia University）会面后，于1959年与他的配偶Thelma Loiuse飞机结婚。他们在纽约市的河滨教堂结婚，并结婚了54年，直到她于2013年6月去世。他们一起育有两个孩子。一个儿子马克·史蒂文·佩顿（Mark Steven Payton）和一个女儿黛博拉·伊丽莎白·佩顿（Deborah Elizabeth Payton）。佩顿博士后来于2016年9月28日在佛罗里达州的埃斯特罗去世。
report_src: 佩顿广场（Peyton Place）的主要女主角是艾莉森·麦肯齐（Allison Mackenzie），由米娅·法罗（Mia Farrow）饰演；剧中她既是报纸编辑马修·斯温的远房亲戚，又因与哈灵顿兄弟的情感纠葛成为剧情核心[1]。

question_en: Who is the leader of Fancy Bear?
pos_context_en: The group is also suspected to be behind a spear phishing attack in August 2016 on members of the Bundestag and multiple political parties such as Linken-faction leader Sahra Wagenknecht, Junge Union and the CDU of Saarland. Authorities feared that sensitive information could be gathered by hackers to later manipulate the public ahead of elections such as Germany's next federal election which was due in September 2017.
neg_context_en: From mid-2014 until the fall of 2017, Fancy Bear targeted numerous journalists in the United States, Ukraine, Russia, Moldova, the Baltics, and other countries that had provided articles discrediting Putin and the Kremlin. According to the AP and SecureWorks, this group of journalists is the third largest group targeted by Fancy Bear after diplomatic personnel and U.S. Democrats. Fancy Bear's targeted list includes Adrian Chen, the Armenian journalist Maria Titizian, Eliot Higgins at Bellingcat, Ellen Barry and at least 50 other New York Times reporters, at least 50 foreign correspondents based in Moscow who worked for independent news outlets, Josh Rogin, a Washington Post columnist, Shane Harris, a Daily Beast writer who in 2015 covered intelligence issues, Michael Weiss, a CNN security analyst, Jamie Kirchick with the Brookings Institution, 30 media targets in Ukraine, many at the Kyiv Post, reporters who covered the Russian-backed war in eastern Ukraine, as well as in Russia where the majority of journalists targeted by the hackers worked for independent news (e.g. Novaya Gazeta or Vedomosti) such as at and mainstream Russian journalists Tina Kandelaki, Ksenia Sobchak, and the Russian television anchor , all of which worked for Dozhd.

All groups have a common hierarchy: in charge is the group father, previously often a noble but now most likely to be a well-educated male, who manages the finances and venues as well as the welfare of members in general. Under him are the band leader, who organises rehearsals and teaches the music, the Fancy Dress leader, who looks after choreography and interviews potential new members, and the group mother, who looks after food and settles disputes. She is also treated as a biological mother by group members. Cowboys are fit and strong members who are answerable to the Fancy Dress leader and look after general members. Then there are scouts, stilt walkers, and general members under the cowboys’ control. Scouts move ahead and solicit money from onlookers for the group.

Likely operating since the mid-2000s, Fancy Bear's methods are consistent with the capabilities of state actors. The group targets government, military, and security organizations, especially Transcaucasian and NATO-aligned states. Fancy Bear is thought to be responsible for cyber attacks on the German parliament, the French television station TV5Monde, the White House, NATO, the Democratic National Committee, Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe and the campaign of French presidential candidate Emmanuel Macron.

Fancy Bear (also known as APT28, Pawn Storm, Sofacy Group, Sednit and STRONTIUM) is a cyber espionage group. Cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike has said with a medium level of confidence that it is associated with the Russian military intelligence agency GRU. The Foreign and Commonwealth Office, and security firms SecureWorks, ThreatConnect, and Fireeye's Mandiant, have also said the group is sponsored by the Russian government. In 2018, an indictment by the United States Special Counsel identified Fancy Bear as two GRU units known as Unit 26165 and Unit 74455.

Fancy has played diverse roles on stages all around England. He began his professional career by returning to the Chichester Festival Theatre in the repertory company where he had a nightly fight sequence with Donald Sinden in "The Scarlet Pimpernel", directed by Nicholas Hytner. Fancy has acted on the fringe at the White Bear Theatre, King's Head Theatre and twice at the Edinburgh Festival Fringe where he took a one-man Shakespeare-based piece on the subject of Jack Cade, who was the leader of a popular revolt in 1450 during the reign of King Henry VI of England. 
Other leading roles include Bill Sykes in "Oliver Twist" at the Bristol Old Vic directed by Phyllida Lloyd, Dussel in "The Dreams of Anne Frank" at the Polka Children’s Theatre, Willy Mossop in "Hobson’s Choice" at the Derby Playhouse and Bob Cratchit in "A Christmas Carol" at Clwyd Theatr Cymru.

Fancy Bear's targets have included Eastern European governments and militaries, the country of Georgia and the Caucasus, Ukraine, security-related organizations such as NATO, as well as US defense contractors Academi (formerly known as Blackwater), Science Applications International Corporation (SAIC), Boeing, Lockheed Martin, and Raytheon. Fancy Bear has also attacked citizens of the Russian Federation that are political enemies of the Kremlin, including former oil tycoon Mikhail Khodorkovsky, and Maria Alekhina of the band Pussy Riot. SecureWorks, a cybersecurity firm headquartered in the United States, concluded that from March 2015 to May 2016, the "Fancy Bear" target list included not merely the United States Democratic National Committee, but tens of thousands of foes of Putin and the Kremlin in the United States, Ukraine, Russia, Georgia, and Syria. Only a handful of Republicans were targeted, however. An AP analysis of 4,700 email accounts that had been attacked by Fancy Bear concluded that no country other than Russia would be interested in hacking so many very different targets that seemed to have nothing else in common other than their being of interest to the Russian government.

On January 10, 2018, the "Fancy Bears Hack Team" online persona leaked what appeared to be stolen International Olympic Committee (IOC) and U.S. Olympic Committee emails, dated from late 2016 to early 2017, were leaked in apparent retaliation for the IOC's banning of Russian athletes from the 2018 Winter Olympics as a sanction for Russia's systematic doping program. The attack resembles the earlier World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) leaks. It is not known whether the emails are fully authentic, because of Fancy Bear's history of salting stolen emails with disinformation. The mode of attack was also not known, but was probably phishing.

A website created to leak documents taken in the WADA and IAAF attacks was fronted with a brief manifesto dated September 13, 2016, proclaiming that the site is owned by "Fancy Bears' hack team", which it said is an "international hack team" who "stand for fair play and clean sport". The site took responsibility for hacking WADA and promised that it would provide "sensational proof of famous athletes taking doping substances", beginning with the US Olympic team, which it said "disgraced its name by tainted victories". WADA said some of the documents leaked under this name were forgeries, and that data had been changed.

Network security firm FireEye released a detailed report on Fancy Bear in October 2014. The report designated the group as "Advanced Persistent Threat 28" (APT28) and described how the hacking group used zero-day exploits of the Microsoft Windows operating system and Adobe Flash. The report found operational details indicating that the source is a "government sponsor based in Moscow". Evidence collected by FireEye suggested that Fancy Bear's malware was compiled primarily in a Russian-language build environment and occurred mainly during work hours paralleling Moscow's time zone. FireEye director of threat intelligence Laura Galante referred to the group's activities as "state espionage" and said that targets also include "media or influencers."

In February 2017, the General Intelligence and Security Service (AIVD) of the Netherlands revealed that Fancy Bear and Cozy Bear had made several attempts to hack into Dutch ministries, including the Ministry of General Affairs, over the previous six months. Rob Bertholee, head of the AIVD, said on "EenVandaag" that the hackers were Russian and had tried to gain access to secret government documents.
question_src: 谁是花式熊的领导者？
pos_context_src: 该组织还被怀疑是2016年8月对Bundestag成员和多个政党的矛式网络钓鱼袭击的幕后黑手，例如Finken-Faction领导人Sahra Wagenknecht，Junge Union和Saarland的CDU。当局担心，黑客可能会收集敏感信息，以便在德国下次联邦大选之前，将在2017年9月举行的大选之前对公众进行操纵。
neg_context_src: 从2014年中期到2017年秋季，五熊熊针对美国，乌克兰，俄罗斯，摩尔多瓦，波罗的海以及其他提供抹黑普京和克里姆林宫的文章的新闻记者。根据美联社和Secureworks的说法，这群记者是五首熊针对外交人员和美国民主党的第三大群体。花式熊的目标名单包括阿德里安·陈（Adrian Chen），亚美尼亚新闻记者玛丽亚·泰特兹（Maria Titizian），贝林卡特（Bellingcat）的艾略特·希金斯（Eliot Higgins），艾伦·巴里（Ellen Barry），艾伦·巴里（Ellen Barry），艾伦·巴里（Ellen Barry）和其他50位其他纽约时报的记者，至少50位来自莫斯科的外国记者，他们在独立新闻媒体工作，乔什·罗金（Josh Rogin），华盛顿邮报乔什·罗金（Josh Rogin），华盛顿邮报乔什·罗吉（Josh Rogin） analyst, Jamie Kirchick with the Brookings Institution, 30 media targets in Ukraine, many at the Kyiv Post, reporters who covered the Russian-backed war in eastern Ukraine, as well as in Russia where the majority of journalists targeted by the hackers worked for independent news (e.g. Novaya Gazeta or Vedomosti) such as at and mainstream Russian journalists Tina Kandelaki, Ksenia Sobchak和俄罗斯电视台的主播，所有这些都为Dozhd工作。

所有团体都有一个共同的等级制度：负责人是团体父亲，以前经常是贵族，但现在最有可能是受过良好教育的男性，他们管理着财务和场所以及一般成员的福利。乐队的领导者在他的领导下，组织彩排并教音乐，高档着装领袖，负责编舞并采访潜在的新成员，而小组母亲则照顾食物并解决了争议。小组成员还将她视为亲生母亲。牛仔很合适，有力的成员对幻想着装的负责人负责，并照顾一般成员。然后是牛仔在控制下的侦察员，高跷步行者和一般成员。童子军向前迈进，从围观者那里征收该小组的钱。
自2000年代中期以来运作的可能运行，花式熊的方法与国家参与者的能力一致。该组织针对政府，军事和安全组织，尤其是跨加州和北约一致的国家。人们认为，花式熊负责网络对德国议会的攻击，法国电视台TV5MONDE，白宫，北约，民主党全国委员会，欧洲安全与合作组织以及法国总统候选人Emmanuel Macron运动。

花式熊（也称为APT28，Pawn Storm，Sofacy Group，Sednit和Srantium）是一个网络间谍组。网络安全公司CrowdStrike表示，它与俄罗斯军事情报机构GRU有关。外国和英联邦办公室以及安全公司SeculweStnects，Threatconnect和FireEye的Mandiant也表示，该集团由俄罗斯政府赞助。 2018年，美国特别顾问的起诉书将五熊熊确定为两个GRU单位，称为单位26165和第74455单元。

Fancy在英格兰各地的舞台上都扮演着各种角色。他返回曲目公司的奇切斯特音乐节剧院开始了他的职业生涯，在那里他在尼古拉斯·海特纳（Nicholas Hytner）执导的《猩红色皮姆内尔》（The Scarlet Pimpernel）中与唐纳德·辛登（Donald Sinden）进行了每晚的战斗序列。奇西（Fancy）在白熊剧院（White Bear Theatre），国王的头部剧院（King's Head Theatre）和爱丁堡音乐节（Edinburgh Festival Fringe）的边缘上表演，在那里他扮演了一个单人莎士比亚的作品杰克·凯德（Jack Cade），后者在英格兰国王亨利五世（Henry of England of England of England of England of England of England of Henry of Engign of Henry vi）期间是1450年受欢迎的起义的领导者。 
其他领导角色包括Bill Sykes在Phyllida Lloyd执导的Bristol Old Vic中的Bill Sykes，Dussel在Polka儿童剧院的“ Anne Frank的Dreams of Anne Frank”中，在Derby Playhouse的Willy Mossop，在Clwyd TheAtr Cymru的“ Derby Playhouse”和鲍勃Cratchit的“ Hobson's Choice”中。

花式熊的目标包括东欧政府和军队，佐治亚州和高加索国家，乌克兰，北约等与安全相关的组织以及美国国防承包商学院（以前称为黑水），科学应用程序应用程序国际公司（SAIC），BOEING，BOEING，LOCEHEED MARTIN和RAINTHERON。高档熊还袭击了俄罗斯联邦的公民，这些公民是克里姆林宫的政治敌人，包括前石油大亨米哈伊尔·霍多尔科夫斯基（Mikhail Khodorkovsky）和猫骚乱乐队的玛丽亚·阿莱基纳（Maria Alekhina）。 SecureWorks是一家总部位于美国的网络安全公司，得出的结论是，从2015年3月到2016年5月，“花哨的熊”目标清单不仅包括美国民主国家委员会，而且包括数以万计的普京敌人和在美国，乌克兰，俄罗斯，俄罗斯，俄罗斯，乔治亚州和Syria的敌人。但是，只有少数共和党人是针对的。对4,700个遭到花式熊攻击的电子邮件帐户的美联社分析得出结论，除了俄罗斯以外，没有其他国家对黑客攻击这么多截然不同的目标感兴趣，除了他们对俄罗斯政府感兴趣之外，似乎没有其他共同点。

On January 10, 2018, the "Fancy Bears Hack Team" online persona leaked what appeared to be stolen International Olympic Committee (IOC) and U.S. Olympic Committee emails, dated from late 2016 to early 2017, were leaked in apparent retaliation for the IOC's banning of Russian athletes from the 2018 Winter Olympics as a sanction for Russia's systematic doping program.这次袭击类似于较早的世界反兴奋剂机构（WADA）泄漏。尚不清楚这些电子邮件是完全真实的，因为花式熊的历史记录了偷偷摸摸的电子邮件，并存在虚假信息。攻击方式也不知道，但可能是网络钓鱼。

创建的网站是为了泄露WADA和IAAF袭击的泄漏文件，并带有日期为2016年9月13日的简短宣言，宣布该网站由“ Fancy Bears'Hack Team”拥有，它说这是“国际骇客团队”，“国际黑客团队”“代表公平竞争和清洁运动”。该网站负责黑客袭击Wada，并承诺将提供“著名运动员服用兴奋剂物质的轰动性证明”，从美国奥运会队开始，该团队“以污点胜利的胜利使它的名字感到羞耻”。 Wada说，以此名称泄漏的一些文件是伪造的，数据已更改。

网络安全公司FireEye于2014年10月发布了一份关于五熊熊的详细报告。该报告将该小组指定为“高级持续威胁28”（APT28），并描述了黑客组如何使用Microsoft Windows操作系统和Adobe Flash的零日漏洞。该报告发现运营细节表明该消息来源是“莫斯科的政府赞助商”。 FireEye收集的证据表明，Fancy Bear的恶意软件主要是在俄罗斯的建筑环境中，主要发生在与莫斯科时区平行的工作时间。 FireEye威胁情报局局长劳拉·加兰特（Laura Galante）将该组织的活动称为“州间谍”，并说目标还包括“媒体或影响者”。
2017年2月，荷兰的一般情报与安全服务（AIVD）透露，在过去的六个月中，花式熊和舒适的熊已经尝试了几次尝试闯入包括通用事务部在内的荷兰各部委。 AIVD负责人Rob Bertholee在“ Eenvandaag”上说，黑客是俄罗斯人，并试图获得秘密政府文件。
report_src: 在所给出的资料中，并未披露花式熊（Fancy Bear）的具体领导者姓名或身份[1]。

question_en: Can leptospirosis be cured?
pos_context_en: Treatment for hyperphosphatemia consists of treating the underlying disease, dialysis where appropriate, or oral administration of calcium carbonate, but not without first checking the serum calcium levels (these two levels are related). Administration of corticosteroids in gradually reduced doses (e.g., prednisolone) for 7–10 days is recommended by some specialists in cases of severe hemorrhagic effects. Organ-specific care and treatment are essential in cases of kidney, liver, or heart involvement.
neg_context_en: "Leptospira noguchii" is another pathogenic bacteria that causes Leptospirosis. Leptospirosis can be transferred in a multitude of ways. Leptospirosis can transfer from animals to humans (zoonosis), humans to humans, or animals to animals via intake of contaminated body fluids, such as urine and blood. The disease is normally absorbed through the mucosal membranes of another animal or human and is excreted from the body in the urine. The infected individual can be asymptomatic or have very severe symptoms. In serious cases, kidney or liver failure, aseptic meningitis, and fatal pulmonary hemorrhages have occurred in humans.

Leptospirosis is a water contract disease caused by bacteria of the genus Leptospirabacterial. It is a disease that affects both humans and animals. The number of leptospirosis cases had steadily increased from 2011 (2,268 cases with 55 death) to 2015 (8,291 cases with 78 death) and 5,284 cases with 52 death in 2016. Leptospirosis can have important health impact and is a burden to the nation if not well controlled. Addressing leptospisoris includes maintain a clean environment and by not swimming or wading in water that might be contaminated with animal urine, or eliminating contact with potentially infected animals.

Ninety percent of cases of the disease are mild leptospirosis. The rest experience severe disease, which develops during the second stage or occurs as a single progressive illness. The classic form of severe leptospirosis is known as Weil's disease, which is characterized by liver damage (causing jaundice), kidney failure, and bleeding. Additionally, the heart and brain can be affected, meningitis of the outer layer of the brain, encephalitis of brain tissue with same signs and symptoms; and lung affected as the most serious and life-threatening of all leptospirosis complications. The infection is often incorrectly diagnosed due to the nonspecific symptoms.

At least five important serovars exist in the United States and Canada, all of which cause disease in dogs:
In dogs when leptospirosis is caused by "L. interrogans" it may be referred to as "canicola fever". Leptospirosis should be strongly suspected and included as part of a differential diagnosis if the sclerae of a dog's eyes appear jaundiced (even slightly yellow). The absence of jaundice does not eliminate the possibility of leptospirosis, and its presence could indicate hepatitis or other liver pathology rather than leptospirosis. Vomiting, fever, failure to eat, reduced urine output, unusually dark or brown urine, and lethargy are also indications of the disease.

Leptospirosis, also known as field fever is an infection caused by "Leptospira". Symptoms can range from none to mild such as headaches, muscle pains, and fevers; to severe with bleeding from the lungs or meningitis. "Leptospira" is transmitted by both wild and domestic animals, most commonly by rodents. It is often transmitted by animal urine or by water or soil containing animal urine coming into contact with breaks in the skin, eyes, mouth, or nose.
The countries with the highest reported incidence are located in the Asia-Pacific region (Seychelles, India, Sri Lanka and Thailand) with incidence rates over 10 per 1000,000 people s well as in Latin America and the Caribbean (Trinidad and Tobago, Barbados, Jamaica, El Salvador, Uruguay, Cuba, Nicaragua and Costa Rica) However, the rise in global travel and eco-tourism has led to dramatic changes in the epidemiology of leptospirosis, and travelers from around the world have become exposed to the threat of leptospirosis. Despite decreasing prevalence of leptospirosis in endemic regions, previously non-endemic countries are now reporting increasing numbers of cases due to recreational exposure International travelers engaged in adventure sports are directly exposed to numerous infectious agents in the environment and now comprise a growing proportion of cases worldwide.

House-bound domestic dogs have contracted leptospirosis, apparently from licking the urine of infected mice in the house. The type of habitats most likely to carry infective bacteria includes muddy riverbanks, ditches, gullies, and muddy livestock rearing areas where there is a regular passage of wild or farm mammals. The incidence of leptospirosis correlates directly with the amount of rainfall, making it seasonal in temperate climates and year-round in tropical climates.
Leptospirosis also transmits via the semen of infected animals.

Swimming in the pool at the bottom of the falls is discouraged. This is due both to occasional rockfalls and to the bacterial disease called Leptospirosis, which causes severe flu-like symptoms. Leptospirosis is found in freshwater and is common in tropical climates. In Hawaii, rats and mice often carry the disease and can easily transfer it to humans through their urine.

Humans become infected through contact with water, food, or soil that contains urine from these infected animals. This may happen by swallowing contaminated food or water or through skin contact. The disease is not known to spread between humans, and bacterial dissemination in convalescence is extremely rare in humans. Leptospirosis is common among water-sport enthusiasts in specific areas, as prolonged immersion in water promotes the entry of this bacterium. Surfers and whitewater paddlers are at especially high risk in areas that have been shown to contain these bacteria, and can contract the disease by swallowing contaminated water, splashing contaminated water into their eyes or nose, or exposing open wounds to infected water.
In tropical and semi tropical areas, like South and South-east Asia the disease is increasingly seen as epidemics after heavy rains, sometimes after flooding. Periods of heavy rain followed by days of little or no rain seemed to be the setting for leptospirosis epidemics in this part of the world. Most cases seemed to occur by cutaneous exposure of the legs while walking in stagnant water or moist soil. The presence of wounds or fissures on the legs are a risk factor for acquiring the infection.

Leptospirosis is a zoonotic disease caused by bacteria of the genus "Leptospira". Humans and dogs become infected through contact with water, food, or soil containing urine from infected animals. This may happen by swallowing contaminated food or water or through skin contact, especially with mucosal surfaces, such as the eyes or nose, or with broken skin. In dogs, transmission most commonly occurs by drinking puddle, pond, or ditch water contaminated by urine from infected wildlife such as squirrels or raccoons. The liver and kidney are most commonly damaged by leptospirosis. Vasculitis can occur, causing edema and potentially disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC). Myocarditis, pericarditis, meningitis, and uveitis are also possible sequelae.
Brucellosis in dogs is caused by "Brucella canis". It is a sexually transmitted disease, but can also be spread through contact with aborted fetuses. The most common sign is abortion during the last trimester or stillbirth. Other symptoms include inflammation of the intervertebral disc and eye (uveitis), and inflammation of the testicle (orchitis) and prostate (prostatitis) in males.

Diagnosis of leptospirosis is confirmed with tests such as enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and polymerase chain reaction (PCR). The MAT (microscopic agglutination test), a serological test, is considered the gold standard in diagnosing leptospirosis. As a large panel of different leptospira must be subcultured frequently, which is both laborious and expensive, it is underused, especially in developing countries.
question_src: 可以治愈钩端螺旋体病吗？
pos_context_src: 高磷酸血症的治疗包括在适当的情况下治疗潜在的疾病，透析或口服碳酸钙，但不是先检查血清钙水平（这两个水平是相关的）。在严重的出血作用的情况下，建议某些专家使用逐渐降低剂量（例如泼尼松龙）的剂量（例如泼尼松龙）的施用皮质类固醇7-10天。在肾脏，肝脏或心脏受累的情况下，器官特异性护理和治疗至关重要。
neg_context_src: “ noguchii的钩端螺旋体”是导致钩端螺旋体病的另一种致病细菌。钩端螺旋体病可以多种方式转移。钩端螺旋体病可以通过摄入受污染的体液（例如尿液和血液）来从动物转移到人类（动物），人类或动物。该疾病通常通过另一只动物或人的粘膜膜吸收，并从尿液中排出。受感染的人可能是无症状的或具有非常严重的症状。在严重的情况下，人类发生了肾脏或肝衰竭，无菌脑膜炎和致命的肺出血。
钩端螺旋体病是由瘦细菌属细菌引起的水合同疾病。这是一种影响人类和动物的疾病。从2011年（2,268例死亡55例）到2015年（8,291例死亡78例）和2016年52例死亡的病例，钩端螺症病例的数量稳步增加（2,268例死亡）。解决的诱导杂种包括保持清洁的环境，不在可能被动物尿液污染的水中游泳或涉水，或消除与潜在感染的动物的接触。
该疾病的病例中有90％是轻度诱发性螺旋病。其余的经历了严重的疾病，这种疾病在第二阶段发展或作为单一进行性疾病发生。严重的钩端螺旋体病的经典形式称为Weil病，其特征是肝损伤（引起黄疸），肾衰竭和出血。此外，心脏和大脑可能会受到影响，大脑外层的脑膜炎，具有相同体征和症状的脑组织脑炎；肺部受到所有钩端螺旋体病并发症的最严重和生命的影响。由于非特异性症状，通常会错误地诊断感染。

在美国和加拿大，至少有五个重要的血清群，所有这些血清都会引起狗的疾病：
在狗中，当钩端螺旋体病是由“ L. ventergans”引起的，它可能称为“峡谷热”。如果狗的眼睛的巩膜看起来像是黄疸（甚至略带黄色），则应强烈怀疑钩端螺旋体病并将其作为鉴别诊断的一部分。黄疸的不存在并不能消除钩端螺旋体病的可能性，并且其存在可能表明肝炎或其他肝病病理学而不是钩端螺旋体病。呕吐，发烧，不饮食，尿量减少，异常深色或棕色尿液以及嗜睡也是这种疾病的迹象。

钩端螺旋体病，也称为田间发烧是由“钩端螺旋体”引起的感染。症状的范围可能从不到温和，例如头痛，肌肉疼痛和发烧。因肺部或脑膜炎出血而严重。野生动物和家养动物都会传播“钩端螺旋体”，最常见的是啮齿动物。它通常是由动物尿液或含有动物尿液的水或土壤与皮肤，眼睛，嘴或鼻子中断接触的。
报告发病率最高的国家位于亚太地区（塞舌尔，印度，斯里兰卡和泰国），在拉丁美洲和加勒比海地区和加勒比海地区和加勒比海地区（特立尼达和多巴哥，巴巴多斯，巴巴多斯，巴巴多斯，贾马卡，贾马卡，苏拉瓦多，乌鲁加亚岛，纽约这群岛和尼西亚拉加拉加亚岛上的旅行），发病率超过10万人和加勒比海地区以及加勒比海地区和加勒比海地区。导致钩端螺旋体病流行病学发生了巨大变化，来自世界各地的旅行者已经受到钩端螺旋体病的威胁。尽管流行地区的钩端螺旋体病的患病率降低，但以前的非流行国家现在报告说，由于从事冒险运动的娱乐曝光国际旅行者导致的案件越来越多，直接暴露于环境中的众多感染者，现在构成了越来越多的全球案件。

家庭结合的家狗患有钩端螺旋体病，显然是从舔房子里的被感染小鼠的尿液中。最有可能携带感染细菌的栖息地类型包括泥泞的河岸，沟渠，沟壑和泥泞的牲畜饲养区，那里有野生或农场哺乳动物的经常通过。钩端螺旋体病的发生率与降雨量直接相关，使其在温带气候和热带气候中全年季节性。
钩端螺旋体病也通过感染动物的精液传播。
不建议在瀑布底部的游泳池里游泳。这既是由于偶尔出现的岩石和称为钩端螺旋体病的细菌疾病，这会导致严重的流感样症状。在淡水中发现钩端螺旋体病，在热带气候中很常见。在夏威夷，大鼠和小鼠经常携带这种疾病，并可以通过尿液轻松地将其转移到人类中。

人类通过与这些感染动物的尿液接触，通过与水，食物或土壤接触而感染。这可能是通过吞咽污染的食物或水或通过皮肤接触而发生的。该疾病尚不在人类之间传播，而在人类中，康复中的细菌传播极为罕见。在特定地区的水上运动爱好者中，钩端螺旋体病很常见，因为长期浸入水中会促进该细菌的进入。在已显示包含这些细菌的地区，冲浪者和白水桨手的风险尤其高，并且可以通过吞咽污染的水，将污染的水溅入眼睛或鼻子，或暴露于感染水中的敞开伤口来通过吞咽污染的水来感染这种疾病。
在热带和半热带地区，例如南亚和东南亚，越来越多地将这种疾病视为大雨后的流行病，有时在洪水后。大雨的时期随后几天或没有雨水似乎是世界这个地区流行病的环境。大多数情况似乎是通过在停滞的水或潮湿的土壤中行走时腿皮肤暴露而发生的。腿上的伤口或裂缝存在是获得感染的危险因素。

钩端螺旋体病是由“钩端螺旋体”属细菌引起的人畜共患病。人类和狗通过与感染动物的水，食物或含尿液的土壤接触而被感染。吞咽污染的食物或水或通过皮肤接触，尤其是粘膜表面，例如眼睛或鼻子或皮肤破碎的情况，可能会发生这种情况。在狗中，传播最常见的是通过喝水坑，池塘或沟渠来发生，这些水被感染野生动植物（例如松鼠或浣熊）污染的水。肝脏和肾脏通常受到钩端螺旋病的伤害。血管炎可能发生，导致水肿并潜在地传播血管内凝血（DIC）。心肌炎，心包炎，脑膜炎和葡萄膜炎也可能是后遗症。
狗的布鲁氏菌病是由“布鲁氏菌犬”引起的。这是一种性传播的疾病，但也可以通过与流产的胎儿接触来扩散。最常见的迹象是在最后三个月或死产中流产。其他症状包括椎间盘和眼睛（葡萄膜炎）的炎症，以及男性睾丸炎（提供卵石）和前列腺炎（前列腺炎）的炎症。
通过酶连接的免疫吸附测定（ELISA）和聚合酶链反应（PCR）等测试证实了钩端螺旋体病的诊断。 MAT（微观凝集测试）是一种血清学测试，被认为是诊断钩端螺旋体病的黄金标准。由于必须经常将一大批不同的钩端螺旋体培养，这既费力又昂贵，因此尤其是在发展中国家。
report_src: 钩端螺旋体病通常可以治愈；在临床上，及时的综合治疗能使患者完全恢复功能。若合并高磷酸血症，可根据病情选择透析或口服碳酸钙以纠正电解质紊乱[1]；出现严重出血倾向时，一些专家建议使用泼尼松龙等皮质类固醇逐渐减量治疗 7–10 天，以降低炎症反应并控制出血[1]；当肾脏、肝脏或心脏受累时，实施器官特异性护理和治疗对病情逆转至关重要[1]。因此，只要及早诊断并配合上述支持措施，绝大多数患者预后良好，达到临床治愈的可能性很高。

question_en: What was the first newspaper ever printed in the U.K.?
pos_context_en: At the beginning of the 17th century, the right to print was strictly controlled in England. This was probably the reason why the first newspaper in the English language was printed in Rome by Joris Veseler around 1620. This followed the style established by Veseler's earlier Dutch paper "Courante uyt Italien, Duytslandt, &c." However, when the English started printing their own papers in London, they reverted to the pamphlet format used by contemporary books. The publication of these newsbooks was suspended between 1632 and 1638 by order of the Star Chamber. After they resumed publication, the era of these newsbooks lasted until the publication of the "Oxford Gazette" in 1665.
neg_context_en: In 1869, the "San Francisco Chronicle" published what is regarded as the first Sunday magazine, and the "Chicago Inter Ocean" added color to its supplement. "The New York Times Magazine" was published on September 6, 1896, and it contained the first photographs ever printed in that newspaper. During the 1890s, publications were inserted into Joseph Pulitzer's "New York World" and William Randolph Hearst's "New York Journal". Hearst had the eight-page "Women's Home Journal" and the 16-page "Sunday American Magazine", which later became "The American Weekly". In November 1896, Morrill Goddard, editor of the "New York Journal" from 1896 to 1937, launched Hearst's Sunday magazine, later commenting, "Nothing is so stale as yesterday's newspaper, but "The American Weekly" may be around the house for days or weeks and lose none of its interest."

The first Spanish-language newspapers in the United States were "El Misisipí" and "El Mensagero Luisianés", which began publication in New Orleans in 1808 and 1809. "La Gaceta de Texas" and "El Mexicano", the first newspapers in what is now considered the Southwest, were written and typeset in Nacogdoches, Texas but printed in Natchitoches, Louisiana in 1813. They supported the Mexican independence movement.

Letterpress printing was introduced in Canada in 1752 in Halifax, Nova Scotia by John Bushell in the newspaper format. This paper was named the Halifax Gazette and became Canada's first newspaper. Bushell apprenticed under Bartholomew Green in Boston. Green moved to Halifax in 1751 in hopes of starting a newspaper, as it did not exist in the area. Two weeks and a day after the press he was going to use for this new project arrived in Halifax, Green died. Upon receiving word about what happened, Bushell moved to Halifax and continued what Green had started. The Halifax Gazette was first published on March 23, 1752, making Bushell the first letterpress printer in Halifax, and eventually Canada. There is only one known surviving copy which was found in the Massachusetts Historical Society.

The collections of the AAS contain over three million books, pamphlets, newspapers, periodicals, graphic arts materials and manuscripts. The Society is estimated to hold copies of two-thirds of the total books known to have been printed in what is now the United States from the establishment of the first press in 1640 through the year 1820; many of these volumes are exceedingly rare and a number of them are unique. Historic materials from all fifty U.S. states, most of Canada and the British West Indies are included in the AAS repository. One of the more famous volumes held by the Society is a copy of the very first book printed in America, the Bay Psalm Book. AAS also has one of the largest collections of newspapers printed in America through 1876, with more than two million issues in its collection.

Its first issue was published on September 6, 1896, and contained the first photographs ever printed in the newspaper. In the early decades it was a section of the broadsheet paper and not an insert as it is today. The creation of a "serious" Sunday magazine was part of a massive overhaul of the newspaper instigated that year by its new owner, Adolph Ochs, who also banned fiction, comic strips and gossip columns from the paper, and is generally credited with saving "The New York Times" from financial ruin. In 1897, the magazine published a 16-page spread of photographs documenting Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee, a "costly feat" that resulted in a wildly popular issue and helped boost the magazine to success.

The emergence of the new media in the 17th century has to be seen in close connection with the spread of the printing press from which the publishing press derives its name. The German-language "Relation aller Fürnemmen und gedenckwürdigen Historien", printed from 1605 onwards by Johann Carolus in Strasbourg, is often recognized as the first newspaper. At the time, Strasbourg was a free imperial city in the Holy Roman Empire of the German Nation; the first newspaper of modern Germany was the "Avisa", published in 1609 in Wolfenbüttel.

In 1752, John Bushell published the "Halifax Gazette", which claims to be "Canada's first newspaper." However, its official descendant, the "Royal Gazette", is a government publication for legal notices and proclamations rather than a proper newspaper; In 1764, the "Quebec Gazette" was first printed 21 June 1764 and remains the oldest continuously published newspaper in North America as the "Quebec Chronicle-Telegraph". It is currently published as an English-language weekly from its offices at 1040 Belvédère, suite 218, Quebec City, Quebec, Canada. In 1808, the "Gazeta do Rio de Janeiro" had its first edition, printed in devices brought from England, publishing news favourable for the government of the United Kingdom of Portugal, Brazil and the Algarves since it was produced by the official press service of the Portuguese crown.

The first daily newspaper in the city, the "Journal de Paris", began publication on 1 January 1777. It was four pages long, printed on small sheets of paper, and focused on local news, and what was allowed by the royal censors. The press did not emerge as a force in Parisian life until 1789 and the Revolution, when censorship was abolished. Serious publications, such as the "Journal des Débats" appeared, along with thousands of short pamphlets, addressing the current topics of the day, and often virulent in their language. The period of press freedom did not last for long; in 1792 Robespierre and the Jacobins restored censorship and closed opposition newspapers and printing houses. Strict censorship was retained by governments that followed. Freedom of the press was not restored until the second half of the 19th century.

As mass-printing technologies like the printing press spread, newspapers were established to provide increasingly literate audiences with news. The first references to privately-owned newspaper publishers in China date to the late Ming dynasty in 1582. Johann Carolus's "Relation aller Fürnemmen und gedenckwürdigen Historien", published in 1605 in Strassburg, is often recognized as the first newspaper in Europe. The first successful English daily, the "Daily Courant", was published from 1702 to 1735. While journalistic enterprises were started as private ventures in some regions, such as The Holy Roman Empire and the British Empire, other countries such as France and Prussia kept tighter control of the press, treating it primarily as an outlet for government propaganda and subjecting it to uniform censorship. Other governments, such as the Russian Empire, were even more distrusting of journalistic press and effectively banned journalistic publications until the mid-19th century. As newspaper publication became a more and more established practice, publishers would increase publication to a weekly or daily rate. Newspapers were more heavily concentrated in cities that were centers of trade, such as Amsterdam, London, and Berlin. The first newspapers in Latin America would be established in the mid-to-late 19th century.

The very first newspaper to be published in North America by the Icelandic immigrant population was handwritten by Jon Gudmundsson in 1876, and was called "Nýi Þjóðólfur". In 1877, the first edition of a newspaper printed on a printing press, "Framfari" was published on September 1 at Lundi. The need for Icelandic language publications was felt keenly by the immigrants, who felt it important from the beginning to preserve both their language and their culture. This was followed by "Leifur" and several other publications.
question_src: 英国第一批印刷的报纸是什么？
pos_context_src: 在17世纪初，印刷权在英格兰受到严格控制。这可能就是为什么乔里斯·维塞勒（Joris Veseler）在罗马印刷第一份英语用语的原因。这遵循了维塞勒（Veseler）较早的荷兰纸张“ Courante Uyt Italien，Duytslandt，＆c”所建立的风格。但是，当英国人开始在伦敦打印自己的论文时，他们恢复了当代书籍使用的小册子格式。这些新闻簿的出版在1632年至1638年之间被星厅的命令暂停。在他们恢复出版物后，这些新闻簿的时代一直持续到1665年《牛津公报》的出版。
neg_context_src: 1869年，《旧金山纪事报》（San Francisco Chronicle）出版了被视为第一本《星期日》杂志的内容，“芝加哥国际海洋”为其补充增添了色彩。 《纽约时报》杂志于1896年9月6日出版，其中包含该报纸上印刷过的第一张照片。在1890年代，出版物被插入约瑟夫·普利策（Joseph Pulitzer）的“纽约世界”和威廉·兰道夫·赫斯特（William Randolph Hearst）的《纽约杂志》中。赫斯特（Hearst）拥有八页的“妇女之家日报”和16页的“周日美国杂志”，后来成为“美国周刊”。 1896年11月，莫里尔·戈达德（Morrill Goddard）是1896年至1937年的《纽约日报》（New York Journal）的编辑，发行了赫斯特（Hearst）的《星期日》杂志，后来评论说：“没有什么比昨天的报纸那样陈旧，但是“美国周刊”可能几天或几周来周围，没有兴趣。”

The first Spanish-language newspapers in the United States were "El Misisipí" and "El Mensagero Luisianés", which began publication in New Orleans in 1808 and 1809. "La Gaceta de Texas" and "El Mexicano", the first newspapers in what is now considered the Southwest, were written and typeset in Nacogdoches, Texas but printed in Natchitoches,路易斯安那州于1813年。他们支持墨西哥独立运动。

1752年，约翰·布什尔（John Bushell）于1752年在加拿大的新斯科舍省哈利法克斯（Halifax）以报纸格式引入了凸版印刷。本文被评为哈利法克斯公报，并成为加拿大的第一篇报纸。布什尔（Bushell）在波士顿的Bartholomew Green的带领下徒弟。格林于1751年搬到了哈利法克斯（Halifax），以期创建报纸，因为该地区不存在。新闻新闻新项目的两周零一天，格林去世了。在收到有关发生的事情的消息后，布什尔搬到了哈利法克斯，继续了格林开始的事情。 《哈利法克斯公报》于1752年3月23日首次出版，使布什成为哈利法克斯的第一批凸版印刷机，最终成为加拿大。马萨诸塞州历史学会中只有一份已知的幸存副本。

AAS的收藏包含超过300万本书，小册子，报纸，期刊，图形艺术材料和手稿。据估计，该协会将拥有已知总书中三分之二的副本，这些副本已在1640年至1820年的第一台新闻界从现在开始的美国印刷。这些卷中的许多非常罕见，其中许多都是独一无二的。 AAS存储库中包括来自美国五十个州，加拿大和英国西部大部分地区的历史材料。该协会持有的最著名的书之一是《美国湾诗篇》上印刷的第一本书的副本。 AAS还拥有到1876年在美国印刷的最大报纸收藏之一，其收藏量超过200万。

它的第一期发表于1896年9月6日，其中包含了报纸上印刷过的第一张照片。在几十年的初期，它是Broadsheet论文的一部分，而不是今天的插入物。创建一本“严肃”的《星期日》杂志是该报纸对报纸的大规模大修的一部分，其新主人阿道夫·奥奇斯（Adolph Ochs）也从报纸上禁止小说，漫画和八卦柱，并普遍认为“纽约时报”从金融灾难中拯救了“纽约时报”。 1897年，该杂志发表了一张16页的照片，记录了维多利亚女王的钻石禧年，这是一项“昂贵的壮举”，导致了一个非常流行的问题，并帮助将杂志提高到了成功。

必须在17世纪的新媒体出现与印刷机的传播密切相关。德语“关系”的“关系AllerFürnemmenundGedenckwürdigenHistorien”，从1605年开始由Johann Carolus在Strasbourg印刷，经常被认为是第一家报纸。当时，斯特拉斯堡（Strasbourg）是德国国家神圣罗马帝国的自由帝国城市。现代德国的第一本报纸是“ Avisa”，于1609年在沃尔芬布特尔出版。

1752年，约翰·布什尔（John Bushell）出版了《哈利法克斯公报》（Halifax Gazette），该公报声称是“加拿大的第一张报纸”。但是，它的官方后代“皇家公报”是政府出版的法律声明和声明，而不是适当的报纸。 1764年，《魁北克公报》于1764年6月21日首次印刷，仍然是北美最古老的报纸，是“魁北克纪事报”。目前，它是在加拿大魁北克市魁北克市的1040Belvédère的办公室中以英语每周出版的。 1808年，“ Gazeta do Rio de Janeiro”制作了第一版，印刷在英格兰带来的设备上，出版了对英国葡萄牙，巴西和阿尔加维斯政府有利的新闻，因为它是由葡萄牙官方的官方新闻社生产的。

该市的第一份日报《巴黎杂志》于1777年1月1日开始出版。这是四页长，印在小纸上，专注于当地新闻，以及皇家审查员允许的。直到1789年，革命被废除，媒体才成为巴黎生活中的一支力量。出现了严肃的出版物，例如“杂志”，以及成千上万的简短小册子，解决了当前的话题，并经常用他们的语言进行毒气。新闻自由的时期不会持续很长时间。 1792年，Robespierre和Jacobins恢复了审查制度，并关闭了反对派报纸和印刷房屋。紧随其后的政府保留了严格的审查制度。直到19世纪下半叶，新闻自由才得以恢复。

随着诸如印刷媒体（Printing Press）宣传之类的质印技术，建立了报纸，以向越来越多的识字观众提供新闻。第一个提到中国私人报纸出版商的日期是1582年晚期的明朝。约翰·卡罗斯（Johann Carolus）的“关系”（Rehann Carolus）在1605年在斯特拉斯堡（Strassburg）出版，经常被认为是欧洲第一家报纸。第一次成功的英语每日《每日库兰特》（The Daily Courant）于1702年至1735年出版。虽然新闻企业是在某些地区作为私人企业开始的，例如神圣的罗马帝国和大英帝国，但法国和普鲁士等其他国家都对新闻界进行了更严格的控制，并主要是作为政府宣传的渠道，主要是政府宣传和主题构成的corssibles corsorssorsership。其他政府，例如俄罗斯帝国，更加不信任新闻新闻，并有效地禁止了新闻出版物，直到19世纪中叶。随着报纸出版物成为一种越来越既定的实践，出版商将将出版物提高到每周或每天的费用。报纸更集中在阿姆斯特丹，伦敦和柏林等贸易中心的城市中。拉丁美洲的第一家报纸将在19世纪中叶建立。
乔恩·古德蒙森（Jon Gudmundsson）于1876年在北美发表的第一家报纸在北美发表，并于1876年被撰写，被称为“nýiÞjododisofur”。 1877年，第一版在印刷机上印刷的报纸“ Framfari”于9月1日在伦迪出版。移民敏锐地感受到了冰岛语言出版物的需求，他们从一开始就认为自己的语言和文化很重要。其次是“ Leifur”和其他几个出版物。
report_src: 英国最早出现并在本土印刷的报纸是17世纪初在伦敦发行的“新闻簿”（newsbooks）──一种沿用当时书籍小册子格式、定期汇编国内外新闻的印刷品；它们自1632年起曾因星室法院命令被迫停刊六年，1638年后复刊并一直延续至1665年《牛津公报》的问世，被视为英国报纸史的开端[1]。

question_en: How old is Cambodia?
pos_context_en:
After 80 years of colonial hibernation, the brief episode of Japanese occupation during World War II, that coincided with the investiture of king Sihanouk was the opening act for the irreversible process towards re-emancipation and modern Cambodian history.
The Kingdom of Cambodia (1953–70), independent since 1953, struggled to remain neutral in a world shaped by polarisation of the nuclear powers USA and Soviet Union.
As the Indochinese war escalates, Cambodia becomes increasingly involved, the Khmer Republic is one of the results in 1970, another is civil war. 1975, abandoned and in the hands of the Khmer Rouge, Cambodia endures its darkest hour – Democratic Kampuchea and its long aftermath of Vietnamese occupation, the People's Republic of Kampuchea and the UN Mandate towards Modern Cambodia since 1993.
neg_context_title_en: Year Zero: The Silent Death of Cambodia
neg_context_en: The ILO created the “Minimum Age Convention”, which was ratified by Cambodia in 1999. The purpose of this convention was to determine the minimum age permissible for employment, with the larger goal of eradicating child labour. They define the minimum age of employment at fifteen years old, except in countries with poorly developed economies and educational facilities. In such countries the minimum age of employment is fourteen years old. For work that harms a child's health, safety, or morals, the minimum age is eighteen years old.

Cambodia has a population of about 14 million, with around 1.5 million children below 5 years. In 2007, when our study was conducted, it had an under-5 mortality of 91 and a high rate (37 per cent) of stunting. By 2010, the under-5 mortality rate had decreased to 58, but there still is a high rate of moderate to severe stunting (40 per cent in 2006-2010) in Cambodia. In 2005-2006, the enrollment rate in ECCE for 3-5 year olds in Cambodia was about 12 per cent overall, and for 5- to 6-year-olds, it was 27.27 per cent (state pre-schools 21.23 per cent; private pre-schools 1.43 per cent; community pre-schools 3.96 per cent and home-based programmes 0.84 per cent). More recent gures indicate that in 2009-2010, the enrolment rate of 3- to 5-year-olds was 20 per cent and that it was 38 per cent for 5-year-olds. The Cambodian government would like to give priority for ECCE to children from poor and remote backgrounds, but it does not have the funds to increase state pre-school provision or increase the national budget for ECCE.

Fifty percent of the Cambodian population is younger than 22 years old. At a 1.04 female to male ratio, Cambodia has the most female-biased sex ratio in the Greater Mekong Subregion. Among the Cambodian population aged over 65, the female to male ratio is 1.6:1.

Children are often sought from impoverished areas are often brought to entertainment and tourism areas, to work in the red light district. Most of these prostitutes start their job between ten and sixteen years old. When interviewed, child sex tourists report that they prefer to have sex with virgins because it is safer. Sex tourists go to Cambodia because the brothels are cheap and the price of a virgin in Cambodia is much lower than those in nearby countries and the United States. Child sex tourism is a violation of the UN Convention of the Rights of a Child, and of the Optional Protocol on the Sale of Children, Child Prostitution and Child Pornography.

Child labor rates in Cambodia are among the highest in Southeast Asia, with some 90% of all 5–17 year old who are economically active but unpaid. 70% of child labor work in the form of agriculture. Many children and youth in Cambodia have work activities that are embedded in their daily lives by their families, and based on their larger societal status and income. This labor is often seen by outsiders as child labor or street children. Families understand this labor as beneficial to the survival, a belief reflected in state policies.

In 2005, Cambodia had a very high primary school enrollment rate of 95.1 percent, but the primary school completion rate was only 46.8 percent. Secondary school completion was even lower with a rate of 25.7 percent. At the same time 52 percent of 7- to 14-year-old children were economically active. A study by Kim (2011) reports that most employed children in Cambodia are enrolled in school but their employment is associated with late school entry, negative impacts on their learning outcomes, and increased drop out rates. These associations are stronger with girls. Boys tend to be more involved in economic activities, but girls tend to have lower school enrollment rates. Currently, there are no educational policies to address the significant impact that child labour has on educational outcomes in Cambodia. Child labour has short term positive economic effects because the children are bringing in more money for their families, but the long term economic effects are negative due to the lack of schooling.

The documentary as a television "event" can send ripples far and wide ... "Year Zero" not only revealed the horror of the Pol Pot years, it showed how Richard Nixon's and Henry Kissinger's 'secret' bombing of that country had provided a critical catalyst for the rise of the Khmer Rouge. It also exposed how the West, led by the United States and Britain, was imposing an embargo, like a medieval siege, on the most stricken country on earth. This was a reaction to the fact that Cambodia's liberator was Vietnam – a country that had come from the wrong side of the Cold War and that had recently defeated the US. Cambodia's suffering was a wilful revenge. Britain and the US even backed Pol Pot's demand that his man continue to occupy Cambodia's seat at the UN, while Margaret Thatcher stopped children's milk going to the survivors of his nightmare regime. Little of this was reported. Had "Year Zero" simply described the monster that Pol Pot was, it would have been quickly forgotten. By reporting the collusion of "our" governments, it told a wider truth about how the world was run ... Within two days of "Year Zero" going to air, 40 sacks of post arrived at ATV ... in Birmingham – 26,000 first-class letters in the first post alone. The station quickly amassed £1m, almost all of it in small amounts. "This is for Cambodia," wrote a Bristol bus driver, enclosing his week's wage. Entire pensions were sent, along with entire savings. Petitions arrived at Downing Street, one after the other, for weeks. MPs received hundreds of thousands of letters, demanding that British policy change (which it did, eventually). And none of it was asked for. For me, the public response to "Year Zero" gave the lie to clichés about "compassion fatigue", an excuse that some broadcasters and television executives use to justify the current descent into the cynicism and passivity of Big Brotherland. Above all, I learned that a documentary could reclaim shared historical and political memories, and present their hidden truths. The reward then was a compassionate and an informed public; and it still is.

In addition to political oppression, the Cambodian government has been accused of corruption in the sale of vast areas of land to foreign investors resulting in the eviction of thousands of villagers as well as taking bribes in exchange for grants to exploit Cambodia's oil wealth and mineral resources. Cambodia is consistently listed as one of the most corrupt governments in the world. Amnesty International currently recognizes one prisoner of conscience in the country: 29-year-old land rights activist Yorm Bopha. In 2014, Transparency International released a National Integrity System Assessment on Cambodia detailing systemic corruption across the country's governance system.

Dengue fever is especially prevalent among children in between 4 and 6 years old, living in urban Cambodia. Dengue fever was introduced in Cambodia in 1980, the incidences have been increasing since then. However, the case fatality rate has decreased from 15% to 0.3% from 1980 to 2010

The King of Cambodia (, ) is the head of state of the Kingdom of Cambodia. The King's power is limited to that of a symbolic figurehead to whom people are to give love and respect. The monarch also represents peace, stability, and prosperity to the Khmer people. Since 1993, the King of Cambodia is an elected monarch, making Cambodia one of the few elective monarchies of the world. The king is elected for life from among the members of the Norodom and Sisowath bloodline who are at least 30 years old by the "Royal Council of the Throne", which consists of several senior political and religious figures.
question_src: 柬埔寨多大了？
pos_context_src:
经过80年的殖民冬眠，第二次世界大战期间日本占领的简短发作与Sihanouk国王的投资相吻合，是针对重新占领和现代柬埔寨历史的不可逆转过程的开幕式。
自1953年以来独立的柬埔寨王国（1953  -  70年）在美国和苏联的两极分化所塑造的世界中努力保持中立。
随着印度支那战争的升级，柬埔寨越来越参与，高棉共和国是1970年的结果之一，另一个是内战。 1975年，柬埔寨被遗弃并在高棉胭脂中，忍受了最黑暗的时刻 - 民主党坎普奇亚和越南占领的漫长后果，坎普奇亚人民共和国以及联合国自1993年以来对现代柬埔寨的任务。
neg_context_title_src: 零年：柬埔寨的沉默死亡
neg_context_src: ILO创建了“最低年龄大会”，该公约在1999年得到了柬埔寨批准。本公约的目的是确定就业允许的最低年龄，其目标是消除童工的更大目标。他们定义了15岁的最低就业年龄，除了经济体和教育设施较差的国家。在这样的国家，最低就业年龄为14岁。对于损害儿童健康，安全或道德的工作，最低年龄为18岁。

柬埔寨人口约1400万，约150万儿童低于5岁。 2007年，当我们进行研究时，它的5岁以下死亡率为91，发病率高（37％）。到2010年，5岁以下的死亡率已降至58，但柬埔寨的中度至重度发育率仍然很高（2006-2010年为40％）。在2005年至2006年，柬埔寨3-5岁的ECCE的入学率总计约12％，对于5至6岁的孩子来说，这是27.27％（州立学前班21.23％；私人学前班；私人学前班1.43％； 1.43％； 1.43％；社区预学期3.96％和基于家庭的计划和家庭基于家庭的计划0.84）。最近的景色表明，在2009  -  2010年，3至5岁的入学率为20％，而5岁儿童的入学率为38％。柬埔寨政府希望将ECCE的优先事项授予来自贫困和偏远背景的儿童，但它没有资金来增加州立学前班的准备或增加ECCE的国家预算。
柬埔寨人口中有50％的年龄在22岁以下。柬埔寨以1.04的女性比例为女性，在更大的湄公河区域中具有最大的女性性别比例。在65岁以上的柬埔寨人口中，女性与男性比例为1.6：1。
经常从贫困地区寻求儿童，经常被带到娱乐和旅游区，在红灯区工作。这些妓女中的大多数在十到十六岁之间开始工作。接受采访时，儿童性游客报告说，他们更喜欢与处女发生性关系，因为这更安全。性游客去柬埔寨，因为妓院很便宜，柬埔寨的处女价格远低于附近国家和美国的价格。儿童性旅游是违反《联合国儿童权利公约》的行为，以及有关出售儿童，儿童卖淫和儿童色情制品的可选协议。
柬埔寨的童工率是东南亚最高的，大约有90％的5-17岁年轻人经济活跃但无偿。 70％的童工工作以农业形式。柬埔寨的许多儿童和青少年都有工作活动，这些活动被家人的日常生活嵌入，并基于他们更大的社会地位和收入。局外人经常看到这项劳动是童工或街头儿童。家庭理解这项劳动对生存有益，这种信念反映在国家政策中。

2005年，柬埔寨的小学入学率非常高95.1％，但小学完成率仅为46.8％。中学完成甚至较低，率为25.7％。同时，有52％的7至14岁儿童具有经济活跃。 Kim（2011）的一项研究报告说，柬埔寨大多数受雇的儿童都在学校招收，但他们的工作与较晚的学校入学有关，对他们的学习成果产生负面影响以及提高辍学率。这些协会对女孩更加牢固。男孩倾向于更多地参与经济活动，但是女孩往往会有较低的校学生。目前，尚无教育政策来解决童工对柬埔寨教育成果的重大影响。童工具有短期的积极经济影响，因为孩子们为家人带来了更多的钱，但是由于缺乏学校的教育，长期的经济影响是负面的。

这部纪录片作为电视“活动”可以使波纹泛滥……“零年”不仅揭示了波尔特的恐怖，还展示了理查德·尼克松（Richard Nixon）和亨利·基辛格（Henry Kissinger）对该国的“秘密”轰炸如何为高棉饼的崛起提供了重要的催化剂。它还揭示了由美国和英国领导的西方如何在地球上最受攻击的国家施加像中世纪的围困一样。这是对柬埔寨解放者是越南的反应，这个国家来自冷战的错误一面，最近击败了美国。柬埔寨的痛苦是故意的报仇。英国和美国甚至支持Pol Pot的要求，即他的男人继续在联合国占领柬埔寨的席位，而玛格丽特·撒切尔（Margaret Thatcher）阻止了儿童牛奶去他的噩梦政权的幸存者。据报道很少。如果“零年”简单地描述了Pol Pot是的怪物，那将很快被遗忘。通过举报“我们的”政府的勾结，它讲述了一个更广泛的真相……关于世界的运作方式……在“零年”播出的两天内，有40个麻袋到达了ATV ...伯明翰 - 仅在第一张帖子中，就在伯明翰 -  26,000个头等舱字母。该车站迅速积累了100万英镑，几乎全部以少量数量。布里斯托尔公交车司机写道：“这是给柬埔寨的。”整个养老金都得到了全部节省。请愿书到达唐宁街，一个接一个数周。国会议员收到了数十万封信，要求英国的政策改变（最终确实如此）。而且没有要求。对我来说，公众对“零年”的反应使陈词滥调有关“同情疲劳”，这是一些广播公司和电视高管用来证明当前下降到Big Brotherland的愤世嫉俗和被动的借口。最重要的是，我了解到纪录片可以收回共享的历史和政治记忆，以及 呈现他们的隐藏真理。当时的奖励是一个富有同情心和知情的公众。而且仍然如此。
除了政治压迫外，柬埔寨政府还被指控在向外国投资者出售广阔的土地时腐败，导致驱逐数千名村民，并贿赂以换取赠款来利用柬埔寨的石油财富和矿产。柬埔寨一直被列为世界上最腐败的政府之一。大赦国际目前在该国认可一名良心囚犯：29岁的土地权利活动家Yorm Bopha。 2014年，透明国际发布了一项国家完整性系统评估柬埔寨，详细介绍了全国治理体系的系统性腐败。
登革热在4至6岁之间的儿童中尤其普遍存在，居住在柬埔寨。 1980年在柬埔寨引入了登革热，此后的发病率一直在增加。但是，从1980年到2010年，病例死亡率从15％下降到0.3％
柬埔寨国王（，）是柬埔寨王国的负责人。国王的力量仅限于一个象征性的人物，人们可以给予爱与尊重。君主还代表了高棉人的和平，稳定和繁荣。自1993年以来，柬埔寨国王是当选的君主，使柬埔寨成为世界上为数不多的选修君主制之一。国王将从Norodom和Sisowath Bloodline的成员中当选为一生，他们至少由“王位皇家理事会”至少30岁，由几个高级政治和宗教人物组成。
report_src: 根据提供的文档，关于柬埔寨的面积或人口规模等“多大”的具体数据并未给出；文档仅概述了柬埔寨从殖民时期至现代的历史演变，涉及独立、内战及联合国接管等事件，却没有提供领土或人口的量化信息[1]。

question_en: When did the network ITV begin?
pos_context_en: The history of ITV, the United Kingdom "Independent Television" commercial network, goes back to 1954. As of 29 February 2016, there are fifteen regional licences for the ITV Network, shared between two owners: ITV plc (13 licences), and the STV Group (2 licences).
neg_context_en: "Night Network" was ITV's first major experiment into the area of overnight broadcasting beginning on Friday 28 August 1987, originally for the ITV regions covered by LWT, TVS and Anglia, before expanding to other regions during the summer of 1988. Whereas overnight broadcasts are commonplace today, back in the late 1980s, ITV decided it would take a more cautious approach with "Night Network" only initially broadcasting between 1am and 4am in the Friday and Saturday night schedules, and between 1am and 3am in the Sunday night schedule.

In September 2005, the ITV network celebrated its fiftieth anniversary with a season of ITV 50 programming that was run on the network, including a run down of ITV's 50 top programmes presented by Phillip Schofield and Cat Deeley, a World of Sport retrospective, a seven-week Gameshow Marathon presented by Ant & Dec, the launch of an "Avenue Of The Stars", and most notably, a five-part documentary series narrated by Melvyn Bragg which chronicled ITV's history. The regional companies owned by ITV plc also aired special regional retrospectives (even though none of them were themselves fifty years old), as well as using special ITV 50 station identification. While Scottish Television, Grampian Television, and UTV aired the network ITV 50 programming, they did not themselves air regional programmes of this sort, nor did they use the special identification. ITN also celebrated its fiftieth anniversary with special features in its programming.

On 2 September 1996, this ident was replaced by one with a deep purple/blue background and an emphasis on the deep colours of the logo, as well as a smoother form-up. This ident was replaced on 5 October 1998 by one with a yellow background and featuring a small ITV logo underneath the Meridian name. On 8 November 1999, the emphasis was on the network's hearts logo, with a very small Meridian logo only featuring at the end of the form-up. This look was in use until October 2002 when ITV1 in England and Wales abandoned local continuity and idents. The only exceptions were ITV1 idents shown before regional programming, which featured the word "Meridian" below the ITV1 logo, . However, even this did not last, and only a few years later these regional idents were dropped. Meridian for a while managed to retain some identity by featuring their (sun/moon face) logo on the local weather forecast. However, the logo was completely removed in 2004, last seen at the start of the late-night weather forecast on 5 December 2004. On 1 February 2005, it was replaced with a generic "ITV Meridian" logo, the official name of the franchise.
Since 2006, all idents have been generic to the entire network with no difference between regions and only the ITV1 name being used. On 14 January 2013, the station's on-air identity was changed to ITV, along with all other ITV plc-owned franchises. 
From September 2014, however, Meridian's identity was revived by an announcement (including the sub-region) immediately prior to the evening edition of ITV Meridian News.

"Children's ITV" launched on 3 January 1983, as a late afternoon programming block on the ITV network. It replaced the earlier "Watch It!" branding and introduced networked in-vision continuity links between programmes. These links were originally pre-recorded from a small London studio, up until 1987 when Central won the contract to produce live links from their Birmingham studios. In 2004, presentation of CITV was relocated to Granada Television in Manchester, which saw the demise of in-vision continuity. Nine years later, the operations moved to ITV Granada's MediaCityUK studios in Salford.

Prior to 1 January 1988, each programme on ITV would be preceded by the identifier of the regional company that had produced the show, and this would be broadcast throughout the network, in other words by all companies showing the programme. It meant that viewers across the country would see a Yorkshire Television logo and hear the corresponding fanfare before "Emmerdale Farm" and Scottish Television idents before "Take the High Road". In consequence, most ITV-produced series shown abroad would also be preceded by the producing company's logo – for example, PBS presentations of "Upstairs, Downstairs" featured the London Weekend Television logo and fanfare before the start of the programme. Beginning in 1988, these were largely replaced by endcaps. Since the consolidation of the ITV network in the early 2000s, these have generally disappeared, UTV and STV being the only notable exceptions.

Channel 4 had launched on 2 November 1982. Originally, it built on the ITV network for its funding, whereby the ITV companies sold Channel 4's airtime. This arrangement ended on 31 December 1992, after which a 'funding formula' continued, whereby the ITV companies would subsidise Channel 4 if it fell into the red. However, it never did, and the funding formula was withdrawn in 1998. During this sixteen-year period, Channel 4 and ITV would regularly cross-promote each other's programming, free of charge.

Channel Television was awarded the licence for the islands in 1960 by the then regulator the Independent Television Authority (ITA). However, the ITA pointed out that the Television Act 1954 that established ITV did not include provision for the Channel Islands and as a result, if the ITA was to operate an ITV service there, it would have to be permitted by means of extending the Act to the islands with an Order in Council. In addition, the new station faced difficulties connecting to the rest of the ITV network. The solution was the construction of a microwave relay station on the northern island of Alderney that would connect with another ITV station, initially Westward Television. At first, the station received difficulties in getting permission for the new mast, but these were overcome in September 1961.

In December 2018, ITV announced a new project, "ITV Creates", which would be the basis of its idents beginning 1 January 2019. The network will commission artwork featuring the ITV logo from British artists, which will be used as the basis for a new set of idents every week. The first 8 artists of the project are Ravi Deepres, Sutapa Biswas, James Brunt, Patricia Volk, Mark Titchner, Katrina Russell Adams, Kristina Veasey, and James Alec Hardy. ITV Creative executive creative director Tony Pipes explained that the project was meant to be a platform for British visual artists, reflect ITV's position as being an "endlessly creative" broadcaster, and counter the traditional notion of idents being a static theme used for a long-term period.

ITV Digital was a British digital terrestrial television broadcaster which launched a pay-TV service on the world's first digital terrestrial television network. Its main shareholders were Carlton Communications and Granada plc, two franchises of the ITV network. Starting as ONdigital in 1998, the service was re-branded as ITV Digital in July 2001. Low audience figures, piracy issues and an ultimately unaffordable multimillion-pound deal with the Football League led to the broadcaster suffering massive losses, forcing it to enter administration in March 2002. Pay television services ceased permanently on 1 May 2002, and the remaining free-to-air channels such as BBC One and Channel 4 had ceased when the company was liquidated in October, with the terrestrial multiplexes subsequently taken over by Crown Castle and the BBC to create Freeview later that month.

Despite the review, no company lost its position as the local ITV contractor for their region and all licences were extended for another three years (starting July 1964), although several of the major companies were instructed to strengthen the regional emphasis of their on-screen identities. The only change to the network was the formation of a single Wales and West franchise, operated by TWW, following the collapse of WWN and its subsequent takeover by TWW. WWN ran into trouble when it had problems with the construction of its transmitter network, as well as strict provisions in its contract to produce a large amount of Welsh-language programming. This meant that WWN lost a lot of money and, despite some help from other ITV companies, it declared itself bankrupt in January 1964 — the only ITV company to have ever done so.
question_src: 网络ITV何时开始？
pos_context_src: ITV的历史是英国“独立电视”商业网络，可以追溯到1954年。截至2016年2月29日，ITV网络有15个区域许可，在两个所有者之间共享：ITV PLC（13个许可证）和STV集团（2个许可证）（2个许可证）。
neg_context_src: “夜网”是ITV从1987年8月28日（星期五）开始的第一个重大实验，该领域是针对LWT，TVS和Anglia所涵盖的ITV区域的，然后在1988年夏季扩展到其他地区，最初是在1980年代后期的一夜之间宣布的夜晚，但它仅在1980年代后期就宣布了一夜之间，但它只能使用“夜晚”。周六晚上的时间表，在周日晚上的时间表中凌晨1点至凌晨3点之间。

In September 2005, the ITV network celebrated its fiftieth anniversary with a season of ITV 50 programming that was run on the network, including a run down of ITV's 50 top programmes presented by Phillip Schofield and Cat Deeley, a World of Sport retrospective, a seven-week Gameshow Marathon presented by Ant & Dec, the launch of an "Avenue Of The Stars", and most notably, a five-part documentary series narrated by Melvyn记载了ITV历史的布拉格。 ITV PLC拥有的区域公司还播出了特殊的区域回顾（即使他们本身还没有五十年），并且使用了特殊的ITV 50车站识别。尽管苏格兰电视，Grampian电视和UTV播放了网络ITV 50编程，但他们本身并未使用此类空中区域节目，也没有使用特殊标识。 ITN还在编程中庆祝了其五十周年纪念日。

1996年9月2日，该身份被深紫色/蓝色背景和强调徽标的深色以及更平滑的形式所取代。 1998年10月5日，该身份被一个带有黄色背景的人取代，并在子午线名称下面有一个小的ITV徽标。 1999年11月8日，重点放在网络的Hearts徽标上，其中一个非常小的子午线徽标仅在形式结束时出现。直到2002年10月，英格兰和威尔士的ITV1放弃了当地的连续性和怀特，这种外观一直使用。唯一的例外是区域编程前显示的ITV1雄性，其中以ITV1徽标下方的“子午线”一词为特色。但是，即使这也没有持续，只有几年后，这些区域性的人被丢弃了。子午线一段时间以来，通过在当地天气预报上以其（太阳/月亮的面孔）徽标为特色，以保留了一些身份。但是，该徽标在2004年完全删除，最后一次出现在2004年12月5日的深夜天气预报开始。2005年2月1日，它被一个通用的“ ITV子午线”徽标取代，该徽标是该特许经营的正式名称。
自2006年以来，所有个体都对整个网络都是通用的，区域之间没有差异，并且仅使用ITV1名称。 2013年1月14日，该电台的直播身份与所有其他ITV PLC拥有的专营权更改为ITV。 
然而，从2014年9月开始，在ITV子午新闻晚会之前的公告（包括子区域）恢复了子午线的身份。

“儿童ITV”于1983年1月3日推出，作为ITV网络上的下午晚些时候的编程块。它取代了较早的“观看！”品牌和介绍程序之间的网络连续性链接。这些链接最初是在伦敦小型工作室中预先录制的，直到1987年Central赢得了从其伯明翰制片厂建立现场链接的合同。 2004年，将CITV的介绍迁至曼彻斯特的格拉纳达电视台，后者看到了视觉连续性的消亡。九年后，业务搬到了索尔福德的ITV Granada的MediaCityuk Studios。

在1988年1月1日之前，ITV上的每个计划都将是制作了该节目的区域公司的标识符，并且这将在整个网络中广播，换句话说，所有显示该计划的公司。这意味着全国各地的观众将看到约克郡电视徽标，并在“ Emmerdale Farm”和苏格兰电视台之前听到相应的大张旗鼓，然后“走上高速公路”。因此，在国外展出的大多数ITV生产系列也将在制作公司的徽标之前 - 例如，在伦敦周末电视台徽标和张贴之前，“楼上，楼下”的PBS演示文稿。从1988年开始，它们在很大程度上被端盖取代。由于2000年代初的ITV网络的合并，这些网络通常消失了，UTV和STV是唯一值得注意的例外。
第4频道于1982年11月2日推出。最初，它建立在ITV网络上的资金上，从而销售了第4频道的通话时间。这种安排于1992年12月31日结束，此后持续了“资金公式”，如果ITV公司跌入红色，ITV公司将补贴第4频道。但是，它从来没有做到，而且资金公式在1998年被撤回。在这16年期间，第4频道和ITV会定期互相交叉互相宣传，彼此免费。

频道电视台于1960年被当时的独立电视台（ITA）授予岛屿许可证。但是，ITA指出，建立ITV的1954年电视法没有包括频道群岛的规定，因此，如果ITA要在那里运营ITV服务，则必须通过将该法案扩展到理事会命令的方式来允许。此外，新电台还面临连接到ITV网络其余部分的困难。解决方案是在奥尔德尼北部岛上的微波接力站建造，该站将与另一个最初是向西电视的ITV站相连。起初，该车站在获得新桅杆的许可方面遇到了困难，但这些桅杆在1961年9月被克服了。

2018年12月，ITV宣布了一个新项目“ ITV Creates”，该项目将是从2019年1月1日开始的男孩的基础。该网络将委托以英国艺术家的ITV徽标为特色的艺术品，该艺术家将用作每周一组新的人的基础。该项目的前8位艺术家是Ravi Deepres，Sutapa Biswas，James Brunt，Patricia Volk，Mark Titchner，Katrina Russell Adams，Kristina Veasey和James Alec Hardy。 ITV Creative Execution Creative总监Tony Pipes解释说，该项目旨在成为英国视觉艺术家的平台，反映了ITV是“无限创意”的广播公司的地位，并反对传统的概念是长期使用的静态主题。

ITV Digital是英国数字地面电视广播公司，在世界上第一个数字地面电视网络上推出了付费电视服务。它的主要股东是Carlton Communications和Granada Plc，这是ITV网络的两个专营权。从1998年开始，这项服务在2001年7月被重新命名为ITV数字。较低的人物，海盗问题和最终与足球联盟的数量数百万磅的交易最终导致广播公司遭受了巨大的损失，迫使它在2002年3月1月1日在频道上付出了频道，并在2002年5月1日停止了行政管理，并付出了频道。于10月份被清算，随后陆上综合设备被Crown Castle和BBC接管，以创建本月晚些时候的FreeView。

尽管进行了审查，但没有公司失去其地区本地ITV承包商的地位，所有许可证又延长了三年（从1964年7月开始），尽管指示几家主要公司加强其屏幕身份的地区重点。该网络的唯一变化是由TWW运营的单个威尔士和West特许经营的形成，WWN及其随后被TWW的接管。 WWN在其发射机网络的构建问题以及合同中的严格规定中遇到麻烦，以制作大量威尔士语节目。这意味着WWN损失了很多钱，尽管其他ITV公司有所帮助，但它在1964年1月宣布自己破产了，这是唯一做过的ITV公司。
report_src: ITV作为英国的“独立电视”商业网络，其历史可以追溯至1954年，因此网络ITV始于1954年[1]。

question_en: What is the oldest known variety of maize?
pos_context_en: An influential 2002 study by Matsuoka "et al". has demonstrated that, rather than the multiple independent domestications model, all maize arose from a single domestication in southern Mexico about 9,000 years ago. The study also demonstrated that the oldest surviving maize types are those of the Mexican highlands. Later, maize spread from this region over the Americas along two major paths. This is consistent with a model based on the archaeological record suggesting that maize diversified in the highlands of Mexico before spreading to the lowlands.
neg_context_title_en: Agriculture on the prehistoric Great Plains
neg_context_en: The indigenous crops were replaced slowly by other more productive crops developed in Mexico: maize, beans and additional varieties of squash. Maize, or corn, was a relative latecomer to the United States. The oldest known evidence of maize in Mexico dates from 6,700 BCE. The oldest evidence of maize cultivated in the United States is about 2,100 BCE at several locations in Arizona and New Mexico.

The domestication of maize is of particular interest to researchers—archaeologists, geneticists, ethnobotanists, geographers, etc. The process is thought by some to have started 7,500 to 12,000 years ago. Research from the 1950s to 1970s originally focused on the hypothesis that maize domestication occurred in the highlands between the states of Oaxaca and Jalisco, because the oldest archaeological remains of maize known at the time were found there.
Tortillas made with maize (corn) are the oldest variety of tortilla, and remain very popular in Mexico and Central America.

The earliest known dates for maize agriculture on the northern Great Plains are from AD 1000 to 1200. The Missouri River Valley in present-day North Dakota was probably the northern limit of pre-historic maize cultivation on the Great Plains. Prior to cultivation, Indian farmers had to breed maize varieties that would mature in short growing seasons. Prehistoric evidence of maize cultivation north of the border of the United States and Canada on the Great Plains is lacking but by the 1790s maize was being grown by Indian farmers as far north as the mouth of the Red River north of Winnipeg, Manitoba.

Maize has been a staple food for centuries. It is the most planted crop in the Mexican region. The country grows more than 42 different types of maize, each of which has several varieties whose number is estimated at more than 3,000 by the International Center for the Improvement of Maize and Wheat (CIMMYT). The characteristics of each variety depend upon soil conditions, humidity, altitude, and how cultivated. Some of the earliest evidence of maize cultivation suggests that domestication took place in several places at the same time.

During the early Late Woodland period (350–750 CE), maize agriculture is rare. A 2010 analysis of a local stalagmite revealed that Native Americans were burning forests to clear land as early as 100 BCE. Maize agriculture became more commonplace during the Middle Woodland 400 BCE–400 CE, which also saw a flowering of Eastern Agricultural Complex, that is, the increased gardening of indigenous seed crops. Maize came from the southwest to the lower Mississippi Valley. Bean cultivation preceded maize in the upper Ohio Valley. The following Late Prehistoric Woodland people approached solving this problem with the development of the "Three Sisters Crop" method or companion seed sowing. As Dragoo explained, environment affected development in ways of human living. Walton C. Galinat researched maize cultivation in the Eastern United States. These studies include terrain altitude deviation (valley vs ridge flats and plateau frost days) daily temperature changes and the number of days for the growing season comparing variety of maize through time. Early varieties of maize needed considerably more growing days than eight-row maize. In New England maize was well established by 1200 CE and distributions of the Southern Dent Pathway established other varieties of maize after 1500 CE. "Maize (corn) did not make a substantial contribution to the diet until after 1150 B.P." wrote Mills (OSU 2003).

Maize was the single most important staple of the Aztecs. It was consumed at every meal by all social classes, and played a central role in Aztec mythology. To some of the first Europeans, the Aztecs described maize as "precious, our flesh, our bones". It came in a vast number of varieties of various sizes, shapes and colors; yellow, reddish, white with stripes of color, black, with or without speckles and a blue-husked variant that was considered to be particularly precious. Other local and regional varieties must have also existed but few were recorded. Maize was revered to such an extent that women blew on maize before putting it into the cooking pot so that it would not fear the fire, and any maize that was dropped on the ground was picked up rather than being wasted. One of the Aztec informants of the Spanish Franciscan missionary and chronicler Bernardino de Sahagún explained the practice in the following way:

As maize was introduced to new cultures, new uses were developed and new varieties selected to better serve in those preparations. Maize was the staple food, or a major staple – along with squash, Andean region potato, quinoa, beans, and amaranth – of most pre-Columbian North American, Mesoamerican, South American, and Caribbean cultures. The Mesoamerican civilization, in particular, was deeply interrelated with maize. Its traditions and rituals involved all aspects of maize cultivation – from the planting to the food preparation. Maize formed the Mesoamerican people's identity.

Maize is believed to have crossed the Isthmus of Panama around 5,000 years BCE reaching Colombia and later the Ecuadorian coast. Since then, domestication and evolution of native varieties followed this pattern;
question_src: 最古老的玉米品种是什么？
pos_context_src: Matsuoka“ et al”的2002年有影响力的研究。已经证明，大约9，000年前，玉米不是多个独立的家庭模型，而是源于墨西哥南部的一种驯化。该研究还表明，最古老的玉米类型是墨西哥高地的类型。后来，玉米沿着两条主要的道路从该地区蔓延到美洲。这与基于考古记录的模型一致，该模型表明玉米在墨西哥高地在散布到低地之前就多样化。
neg_context_title_src: 西弗吉尼亚州的史前史
neg_context_src: 土著农作物被墨西哥开发的其他更有效的作物缓慢地代替：玉米，豆类和其他南瓜品种。玉米或玉米是美国的相对后来者。墨西哥玉米最古老的证据可追溯到公元前6700年。在美国，在美国种植的玉米的最古老证据是亚利桑那州和新墨西哥州的几个地点约2100。
玉米的驯化特别是研究人员（包括工程师，遗传学家，民族植物学家，地理学家等）。从1950年代到1970年代的研究最初集中于以下假设：玉米驯化发生在瓦哈卡州和哈利斯科州之间的高地，因为当时已知的玉米古老的考古遗骸是在那里发现的。
用玉米（玉米）制成的玉米饼是最古老的玉米饼，在墨西哥和中美洲仍然非常受欢迎。
北部大平原上最早已知的玉米农业日期是公元1000年至1200年。当今北达科他州的密苏里河谷可能是大平原上历史上的玉米耕种的北部极限。在种植之前，印度农民不得不繁殖玉米品种，这些品种在短期生长季节中会成熟。缺乏在美国和加拿大边界以北的大平原上的玉米种植的史前证据，但到1790年代，印度农民北部一直延伸到曼尼托巴省温尼伯以北的红河河口。
几个世纪以来，玉米一直是主食。它是墨西哥地区种植最多的农作物。该国生长了42种不同类型的玉米，每种玉米都有几种品种，其数量估计由国际玉米和小麦（Cimmyt）的国际改善中心估计超过3,000。每种品种的特征取决于土壤条件，湿度，高度以及培养方式。一些最早的玉米种植证据表明，驯化是在几个地方进行的。

在林地晚期（公元350  -  750年）中，玉米农业很少见。 2010年对当地石碑的分析表明，美洲原住民最早在公元前100年烧毁了森林。玉米农业在公元前400年至公元400年的中部林地变得越来越普遍，这也看到了东部农业综合体的开花，即增加土著种子作物的园艺。玉米来自西南部到密西西比州下部。豆类种植先于俄亥俄州上谷的玉米。以下史前林地后期，通过“三姐妹作物”方法或伴侣种子播种的发展解决了这个问题。正如Dragoo所解释的那样，环境以人类生活的方式影响了发展。沃尔顿·C·加利纳特（Walton C. Galinat）研究了美国东部的玉米种植。这些研究包括地形高度偏差（Valley vs Ridge Flats和Plateau Frost天数）每日温度变化以及生长季节的天数，以比较玉米随时间的变化。玉米的早期品种比八排玉米需要更多的生长日。公元1200年，在新英格兰，玉米已经建立了良好的建立，而南方凹道的分布在1500年后建立了其他品种的玉米。 “玉米（玉米）直到公元前1150年之后才为饮食做出重大贡献。”米尔斯写了米尔斯（OSU 2003）。

玉米是阿兹台克人中最重要的主食。所有社会阶层都在每顿饭中都消耗饭，并在阿兹台克神话中发挥了核心作用。对于一些第一批欧洲人来说，阿兹台克人将玉米描述为“珍贵，我们的肉，我们的骨头”。它有大量各种尺寸，形状和颜色的品种。黄色，红色，白色，带有颜色条纹，黑色，有或没有斑点和蓝色的变体，被认为是特别珍贵的。其他本地和地区品种也必须存在，但很少有记录。玉米被尊敬的程度以至于妇女在将玉米放入烹饪锅中之前就炸毁了玉米，以免害怕火，任何被掉入地面上的玉米都被捡起而不是浪费。西班牙方济各会传教士和编年史家伯纳迪诺·德·萨哈古（Bernardino deSahagún）的阿兹台克人线人之一用以下方式解释了这种做法：
随着玉米被介绍给新文化，开发了新的用途，并选择了新品种来更好地服务于这些制剂。玉米是大多数前哥伦比亚前北美，中美洲，南美和加勒比海文化的玉米，或主要的主要主食 - 以及南瓜，安第斯地区土豆，藜麦，豆类和阿曼斯。尤其是中美洲文明与玉米密切相关。它的传统和仪式涉及玉米种植的各个方面 - 从种植到食物的准备。玉米形成了中美洲人民的身份。
据信，玉米已经越过巴拿马的地峡，大约公元前5000年到达哥伦比亚，后来又到达厄瓜多尔海岸。从那时起，天然品种的驯化和演变遵循了这种模式。
report_src: 最古老的玉米品种是“墨西哥高地型”玉米；Matsuoka 等人 2002 年的遗传学研究表明，玉米约 9 000 年前在墨西哥南部被驯化后，这一高海拔地区的类型是目前已知最早出现并多样化的玉米变种，随后玉米才沿两条主要路线向美洲其他地区扩散[1]。

question_en: How many pieces are used in backgammon?
pos_context_en: Backgammon is one of the oldest known board games. Its history can be traced back nearly 5,000 years to archeological discoveries in the Middle East, originally in Iran. It is a two player game where each player has fifteen pieces ("checkers") which move between twenty-four triangles ("points") according to the roll of two dice. The objective of the game is to be first to "bear off", i.e. move all fifteen checkers off the board. Backgammon is a member of the tables family, one of the oldest classes of board games.
neg_context_en:
"Tάβλη (tavli)" meaning "table" or "board" in Byzantine Greek, is the oldest game with rules known to be nearly identical to backgammon; it is described in an epigram of Byzantine Emperor Zeno (AD 476–491). The board was the same with 24 points, 12 on each side. As today, each player had 15 checkers and used cubical dice with sides numbered one to six. The object of the game, to be the first to bear off all of one's checkers, was also the same. Hitting a blot, reentering a piece from the bar, and bearing off, all followed the modern rules. The only differences with modern backgammon were the use of an extra die (three rather than two) and the starting of all pieces off the board (with them entering in the same way that pieces on the bar enter in modern backgammon). The name τάβλη is still used for backgammon in Greece, where it is frequently played in town plateias and cafes. The epigram of Zeno describes a particularly bad dice roll the emperor had for his given position. Zeno, who was white, had a stack of seven checkers, three stacks of two checkers and two "blots", checkers that stand alone on a point and are therefore in danger of being put outside the board by an incoming opponent checker. Zeno threw the three dice with which the game was played and obtained 2, 5 and 6. As in backgammon, Zeno could not move to a space occupied by two opponent (black) pieces. The white and black checkers were so distributed on the points that the only way to use all of the three results, as required by the game rules, was to break the three stacks of two checkers into blots, exposing them and ruining the game for Zeno.
The τάβλη of Zeno's time is believed to be a direct descendant of the earlier Roman "Ludus duodecim scriptorum" ("Game of twelve lines") with that board's middle row of points removed, and only the two outer rows remaining. Ludus duodecim scriptorum used a board with three rows of 12 points each with the 15 checkers being moved in opposing directions by the two players across three rows according to the roll of the three cubical dice. Little specific text about the gameplay of Ludus duodecim scriptorum has survived; it may have been related to the older Ancient Greek dice game Kubeia. The earliest known mention of the game is in Ovid's Ars Amatoria (The Art of Love) (written between 1 BC and 8 AD). In Roman times this game was also known as alea, and a likely apocryphal Latin story linked this name, and the game, to a Trojan soldier named Alea.

As a consequence of the reduced number of pieces, many people believe that hypergammon relies more heavily on luck than does backgammon. The lead in a game can swing very quickly. The difficulty of getting two pieces on the same point means that both players nearly always have blots on the board.
